analyzed: de'i rgyan tshig le'ur byas pa dang / kun gyi rgyan du 'gyur bar ni //

analyzed: 'phags pa thogs med skyob nyid kyis //

original: mi pham mgon la gsan nas ni //
analyzed: mi pham mgon la gsan nas ni //
translated: Having heard from Ajita, the protector,

analyzed: bstan bcos chen po'i rnam bshad mdzad //

original: 'gro don rtsa lag dbyig gi gnyen //
analyzed: 'gro don rtsa lag dbyig gi gnyen //

original: rang gi mos pa gtsor byed pas //
analyzed: rang gi mos pa gtsor byed pas //
translated: Primarily through his own interest,

original: shes bya nang gi yin pa la //
analyzed: shes bya nang gi yin pa la //
translated: The knowable is internal.

original: yang dag rten nas rnam par bkrol //🔽'phags pa'i khongs su gtogs pa yi //
analyzed: yang dag rten nas rnam par bkrol // 'phags pa'i khongs su gtogs pa yi //
translated: It is revealed through the perfect support.

original: rnam par grol ba zhes byas kyang //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba zhes byas kyang //
translated: It is called “liberation”🔽Because it belongs to the category of the āryas.

original: des byas byas pa min mthong nas //
analyzed: des byas byas pa min mthong nas //
translated: Seeing that it is not created by that,

original: dbu mar gnas pa'i blos rnam phye //
analyzed: dbu mar gnas pa'i blos rnam phye //
translated: The mind that abides in the middle discerns.

original: de yi 'og tu rnam grol sde //
analyzed: de yi 'og tu rnam grol sde //
translated: After that, the Saṃmatīyas,

original: dad pa'i sa la gnas pa yis //
analyzed: dad pa'i sa la gnas pa yis //
translated: Who abide on the level of faith,

original: bstan bcos mtha' dag ma rnyed par //
analyzed: bstan bcos mtha' dag ma rnyed par //
translated: Did not find the entire treatise

original: rang dang rjes mthun rnam bshad byas //
analyzed: rang dang rjes mthun rnam bshad byas //
translated: And explained it according to their own understanding.

original: de ltar mkhas pas snang byas shing //
analyzed: de ltar mkhas pas snang byas shing //
translated: Thus, the learned ones made it appear

original: 'ga' zhig kho nas ma rnyed pa'i //🔽bstan bcos mtha' dag 'di de ltar //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig kho nas ma rnyed pa'i // bstan bcos mtha' dag 'di de ltar //
translated: As if they had not found it at all.🔽The entire treatise was found

original: rnyed pa gang de ya mtshan no //🔽de ltas shin tu rnyed dka' ba //
analyzed: rnyed pa gang de ya mtshan no // de ltas shin tu rnyed dka' ba //
translated: In that way, and that is amazing.🔽Therefore, this profound path,

original: zab mo'i lam 'di ci zhig ltar //
analyzed: zab mo'i lam 'di ci zhig ltar //
translated: Which is difficult to find,

original: sangs rgyas dbang gis rnyed pa ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dbang gis rnyed pa ni //
translated: Was found by the power of the Buddha.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis dbye ba'i rigs //🔽rnam pa kun du bdag gi ni //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis dbye ba'i rigs //🔽rnam pa kun du bdag gi ni //
translated: The wise ones should discern it.

original: spyod yul min yang bsod nams dag / bsgrub dang mthun phyir rang gzhan la //
analyzed: spyod yul min yang bsod nams dag / bsgrub dang mthun phyir rang gzhan la //
translated: Even though it is not the proper domain,🔽one should generate enthusiasm, wishing to benefit oneself and others,

original: phan gdags 'dod pas spro ba skyes //
analyzed: phan gdags 'dod pas spro ba skyes //
translated: in order to accomplish merit and to be in accord with the practice.

original: 'phags pa byams pa rang nyid dam pa'i spyod pa dang mthun par rab tu ston pas /
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pa rang nyid dam pa'i spyod pa dang mthun par rab tu ston pas /
translated: The noble Maitreya himself, in accord with the practice of the holy ones,

original: so so rang gi rig pa'i ye shes kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yul can gyi rab tu dang ba ni legs pa thams cad 'thob pa'i rgyu'i gtso bo yin no zhes bya bar nges par bzung nas /🔽gzhan dag bcom ldan 'das ma yon tan rin @79a * //
analyzed: so so rang gi rig pa'i ye shes kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yul can gyi rab tu dang ba ni legs pa thams cad 'thob pa'i rgyu'i gtso bo yin no zhes bya bar nges par bzung nas / gzhan dag bcom ldan 'das ma yon tan rin @79a * //
translated: teaches that the faith which is the object of the perfection of wisdom, and which is the intuition attained in the realization of the Dharma by the saints, is the principal cause for attaining all that is good.🔽Having thus ascertained this,

original: po che phul du dbyung du med cing dpag tu med pa'i 'byung gnas la don gyis 'jug par bya ba'i phyir rab tu dang ba bskyed pa'i ched du /
analyzed: po che phul du dbyung du med cing dpag tu med pa'i 'byung gnas la don gyis 'jug par bya ba'i phyir rab tu dang ba bskyed pa'i ched du /
translated: in order to generate faith in others, so that they may enter into the meaning of the Blessed Lady, the inexhaustible and immeasurable source of jewels of good qualities,

original: re zhig dang por yum la yon tan ji lta ba bzhin du brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi phyag 'tshal ba //
analyzed: re zhig dang por yum la yon tan ji lta ba bzhin du brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi phyag 'tshal ba //
translated: he first pays homage to the Mother, preceded by a statement of her good qualities.

original: nyan thos zhi ba tshol rnams kun shes nyid kyis nyer zhir khrid mdzad gang yin dang // 'gro la phan par byed rnams lam shes nyid kyis 'jig rten don sgrub mdzad pa gang //
analyzed: nyan thos zhi ba tshol rnams kun shes nyid kyis nyer zhir khrid mdzad gang yin dang // 'gro la phan par byed rnams lam shes nyid kyis 'jig rten don sgrub mdzad pa gang //
translated: The Sravakas who seek peace are led to peace by the knowledge of all things; those who work for the benefit of the world accomplish the aims of the world by the knowledge of the path.

original: gang dang yang dag ldan pas thub rnams rnam pa kun ldan sna tshogs 'di gsungs pa //
analyzed: gang dang yang dag ldan pas thub rnams rnam pa kun ldan sna tshogs 'di gsungs pa //
translated: The Buddhas, endowed with these, have taught this Dharma which is endowed with the best of all perfections.

original: nyan thos byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs bcas sangs rgyas kyi ni yum de la phyag 'tshal //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: nyan thos byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs bcas sangs rgyas kyi ni yum de la phyag 'tshal // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: I pay homage to the Mother of the Buddhas, together with the hosts of Sravakas and Bodhisattvas.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni 'di'i che ba'i bdag nyid phul du byung ba dang ldan pa brjod de /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni 'di'i che ba'i bdag nyid phul du byung ba dang ldan pa brjod de /
translated: This verse expresses the excellence of its greatness.

original: de thos nas re zhig dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams ni 'di la the tshom med par myur du rab tu dad pa skye'o //
analyzed: de thos nas re zhig dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams ni 'di la the tshom med par myur du rab tu dad pa skye'o //
translated: Having heard this, those who are followers through faith will quickly and without doubt generate faith in it.

original: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyang gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshad mas gzhi dang lam dang rnam pa skye ba med par yongs su shes pa tshigs su bcad pa'i don gyi mtshan nyid kyi yum
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyang gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshad mas gzhi dang lam dang rnam pa skye ba med par yongs su shes pa tshigs su bcad pa'i don gyi mtshan nyid kyi yum
translated: And those who follow the Dharma, due to being free from a nature of one or many, and so on, see no contradiction in the valid cognition that thoroughly knows the basis, path, and aspects as nonarising, the meaning of the verses of the Mother

original: la gnod pa ma mthong nas /
analyzed: la gnod pa ma mthong nas /
translated: Since he did not see any harm in it,🔽

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi bdag nyid tshul gsum pa can /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi bdag nyid tshul gsum pa can /
translated: Therefore, the perfection of wisdom, which has the nature of the three exalted knowers, which has the three modes,

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa bskrun par mdzad pa ni gdon mi za bar srid pa nyid de zhes nges par gzung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa bskrun par mdzad pa ni gdon mi za bar srid pa nyid de zhes nges par gzung ste /
translated: and which produces the buddhas and so on, is definitely without a doubt.

original: de la rab tu dang ba skyed par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la rab tu dang ba skyed par byed pa nyid do //
translated: It is the very existence of that which generates faith.

original: de la rab tu dang bas kyang de'i yon tan mngon par 'dod pa'i gang zag gnyis ka yang de dang de la brten pa'i gsung rab la rnam pa thams cad du gzung ba la sogs pa'i don du shin tu gus par byed do //
analyzed: de la rab tu dang bas kyang de'i yon tan mngon par 'dod pa'i gang zag gnyis ka yang de dang de la brten pa'i gsung rab la rnam pa thams cad du gzung ba la sogs pa'i don du shin tu gus par byed do //
translated: and with faith in that, both persons who desire its qualities will be extremely respectful toward the scriptures that are based on that, in every way, for the sake of comprehending them and so forth.

original: de nas thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i shes pa skye ba'i rim gyis legs pa'i mchog 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i shes pa skye ba'i rim gyis legs pa'i mchog 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, through the process of the arising of the knowledge that comes from listening and so forth, they will attain the supreme good.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ma la rab tu dang / ba ni legs pa thams cad 'thob pa'i rgyu'i gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ma la rab tu dang / ba ni legs pa thams cad 'thob pa'i rgyu'i gtso bo yin no //
translated: Therefore, faith in the Bhagavatī is the primary cause for attaining all that is good.

original: de la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyis ni don brgyad bsdus la de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin zhing des kyang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis don thams cad phun sum tshogs pa yin no zhes de ltar thugs @79b la bzhag
analyzed: de la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyis ni don brgyad bsdus la de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin zhing des kyang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis don thams cad phun sum tshogs pa yin no zhes de ltar thugs @79b la bzhag
translated: With regard to that, the three omnisciences include the eight topics, and they are the perfection of wisdom, and by that, all topics are perfected in the manner that will be explained.

original: nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bstod do //
analyzed: nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bstod do //
translated: He praises the perfection of wisdom from the point of view of the three knowledges.

original: nyan thos dang de'i phyogs su bslan pa rnam par thar pa cung zad tsam zhig gis lhag pa rim pa gcig gis bstan pa rang sangs rgyas kyang ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang de'i phyogs su bslan pa rnam par thar pa cung zad tsam zhig gis lhag pa rim pa gcig gis bstan pa rang sangs rgyas kyang ste /
translated: The listeners and those who are similar to them, who are superior by a mere fraction, are taught in one stage.

original: mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod pa rnams gzhi thams cad skye ba med par yongs su shes pa nyid kyis phung po dang bcas pa dang phung po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis thob par mdzad pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod pa rnams gzhi thams cad skye ba med par yongs su shes pa nyid kyis phung po dang bcas pa dang phung po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis thob par mdzad pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: The solitary realizers, who aspire to nirvana, are caused to attain the two kinds of nirvana, with and without remainder, by their complete knowledge that all phenomena are unborn.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba ji srid bar 'gro ba'i don byed pa rnams lam thams cad skye ba med par rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'gro ba mtha' dag gi don sgrub par mdzad pa gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad skye ba med par thugs su chud pa gang dang ldan na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba ji srid bar 'gro ba'i don byed pa rnams lam thams cad skye ba med par rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'gro ba mtha' dag gi don sgrub par mdzad pa gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad skye ba med par thugs su chud pa gang dang ldan na /
translated: The bodhisattvas who work for the sake of beings for as long as samsara lasts accomplish the welfare of the whole world by means of the very essence of their realization that all paths are unborn.

original: sangs rgyas yang dag par bsdams pa'i sku can rnal 'byor can gyi dbang phyug gi gtso bo rnams spyod pa'i gnyen por chos kyi 'khor lo ma lus pa rnam pa thams cad bskor bar mdzad pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas yang dag par bsdams pa'i sku can rnal 'byor can gyi dbang phyug gi gtso bo rnams spyod pa'i gnyen por chos kyi 'khor lo ma lus pa rnam pa thams cad bskor bar mdzad pa /
translated: And those who have realized that all aspects are unborn turn the wheel of Dharma in all its aspects as the antidote to the conduct of the lords of yoga, the buddhas who possess the body of perfect rapture.

original: sangs rgyas nyan thos la sogs pas yongs su bskor ba de sgrub par byed pa nyid kyi yul de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyan thos la sogs pas yongs su bskor ba de sgrub par byed pa nyid kyi yul de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to that very object of attainment, surrounded by the buddhas' shravakas and so forth.

original: de ltar phyag 'tshal ba dang bstod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gzhi dang gnyen po dang rnam pa rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig bsdus pa mdzad nas /
analyzed: de ltar phyag 'tshal ba dang bstod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gzhi dang gnyen po dang rnam pa rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig bsdus pa mdzad nas /
translated: Thus, having made homage and praise preliminary, he composes the treatise Ornament of Clear Realization, which includes any of the bases, antidotes, and aspects.

original: phyogs dang po ltar na ni 'bad pa don med pa yin te /
analyzed: phyogs dang po ltar na ni 'bad pa don med pa yin te /
translated: If it is the first case, then the effort is pointless,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las ni mtshan nyid kyi bstan bcos dag las mi smos pa'i gzhi gang yin pa de 'byung ba ni med do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las ni mtshan nyid kyi bstan bcos dag las mi smos pa'i gzhi gang yin pa de 'byung ba ni med do //
translated: because in this perfection of wisdom there is nothing that is not mentioned in the treatises on the characteristics.

original: gnyis pa ltar na yang rnam par byang ba'i dngos po bsdus pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos po ma bsdus pas 'di gang gi gnyen po yin pa khong du chud par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa ltar na yang rnam par byang ba'i dngos po bsdus pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos po ma bsdus pas 'di gang gi gnyen po yin pa khong du chud par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the second case, then because the purified things are included, the defiled things are not included, so it is not understood what its antidote is.

original: gsum pa ltar na yang rnam pa gzhi med pa tsam zhig bsdus pa'i phyir don rtogs pa med pas /
analyzed: gsum pa ltar na yang rnam pa gzhi med pa tsam zhig bsdus pa'i phyir don rtogs pa med pas /
translated: If it is the third case, then because only the aspects are included without a basis, the meaning is not understood.

original: cung zad kyang ma bshad pa'i phyir don med pa yin no snyam du gzhan dag sems par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: cung zad kyang ma bshad pa'i phyir don med pa yin no snyam du gzhan dag sems par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But won't others think that it is meaningless because it does not explain anything at all?

original: de ni ma yin te /🔽gang gi phyir nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis go rims ji lta ba bzhin thams cad mkhyen @80a * //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / gang gi phyir nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis go rims ji lta ba bzhin thams cad mkhyen @80a * //
translated: This is not so,🔽because the three types of clear realization of the three omnisciences of sriivakas, pratyekabuddhas, and unsurpassed buddhas include all clear realizations in order.

original: pa nyid gsum gyis mngon par rtogs pa mtha' dag bsdus pas na phyogs gsum car gyis kyang bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa nyid gsum gyis mngon par rtogs pa mtha' dag bsdus pas na phyogs gsum car gyis kyang bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, all three topics include all clear realizations.🔽Thus the middle Mother of the Conquerors says,

original: 'di ltar rgyal ba'i yum bar ma las rab 'byor thams cad shes pa nyid ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyal ba'i yum bar ma las rab 'byor thams cad shes pa nyid ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi yin no //
translated: Subhuti, the knowledge of all bases is that of sriivakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: lam shes pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: lam shes pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yin no //
translated: The knowledge of paths is that of bodhisattvas.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yin no //
translated: The knowledge of all modes is that of the Tathagata, the Arhat, the fully enlightened Buddha.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du thams cad 'tshal ba nyid nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du thams cad 'tshal ba nyid nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi lags /
translated: “Lord, why is the knowledge of all modes the knowledge of all modes of the Tathagata, the Arhat, the fully enlightened Buddha, and not that of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas?”

original: rab 'byor thams cad ni phyi dang nang gi chos rnams ji snyed pa 'di tsam yin la /
analyzed: rab 'byor thams cad ni phyi dang nang gi chos rnams ji snyed pa 'di tsam yin la /
translated: “Subhuti, all is just this much, namely the internal and external dharmas.

original: de dag kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis shes kyi /
analyzed: de dag kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis shes kyi /
translated: The Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas know them,

original: lam thams cad kyis kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: lam thams cad kyis kyang ma yin la /
translated: but not by all the modes,

original: rnam pa thams cad du yang ma yin pas de'i phyir nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni thams cad shes pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du yang ma yin pas de'i phyir nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni thams cad shes pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: and not by all the paths. Therefore it is called the knowledge of all modes of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du lam gyi rnam pa 'tshal ba nyid byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du lam gyi rnam pa 'tshal ba nyid byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lags /
translated: “Lord, why is the knowledge of the modes of the path the knowledge of the Bodhisattvas?”

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni nyan thos kyi lam gang yin pa dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gang yin pa dang sangs rgyas kyi lam gang yin pa'i lam thams cad bskyed par bya zhing lam thams cad shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni nyan thos kyi lam gang yin pa dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gang yin pa dang sangs rgyas kyi lam gang yin pa'i lam thams cad bskyed par bya zhing lam thams cad shes par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattvas should generate all paths—whatever paths there are of śrāvakas, whatever paths there are of pratyekabuddhas, and whatever paths there are of buddhas—and they should know all paths.

original: de dag kyang yongs su rdzogs par bya zhing de dag gis lam gyi bya ba yang bya la /
analyzed: de dag kyang yongs su rdzogs par bya zhing de dag gis lam gyi bya ba yang bya la /
translated: They should also complete them and perform the activity of the paths with them.

original: smon lam yongs su rdzogs par ma byas pa dang sems can rnams yongs su smin par ma byas pa dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su ma sbyangs par de dag gis yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: smon lam yongs su rdzogs par ma byas pa dang sems can rnams yongs su smin par ma byas pa dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su ma sbyangs par de dag gis yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du ni mi bya'o //
translated: But they should not actualize the very limit of reality without completing their aspirations, without bringing beings to maturity, and without purifying a buddhafield.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid cas bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid cas bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the knowledge of path aspects of bodhisattvas.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du rnam pa tham cad mkhyen pa nyid de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lags /🔽rab 'byor rnam pa gang dag dang rtags gang dag dang mtshan ma gang dag gis chos rnams rab tu brjod pa'i rnam pa de dag dang rtags de dag dang mtshan ma de dag de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud de de'i phyir de @80b bzhin gshegs pa dgra
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du rnam pa tham cad mkhyen pa nyid de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lags / rab 'byor rnam pa gang dag dang rtags gang dag dang mtshan ma gang dag gis chos rnams rab tu brjod pa'i rnam pa de dag dang rtags de dag dang mtshan ma de dag de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud de de'i phyir de @80b bzhin gshegs pa dgra
translated: Bhagavan, why is it called the knowledge of all aspects, the Tathagata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One?

original: bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya'o //🔽de bzhin du mdor bsdus pa las kyang nyan thos kyi sa la slob par 'dod pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs la /
analyzed: bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya'o // de bzhin du mdor bsdus pa las kyang nyan thos kyi sa la slob par 'dod pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs la /
translated: Subhuti, the Tathagata has understood those aspects, those tokens, those signs by which dharmas are expressed, and therefore it is called the Tathagata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One's knowledge of all aspects.

original: rgyas pa las kyang rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyas pa las kyang rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: Similarly, in the Condensed Perfection of Wisdom Sutra it says, Even those who wish to train in the level of the Shravakas, and so on, and it is also stated extensively in the extensive version.

original: de la thams cad shes pa nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rten can 'bras bu bdag tu rmongs pa spangs pa can yin no //
analyzed: de la thams cad shes pa nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rten can 'bras bu bdag tu rmongs pa spangs pa can yin no //
translated: The knowledge of all modes has as its basis the impermanence, etc. of the dharmas such as form, etc. and its result is the abandonment of the delusion of self in regard to the effect.

original: lam shes pa nyid ni theg pa thams cad kyis nges par 'byung ba dang / de kho na nyid mngon sum du mi byed pa'i rten can 'bras bu sems can ma bsdus pa sdud pa la sogs par byed pa can yin no //
analyzed: lam shes pa nyid ni theg pa thams cad kyis nges par 'byung ba dang / de kho na nyid mngon sum du mi byed pa'i rten can 'bras bu sems can ma bsdus pa sdud pa la sogs par byed pa can yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the path has as its basis the going forth of all vehicles and the non-realization of suchness, and its result is the performance of the gathering of those not gathered, etc. of sentient beings.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i rten can /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i rten can /
translated: The knowledge of all modes has as its basis the non-production of all dharmas,

original: 'bras bu nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs par sems can gyi don rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / yang dag pa nyid kyi mtha' rtogs pa dang / bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba nyid spangs pa can yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs par sems can gyi don rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / yang dag pa nyid kyi mtha' rtogs pa dang / bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba nyid spangs pa can yin no //
translated: and its result is the uninterrupted benefit of sentient beings reaching to the end of space, the realization of the limit of reality, and the abandonment of the latent tendencies.

original: de lta bas na mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan ni gzhi dang gnyen po dang rnam pa thams cad bsdus pas mngon par rtogs pa ril rdzogs par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan ni gzhi dang gnyen po dang rnam pa thams cad bsdus pas mngon par rtogs pa ril rdzogs par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the Ornament of Clear Realization teaches the entire clear realization by including all the bases, antidotes, and aspects.

original: zhes bya ba 'di 'thad pa yin no //🔽skye bo blo gros dman pa dag bcom ldan 'das rgyas pa dang 'bring dang mdor bsdus pa la dad pa'i sems can la phan 'dogs par bzhed pa thugs rje can nyid kyis rgyal ba'i yum de dang de las mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi rim pa shes rab
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di 'thad pa yin no // skye bo blo gros dman pa dag bcom ldan 'das rgyas pa dang 'bring dang mdor bsdus pa la dad pa'i sems can la phan 'dogs par bzhed pa thugs rje can nyid kyis rgyal ba'i yum de dang de las mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi rim pa shes rab
translated: This is tenable.

original: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don mtha' dag gsal bar mdzad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don mtha' dag gsal bar mdzad pa ma yin nam /
translated: Didn’t the compassionate one, who wishes to benefit sentient beings with faith in the extensive, medium, and brief teachings of the Bhagavatī, clearly explain the entire meaning of the perfection of wisdom in this and that sūtra of the mother of the victors in the stages of the eight clear realizations?🔽What is the point of teaching it again in the Bhagavatī’s Ornament of Clear Realization?

original: bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa ma rgyal ba las rgyal bas yang de bstan pa la don ci zhig yod snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa ma rgyal ba las rgyal bas yang de bstan pa la don ci zhig yod snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel the qualm that arises in the mind of someone of low intelligence,

original: don la the tshom bskyed pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i yan lag rang gi bstan bcos kyi brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa dang dgos pa'i yang dgos pa dang 'brel pa khong na yod pa rnams gsungs te /
analyzed: don la the tshom bskyed pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i yan lag rang gi bstan bcos kyi brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa dang dgos pa'i yang dgos pa dang 'brel pa khong na yod pa rnams gsungs te /
translated: The purpose of the treatise is to generate doubt about the meaning, and the connection is the statement of the subject matter of one's treatise, the purpose, and the purpose of the purpose, which are contained within.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen nyid lam //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen nyid lam //
translated: The path to omniscience

original: ston pas 'di la bshad pa gang //
analyzed: ston pas 'di la bshad pa gang //
translated: is taught by the Teacher.

original: gzhan gyis myong ba ma yin te //
analyzed: gzhan gyis myong ba ma yin te //
translated: It is not experienced by others.

original: chos spyod bcu yi bdag nyid kyi //
analyzed: chos spyod bcu yi bdag nyid kyi //
translated: It is the nature of the ten Dharma practices.

original: mdo don dran pa la bzhag nas //
analyzed: mdo don dran pa la bzhag nas //
translated: Having placed the meaning of the sutra in memory,

original: @81a * // blo dang ldan pas mthong 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: @81a * // blo dang ldan pas mthong 'gyur phyir //
translated: the wise one sees it.🔽Therefore, it is called

original: bde blag tu ni rtogs pa zhes //🔽bya ba rtsom pa'i dgos pa yin //
analyzed: bde blag tu ni rtogs pa zhes // bya ba rtsom pa'i dgos pa yin //
translated: easily understood.

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is the purpose of undertaking the composition.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi lam ste mngon par rtogs pa thams cad nye bar mtshon pa lhur len pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi lam ste mngon par rtogs pa thams cad nye bar mtshon pa lhur len pa yin no //
translated: Omniscience is the path to buddhahood, and it is the essence of all realizations.

original: bcom ldan 'das cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum gyis 'gro ba mtha' dag la rjes su ston par mdzad pa de nyid kyis rgyal ba'i yum rnam pa gsum car las brjod par bya ba nyid du bstan pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum gyis 'gro ba mtha' dag la rjes su ston par mdzad pa de nyid kyis rgyal ba'i yum rnam pa gsum car las brjod par bya ba nyid du bstan pa gang yin pa /
translated: The Bhagavat, by means of the three miracles, teaches all beings. He teaches in the three kinds of Mother of the Victor, the Perfection of Wisdom Sutras.🔽The expression and the expressed are connected by the method and the object of the method.

original: rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba dag thabs dang thabs kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i tshul gyis 'brel par mdzad pa phyi rol pa dang cig shos kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa chos thams cad bdag med pa la goms par ma byas pa
analyzed: rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba dag thabs dang thabs kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i tshul gyis 'brel par mdzad pa phyi rol pa dang cig shos kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa chos thams cad bdag med pa la goms par ma byas pa
translated: Those who are not free from attachment to the external and internal, and who have not become accustomed to the selflessness of all phenomena,

original: rnams kyis thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i shes pa skye ba'i rim gyis ma myangs pa ste /
analyzed: rnams kyis thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i shes pa skye ba'i rim gyis ma myangs pa ste /
translated: will not experience the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rang dang gzhan gyi don du phun sum tshogs pa sgrub pa ci la yang ma rag par chas pa dag kho nas nyams su myong ba shin tu gsal bas bzhag pa'i bag chags las byung ba'i dran pa'i shes pa la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rang dang gzhan gyi don du phun sum tshogs pa sgrub pa ci la yang ma rag par chas pa dag kho nas nyams su myong ba shin tu gsal bas bzhag pa'i bag chags las byung ba'i dran pa'i shes pa la /
translated: The bodhisattvas, who are intent on accomplishing the perfection of their own and others' goals, have a very clear experience of this, and so it is on the basis of the habitual tendencies that are laid down by this that the consciousness of memory arises.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo'i don ma lus pa mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi bdag nyid byang chub kyi sems dang sbyin pa la sogs pa sgrub pa'i spyod pa legs par bzhag nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo'i don ma lus pa mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi bdag nyid byang chub kyi sems dang sbyin pa la sogs pa sgrub pa'i spyod pa legs par bzhag nas /
translated: Having set forth the meaning of the perfection of wisdom sutras in full, in the eight realizations, the nature of which is the awakening mind and the practice of generosity and so on,

original: chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa rtogs pa'i rim pas rnam pa thams cad mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba dgos pa'i yang dgos pa'i yang ched du mngon par 'dod pa'i shes rab
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa rtogs pa'i rim pas rnam pa thams cad mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba dgos pa'i yang dgos pa'i yang ched du mngon par 'dod pa'i shes rab
translated: the wisdom that is the object of attainment is the realization of the all-pervading ultimate expanse, the realization of the grounds such as Perfect Joy, and so on, which is the direct realization of all aspects. This is the ultimate purpose of the treatise.🔽The purpose of the treatise is to present the meaning of the sutras in a condensed form.

original: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don byang chub kyi sems dang sgrub pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gdul bya rnams kyis bde blag tu rtogs par 'gyur ba ni bstan bcos rtsom pa'i dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don byang chub kyi sems dang sgrub pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gdul bya rnams kyis bde blag tu rtogs par 'gyur ba ni bstan bcos rtsom pa'i dgos pa yin no //
translated: The purpose of composing the treatise is that disciples will easily understand the meaning of the perfection of wisdom, which is characterized by the spirit of enlightenment, practice, and so on.

original: de ltar 'brel pa la sogs pa bsnyad nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'brel pa la sogs pa bsnyad nas /
translated: Having thus explained the connection and so on,

original: gdul bya rnams kyis bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dang / bstan bcos kyi don rnam par dbye ba byas pa yang ma 'dzings pa nyid kyis bshad pa bya sla bar gzigs nas tshig le'ur byas pa bco lngas mdo dang rgyas par bstan pas shes rab kyi @81b pha rol tu phyin pa'i lus rnam par bzhag pa gsungs te
analyzed: gdul bya rnams kyis bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dang / bstan bcos kyi don rnam par dbye ba byas pa yang ma 'dzings pa nyid kyis bshad pa bya sla bar gzigs nas tshig le'ur byas pa bco lngas mdo dang rgyas par bstan pas shes rab kyi @81b pha rol tu phyin pa'i lus rnam par bzhag pa gsungs te
translated: in order that disciples might easily understand, and seeing that the meaning of the treatise is well divided and that the explanation is easy because it is not tangled, he taught the body of the perfection of wisdom by way of fifteen verses, teaching it in brief and in detail.

analyzed: / shes rab pha rol phyin pa ni //

analyzed: rnam kun mkhyen nyid lam shes nyid //

analyzed: rnam kun mngon rdzogs rtogs pa dang // rtse mor phyin dang mthar gyis pa //

analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dang // dmigs pa dag dang ched dang ni //

analyzed: go cha 'jug pa'i bya ba dang // tshogs ni nges par 'byung bcas rnams //

translated: The thirteen verses are the extensive explanation because they include the meaning of those.

original: de ltar na bsdus pa dang rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir legs par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bsdus pa dang rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir legs par bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, because it is both a summary and an extensive explanation, it is a good explanation.

original: bsdus pa'i don gyi tshig le'ur byas pa rnams ni /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don gyi tshig le'ur byas pa rnams ni /
translated: The verses on the summary meaning

original: bstan bcos mdzad pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pa nyid kyis /
translated: were composed by the author of the treatise.

original: sems bskyed pa ni gzhan don phyir //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bstan bcos mtha' dag gis 'chad pas /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa ni gzhan don phyir // zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bstan bcos mtha' dag gis 'chad pas /
translated: The treatise begins with the line, “The generation of the mind is for the sake of others’ complete enlightenment.”🔽The entire treatise is an explanation of that line.

original: de dag rnam par bshad pas bshad par bsams te /
analyzed: de dag rnam par bshad pas bshad par bsams te /
translated: Therefore, the verses on the summary meaning are explained by the explanation of that line.

original: zlos pa'i nyes par 'gyur du dogs nas rnam par ma bkrol lo //
analyzed: zlos pa'i nyes par 'gyur du dogs nas rnam par ma bkrol lo //
translated: Fearing that this would be redundant, I will not elaborate on them here.

original: de ltar bsdus pa'i don kun bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar bsdus pa'i don kun bstan nas /
translated: Having thus presented the summary meaning,

original: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub rjes su 'thob par 'dod pas 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya dgos pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub rjes su 'thob par 'dod pas 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya dgos pas /
translated: Because it is the result, bodhisattvas who wish to attain enlightenment must attain omniscience.

original: dang por rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de sdud pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par bshad pa'i sgo nas bshad par bzhed de /
analyzed: dang por rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de sdud pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par bshad pa'i sgo nas bshad par bzhed de /
translated: Therefore, in order to explain the first topic, omniscience, he intends to explain it by means of the explanatory verses that summarize it.

original: sems bskyed pa rang gi ngo bo dmigs pa dang bcas pa /🔽sems bskyed pa ni gzhan don phyir //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa rang gi ngo bo dmigs pa dang bcas pa / sems bskyed pa ni gzhan don phyir //
translated: The essence of the generation of bodhicitta together with its focal object🔽The generation of bodhicitta is

original: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod //🔽ces gsungs te /
analyzed: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod // ces gsungs te /
translated: the wish for perfect complete enlightenment for the sake of others.

original: sangs rgyas su grub nas gzhan gyi don gyi phyir skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'bad par bya'o zhes sems bskyed pa gzhan gyi don du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid smon pa dang 'jug pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam pa gnyis so
analyzed: sangs rgyas su grub nas gzhan gyi don gyi phyir skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'bad par bya'o zhes sems bskyed pa gzhan gyi don du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid smon pa dang 'jug pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam pa gnyis so
translated: Having become a buddha, one should strive according to one’s fortune for the sake of others. The generation of bodhicitta is twofold: the essence of aspiration, which is the wish for perfect complete enlightenment for the sake of others, and the essence of engagement.

original: // yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa nyid ni de don du gnyer ba dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa sems las byung ba yin la /
analyzed: // yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa nyid ni de don du gnyer ba dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa sems las byung ba yin la /
translated: The desire for perfect enlightenment is the mental factor of aspiration for virtuous Dharmas that seeks that enlightenment.

original: sems @82b bskyed pa ni sems yul khyad par du 'phags pa snang ba can 'byung ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: sems @82b bskyed pa ni sems yul khyad par du 'phags pa snang ba can 'byung ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn’t the generation of the enlightenment mind the arising of the mind that appears to have an exalted object?

original: ji ltar na de sems bskyed pa yin par 'gyur zhe na bden mod kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar na de sems bskyed pa yin par 'gyur zhe na bden mod kyi /
translated: How can it be the generation of the enlightenment mind?

original: 'on kyang 'dir dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa'i mtshan nyid don du gnyer ba yod na byang chub kyi sems bskyed pas rgyus 'bas  bu bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa'i mtshan nyid don du gnyer ba yod na byang chub kyi sems bskyed pas rgyus 'bas  bu bstan pa yin te /
translated: Although this is true, here the generation of the enlightenment mind is taught in terms of its cause, since the generation of the enlightenment mind exists when there is the aspiration that is characterized by the desire for virtuous Dharmas.

original: de ltar don du gnyer ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir nye bar btags pa la rten pa yin pas nyes pa med do //🔽rnam pa gcig tu na smon lam ni don du gnyer ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar don du gnyer ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir nye bar btags pa la rten pa yin pas nyes pa med do // rnam pa gcig tu na smon lam ni don du gnyer ba ste /
translated: In order to understand that all the virtuous Dharmas of a bodhisattva who has such an aspiration increase, this is a case of a designation based on a cause.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa nyid yin la /
translated: In one sense, aspiration is the desire for perfect enlightenment.

original: de dang lhan cig spyod pa'i sems bskyed pa de'i sgrar bstan pa ni de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams la smon lam dang ldan pa'i sems de skye'o zhes bya bar shes par bya ba'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig spyod pa'i sems bskyed pa de'i sgrar bstan pa ni de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams la smon lam dang ldan pa'i sems de skye'o zhes bya bar shes par bya ba'i phyir yin no //
translated: The sound of that generation of the thought that accompanies it is taught, in order to understand that the thought endowed with the vow is generated in the Bodhisattvas in that way.

original: yang gang 'dod pa'i bdag nyid dang / gang gi don du sems bskyed pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub de ni gang yin gzhan gyi don ni gang yin zhe na /🔽de dang de ni mdo bzhin du //
analyzed: yang gang 'dod pa'i bdag nyid dang / gang gi don du sems bskyed pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub de ni gang yin gzhan gyi don ni gang yin zhe na / de dang de ni mdo bzhin du //
translated: Again, what is the nature of the desire, what is the perfect enlightenment for the sake of which the thought is generated, what is the benefit of others?🔽That is summarized and expanded upon

original: bsdus dang rgyas pa'i sgo nas brjod //
analyzed: bsdus dang rgyas pa'i sgo nas brjod //
translated: in accordance with the sutras.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said.

original: rgyal ba'i yum rnam pa gsum car las kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad la sbyin par bya ba dang / sbyin pa po dang len pa po la sogs pa mi dmigs par bsgrub par bya'o zhes shes par byed pa'i don can dang /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i yum rnam pa gsum car las kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad la sbyin par bya ba dang / sbyin pa po dang len pa po la sogs pa mi dmigs par bsgrub par bya'o zhes shes par byed pa'i don can dang /
translated: In the Mother of the Victorious Ones, in all three aspects, it is taught that the perfection of wisdom and all the perfections such as generosity should be practiced without observing the object of generosity, the giver, the receiver, and so forth. The meaning of this is to be understood.

original: sems can thams cad skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa dang / ser sna can la sogs pa rnams sbyin pa la sogs pa la dgod par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rab tu ston pa lhur byed pa'i ngag gis mdo'i don dang mi 'gal
analyzed: sems can thams cad skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa dang / ser sna can la sogs pa rnams sbyin pa la sogs pa la dgod par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rab tu ston pa lhur byed pa'i ngag gis mdo'i don dang mi 'gal
translated: One should practice this perfection of wisdom itself, wishing to establish all sentient beings in nirvana according to their fortune, and those who are stingy and so on in generosity and so forth.

original: bar bsdus pa dang rgyas pa'i sgo nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang gzhan gyi don bstan te /
analyzed: bar bsdus pa dang rgyas pa'i sgo nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang gzhan gyi don bstan te /
translated: Thus, the meaning of the sutra is summarized and explained in detail, without contradiction, by the speech of one who is intent on teaching perfect complete enlightenment and the benefit of others.

original: de ltar na sems bskyed pa ni gzhan gyi don gyi phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa'i bdag nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sems bskyed pa ni gzhan gyi don gyi phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa'i bdag nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand that generating the mind is the nature of desiring perfect complete enlightenment for the sake of others.🔽Although it is stated everywhere that one should be intent on teaching the meaning of the scriptures,

original: gtsug lag gi gzhung skabs kyi don ston pa lhur len pa ni thams cad las kyang gsungs mod kyi tshig mangs su dogs nas @83a * //
analyzed: gtsug lag gi gzhung skabs kyi don ston pa lhur len pa ni thams cad las kyang gsungs mod kyi tshig mangs su dogs nas @83a * //
translated: fearing too many words,

original: khungs nyid du ma bris so //
analyzed: khungs nyid du ma bris so //
translated: I have not written the sources.

original: de ltar sems bskyed pa dmigs pa dang rang gi ngo bo dang bcas pa brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar sems bskyed pa dmigs pa dang rang gi ngo bo dang bcas pa brjod nas /
translated: Having thus described the generation of the spirit of enlightenment together with its object and its nature,

original: da ni de'i rab tu dbye ba rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: da ni de'i rab tu dbye ba rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: now, in an intermediate verse, he presents its twenty-two varieties:

original: de yangs gser zla ba me //
analyzed: de yangs gser zla ba me //
translated: It is like a field, gold, the moon,

original: gter dang rin chen 'byung gnas mtsho //
analyzed: gter dang rin chen 'byung gnas mtsho //
translated: a treasure, a jewel mine, an ocean,

original: rdo rje ri sman bshes gnyen dang // yid bzhin nor bu nyi ma glu //
analyzed: rdo rje ri sman bshes gnyen dang // yid bzhin nor bu nyi ma glu //
translated: a diamond, a mountain, a medicine, a friend, a wish-fulfilling gem, the sun, a song,

original: rgyal po mdzod dang lam po che //🔽bzhon pa bkod ma'i chu dang ni //
analyzed: rgyal po mdzod dang lam po che // bzhon pa bkod ma'i chu dang ni //
translated: a king, a treasury, a highway,

original: sgra snyan chu po sprin rnams kyis //
analyzed: sgra snyan chu po sprin rnams kyis //
translated: a vehicle, a river, a lute, a cloud.

original: rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis so //🔽zhes bya ba dag gis bshad de /
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis so // zhes bya ba dag gis bshad de /
translated: These are the twenty-two varieties.

original: 'dun pa dang / bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / sbyor pa dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / thabs mkhas pa dang / smon lam dang /
analyzed: 'dun pa dang / bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / sbyor pa dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / thabs mkhas pa dang / smon lam dang /
translated: The twenty-two varieties of the spirit of enlightenment are the spirit of aspiration, the spirit of engagement, the spirit of superior attitude, the spirit of application, the spirit of generosity, the spirit of morality, the spirit of tolerance, the spirit of effort, the spirit of meditation, the spirit of wisdom, the spirit of skillful means, the spirit of vows, the spirit of power, the spirit of knowledge, the spirit of practice, the spirit of the perfections, the spirit of the aids to enlightenment, the spirit of the vehicles, the spirit of the levels, the spirit of the transcendent perfections, the spirit of the transcendent perfections in general, the spirit of the transcendent perfections in particular, and the spirit of the result of the transcendent perfections.

original: stobs dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / bsod nams dang / ye shes dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos dang / snying rje dang lhag mthong dang / gzugs dang / spobs pa dang /
analyzed: stobs dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / bsod nams dang / ye shes dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos dang / snying rje dang lhag mthong dang / gzugs dang / spobs pa dang /
translated: compassion, insight, form, eloquence,

original: chos kyi dga' ston dang / bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang / chos kyi sku dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: chos kyi dga' ston dang / bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang / chos kyi sku dang ldan pa ni /
translated: the feast of Dharma, the path of single progress, and the dharmakāya.🔽They are like time,

original: go rims bzhin dus dang / gser bzang po dang / zla ba tshes pa dang / me dang / gter chen po dang / rin po che'i 'byung khungs kyi gnas dang / rgya mtsho chen po dang / rdo rje dang / ri'i rgyal po dang /
analyzed: go rims bzhin dus dang / gser bzang po dang / zla ba tshes pa dang / me dang / gter chen po dang / rin po che'i 'byung khungs kyi gnas dang / rgya mtsho chen po dang / rdo rje dang / ri'i rgyal po dang /
translated: fine gold, the waxing moon, fire, a great treasure, a mine of jewels, the great ocean, a diamond, the king of mountains,

original: sman dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang / nyi ma dang / chos kyi sgra dbyangs snyan pa dang // rgyal po chen po dang / bang mdzod dang / lam po che dang / bzhon pa dang / bkod ma'i chu dang /
analyzed: sman dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang / nyi ma dang / chos kyi sgra dbyangs snyan pa dang // rgyal po chen po dang / bang mdzod dang / lam po che dang / bzhon pa dang / bkod ma'i chu dang /
translated: medicine, spiritual teachers, wish-fulfilling gems, the sun, the sweet sounds of the Dharma, great kings, treasuries, highways, vehicles, flowing water,

original: sgra snyan pa dang / chu bo'i rgyun dang / sprin lta bu ste /
analyzed: sgra snyan pa dang / chu bo'i rgyun dang / sprin lta bu ste /
translated: pleasant sounds, the flow of a river, and clouds.

original: chos dkar po thams cad kyi gzhi'i dngos po dang / byang chub kyi bar du mi 'gyur ba dang / dge ba'i chos mtha' dag rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi sgrib pa'i bud shing sreg pa dang /
analyzed: chos dkar po thams cad kyi gzhi'i dngos po dang / byang chub kyi bar du mi 'gyur ba dang / dge ba'i chos mtha' dag rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi sgrib pa'i bud shing sreg pa dang /
translated: It is the basis for all virtuous qualities, it is unchanging until enlightenment, it increases all virtuous qualities, it burns the firewood of the obscurations to the three omnisciences,

original: sems can thams cad tshim par byed pa dang / yon tan rin po che'i rten gyi dngos po dang / mi 'dod pa thams cad thog tu bab pas mi 'khrugs pa dang / yid @83b ches pa brtan pas mi phyed pa dang / dmigs pa'i rnam par g-yeng bas mi bskyod pa dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad tshim par byed pa dang / yon tan rin po che'i rten gyi dngos po dang / mi 'dod pa thams cad thog tu bab pas mi 'khrugs pa dang / yid @83b ches pa brtan pas mi phyed pa dang / dmigs pa'i rnam par g-yeng bas mi bskyod pa dang /
translated: It is the satisfaction of all sentient beings, the basis of precious qualities, unshakable by any unwanted event, indivisible by firm confidence, unshaken by distraction,

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i nad rab tu zhi ba dang / gnas skabs thams cad du sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong ba dang / ji ltar smon pa'i 'bras bu 'grub pa dang / gdul bya yongs su smin par byed pa dang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i nad rab tu zhi ba dang / gnas skabs thams cad du sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong ba dang / ji ltar smon pa'i 'bras bu 'grub pa dang / gdul bya yongs su smin par byed pa dang /
translated: the pacification of the diseases of afflictive and cognitive obscurations, the never abandoning of the welfare of sentient beings in any situation, the accomplishment of the results one wishes for, the ripening of those to be tamed,

original: gdul bya 'dun par byed pa'i chos ston pa dang / mthu thogs pa med pas gzhan gyi don sgrub pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mang po'i mdzod lta bu dang / 'phags pa thams cad gshegs shing rjes su gshegs pa dang /
analyzed: gdul bya 'dun par byed pa'i chos ston pa dang / mthu thogs pa med pas gzhan gyi don sgrub pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mang po'i mdzod lta bu dang / 'phags pa thams cad gshegs shing rjes su gshegs pa dang /
translated: the teaching of the Dharma to inspire those to be tamed, the accomplishment of others' welfare through unimpeded power, the treasury of the great accumulations of merit and wisdom, and the path traversed and followed by all āryas.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gang du yang mi ltung bas bde blag tu 'gro ba dang / thos pa dang ma thos pa'i chos 'dzin pas mi zad pa dang / thar pa 'dod pa'i gdul bya la snyan par sgrogs pa dang / gzhan gyi don bya ba tha mi dad pa dang /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gang du yang mi ltung bas bde blag tu 'gro ba dang / thos pa dang ma thos pa'i chos 'dzin pas mi zad pa dang / thar pa 'dod pa'i gdul bya la snyan par sgrogs pa dang / gzhan gyi don bya ba tha mi dad pa dang /
translated: It is easy to proceed, since one does not fall into either cyclic existence or nirvāṇa. It is inexhaustible, since it retains the Dharma, both what one has heard and what one has not heard. It is pleasing, since it proclaims the Dharma to disciples who desire liberation. It is not different, since it is dedicated to the welfare of others.

original: dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs pa la sogs pa kun du ston par rung ba nyid kyis grangs bzhin no //
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs pa la sogs pa kun du ston par rung ba nyid kyis grangs bzhin no //
translated: It is suitable, since it is suitable to manifest the enjoyment body, the emanation body, and so on, in the abode of Tuṣita Heaven and so forth.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: de yang sa gser zla ba me //
analyzed: de yang sa gser zla ba me //
translated: it is like the earth, gold, the moon, fire,🔽and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it explains twenty-two types of generation of the enlightenment mind.

original: de la dang po gsum ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid kyis las dang po pa'i sas bsdus so //
analyzed: de la dang po gsum ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid kyis las dang po pa'i sas bsdus so //
translated: Among them, the first three are included in the level of the beginner, by virtue of being small, medium, and great.

original: de'i 'og tu gcig ni sa dang po la 'jug pa'i lam gyis bsdus so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gcig ni sa dang po la 'jug pa'i lam gyis bsdus so //
translated: After that, one is included in the path that enters the first level.

original: de'i 'og tu bcu ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa sa bcus bsdus te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bcu ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa sa bcus bsdus te /
translated: After that, ten are included in the ten levels, such as the Joyous.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi spyod yul can yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi spyod yul can yin no //
translated: The first two are the objects of the paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: de'i 'og tu lnga ni khyad par gyi lam gyis bsdus so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu lnga ni khyad par gyi lam gyis bsdus so //
translated: The next five are included in the path of distinction.

original: de'i 'og tu sems bskyed pa gsum ni sbyor ba dang dngos dang mjug gi sgo nas sangs rgyas kyi sas bsdus te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems bskyed pa gsum ni sbyor ba dang dngos dang mjug gi sgo nas sangs rgyas kyi sas bsdus te /
translated: The next three are included in the stage of Buddha, from the point of view of preparation, actualization, and conclusion.

original: de ltar na sems bskyed pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni las dang po pa'i sa nas bzung ste sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar gyis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sems bskyed pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni las dang po pa'i sa nas bzung ste sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar gyis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the divisions of the generation of the Thought are included in the stages from the stage of the beginner up to the stage of Buddha.

original: dbye ba zhar la brjod nas de ltar byang chub kyi sems dang po la sogs pa bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dus ji lta ba bzhin du don du gnyer bar byed pa'i byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa dang / des 'phangs pa'i chos 'grub par bya ba'i phyir yon tan thob pa yongs su bsrung ba'i don gyis mngon par 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir 'doms pa ni gdams ngag ste /
analyzed: dbye ba zhar la brjod nas de ltar byang chub kyi sems dang po la sogs pa bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dus ji lta ba bzhin du don du gnyer bar byed pa'i byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa dang / des 'phangs pa'i chos 'grub par bya ba'i phyir yon tan thob pa yongs su bsrung ba'i don gyis mngon par 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir 'doms pa ni gdams ngag ste /
translated: Having thus incidentally discussed the divisions, the instruction is the exhortation to the Bodhisattva who has generated the first Thought of enlightenment, etc., in order to strive for the goal in accordance with the time, and in order to increase the attainment of virtue for the sake of protecting the generation of the Thought which has been projected by that.

original: sgrub @84a * //
analyzed: sgrub @84a * //
translated: and practice.

original: dang bden pa rnams dang ni //
analyzed: dang bden pa rnams dang ni //
translated: The truths,

original: sangs rgyas la sogs dkon mchog gsum //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs dkon mchog gsum //
translated: the three jewels of Buddha and so on,🔽nonattachment, nonwearying,

original: ma zhen yongs su mi ngal dang // lam ni yongs su 'dzin pa dang // spyan lnga dang ni mngon shes kyi //
analyzed: ma zhen yongs su mi ngal dang // lam ni yongs su 'dzin pa dang // spyan lnga dang ni mngon shes kyi //
translated: grasping the path, the five eyes,🔽the six qualities of clairvoyance,🔽the path of seeing,

original: yon tan drug dang mthong lam dang // bsgom zhes bya la gdams ngag ni //
analyzed: yon tan drug dang mthong lam dang // bsgom zhes bya la gdams ngag ni //
translated: and the path of meditation.🔽One should know the instructions

original: bcu yi bdag nyid shes par bya //
analyzed: bcu yi bdag nyid shes par bya //
translated: to have the nature of ten topics.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi rab tu dbye ba ji skad bshad pa bsgrub pa la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi rab tu dbye ba ji skad bshad pa bsgrub pa la /
translated: In practicing the divisions of the spirit of enlightenment as they have been explained,

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa las mi 'da' bas nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'jug par bya'o zhes slob pa sgrub pa la 'doms pa dang / sdug bsngal la gzugs la sogs pa 'bras bur gyur pa'i stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa las mi 'da' bas nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'jug par bya'o zhes slob pa sgrub pa la 'doms pa dang / sdug bsngal la gzugs la sogs pa 'bras bur gyur pa'i stong pa nyid dang /
translated: one should train in the instructions for practice: “One should enter into the spirit of enlightenment by way of nonapprehending, without transgressing the conventional and ultimate truths, and without being in common with the sravakas and so on.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bor rang bzhin gcig go zhes bya ba dang / kun 'byung ba la stong pa nyid dang gzugs la sogs pa rgyur gyur pa dag tha mi dad pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa ni kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos can ma yin no zhes bya
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bor rang bzhin gcig go zhes bya ba dang / kun 'byung ba la stong pa nyid dang gzugs la sogs pa rgyur gyur pa dag tha mi dad pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa ni kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos can ma yin no zhes bya
translated: The origin of suffering and emptiness and form and so on are not different and therefore form and so on are not phenomena that are the origin of suffering, cessation, defilement and purification.🔽Cessation and emptiness are free from arising, cessation, defilement, purification, decrease, increase and so on.

original: ba dang / 'gog pa la stong pa nyid skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / nyams pa dang 'phel ba la sogs pa dang bral ba la ni gzugs med pa nas ma rig pa skye ba yang med /
analyzed: ba dang / 'gog pa la stong pa nyid skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / nyams pa dang 'phel ba la sogs pa dang bral ba la ni gzugs med pa nas ma rig pa skye ba yang med /
translated: Form does not arise from ignorance.

original: ma rig pa 'gag pa yang med /
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gag pa yang med /
translated: Ignorance does not cease.

original: sangs rgyas kyang med /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyang med /
translated: There are no buddhas.

original: byang chub kyi bar du yang med do zhes bya ba dang / lam la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bdag nyid dam nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni phyi stong pa nyid la sogs sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dag phan tshun ldan pa dang mi ldan pa ma yin pa nyid du sgrub bo zhes ston pa bden pa la 'doms pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar du yang med do zhes bya ba dang / lam la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bdag nyid dam nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni phyi stong pa nyid la sogs sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dag phan tshun ldan pa dang mi ldan pa ma yin pa nyid du sgrub bo zhes ston pa bden pa la 'doms pa dang /
translated: and the path, the perfections such as generosity, and the self or inner emptiness, etc. are established as not mutually possessing or not possessing outer emptiness, etc. and the prior limit and the posterior limit.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs sangs rgyas dang byang chub dag mtshan nyid kyis sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi dmigs pa la gzugs la sogs pa mi sbyor bas dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa nyid du
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs sangs rgyas dang byang chub dag mtshan nyid kyis sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi dmigs pa la gzugs la sogs pa mi sbyor bas dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa nyid du
translated: and the buddhas, etc. are not connected with form, etc. because the defining characteristics of the buddhas and the enlightenments are not observed in the defining characteristics of the knowledge of all aspects that causes the buddhas, and because the object of observation and the observer are not observed.

original: shes pa zhes bya ba dang / chos la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyis bsdus pa'i gzhi dang / gnyen po dang / rnam pa @84b mtha' dag bsdus pa dag gis bsdus pa'i chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya ba dang / chos la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyis bsdus pa'i gzhi dang / gnyen po dang / rnam pa @84b mtha' dag bsdus pa dag gis bsdus pa'i chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba dang /
translated: The Dharma is subsumed by the three knowledges and all phenomena subsumed by the bases, antidotes and all aspects are devoid of entity.

original: dge 'dun la sangs rgyas dkon mchog gi khongs su gtogs pa nyid kyi dgra bcom pa ma gtogs pa 'bras bu la gnas pa dang zhugs pa'i bye brag gis skyes bu chen po bdun po rang sangs rgyas dang lhan cig brgyad po dbang po rtul po la sogs
analyzed: dge 'dun la sangs rgyas dkon mchog gi khongs su gtogs pa nyid kyi dgra bcom pa ma gtogs pa 'bras bu la gnas pa dang zhugs pa'i bye brag gis skyes bu chen po bdun po rang sangs rgyas dang lhan cig brgyad po dbang po rtul po la sogs
translated: The Saṅgha is subsumed by the seven great beings who are classified as abiding in the result or the path of entry, except for the arhat who is included in the Jewel of the Buddha.

original: pa'i bye brag gis grangs nyi shur chad pa byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa slob pa phyi mi ldog pa rnams la skye ba med pa nyid du 'jug par bya'o zhes lung 'bogs pa dkon mchog gsum la 'doms pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa nyid kyis ji skad bshad pa'i don la nan tan byed pa la /
analyzed: pa'i bye brag gis grangs nyi shur chad pa byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa slob pa phyi mi ldog pa rnams la skye ba med pa nyid du 'jug par bya'o zhes lung 'bogs pa dkon mchog gsum la 'doms pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa nyid kyis ji skad bshad pa'i don la nan tan byed pa la /
translated: The instruction in the three jewels is the instruction to the bodhisattvas who are noble beings in training, who are irreversible and who will not be reborn, to engage in the nonexistence of production.🔽The instruction in nonattachment is for those who, through the merit of their bodies and so on, become attached to them.🔽The instruction in the absence of weariness is for those who, though they have trained for a long time, become weary and discouraged if they do not achieve their desired goal.

original: lus la sogs pa'i bsod nams nyid kyis la la mngon par zhen par 'gyur bas ma zhen pa la lus la sogs pa ngo bo nyid med par bstan pa'i 'doms pa dang / dus yun ring po zhig tu goms par byas kyang 'dod pa'i don ma grub na dngang ba'i rang bzhin can yongs su skyo bar 'gyur bas yongs su ngal pa med pa la gzugs la sogs pa nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar la rlom pa
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i bsod nams nyid kyis la la mngon par zhen par 'gyur bas ma zhen pa la lus la sogs pa ngo bo nyid med par bstan pa'i 'doms pa dang / dus yun ring po zhig tu goms par byas kyang 'dod pa'i don ma grub na dngang ba'i rang bzhin can yongs su skyo bar 'gyur bas yongs su ngal pa med pa la gzugs la sogs pa nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar la rlom pa
translated: The instruction in the absence of conceit is for those who, from form up to perfect buddhahood, become conceited.

original: med pa nyid du bstan pa'i gdams ngag dang / phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa las don re re'i phyir lam gyi lung nod par bya na sems zhum par 'gyur bas lam yongs su gzung ba la chos rnams rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa nyid du bslab pa'i gdams ngag dang /
analyzed: med pa nyid du bstan pa'i gdams ngag dang / phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa las don re re'i phyir lam gyi lung nod par bya na sems zhum par 'gyur bas lam yongs su gzung ba la chos rnams rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa nyid du bslab pa'i gdams ngag dang /
translated: and the instruction in the teaching of non-existence, and if one should receive the path's transmission from the Buddhas and so forth dwelling in the ten directions for each of the topics, then one's mind would become depressed.🔽Therefore, the instruction in the training in the very non-production of the natures of the phenomena is the taking hold of the path.
