analyzed: rdzu 'phul dang / lha'i rna ba dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba lha'i mig dang / zag pa zad pa shes @85a * //🔽pa'i mngon par shes pa sa g-yo ba la sogs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na gnas pa'i sgra chung ngu dang cig shos thos pa dang / gzhan gyi sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa yongs su shes pa dang /
translated: The five eyes are taught to be the five objects of observation of the five eyes: the eye of flesh, the divine eye, the wisdom eye, the Dharma

original: rang dang gzhan gyi tshe rabs snga ma du ma rjes su dran pa dang / gzugs thams cad mthong ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bar byed pa rnams gzod ma nas zhi ba nyid du rtogs par bya'o zhes ston pa mngon par shes pa drug la 'doms pa dang /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi tshe rabs snga ma du ma rjes su dran pa dang / gzugs thams cad mthong ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bar byed pa rnams gzod ma nas zhi ba nyid du rtogs par bya'o zhes ston pa mngon par shes pa drug la 'doms pa dang /
translated: The six kinds of preternatural knowledge are taught as instructions for realizing that the recollection of many of one’s own and others’ past lives, the seeing of all forms and the elimination of defilement related and cognitive obscurations are primordially peace.

original: mthong ba'i lam bden pa bzhis bsdus pa skad cig ma bcu drug gi ngo bo nyid chos dang rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / shes pa'i bdag nyid la /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam bden pa bzhis bsdus pa skad cig ma bcu drug gi ngo bo nyid chos dang rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / shes pa'i bdag nyid la /
translated: The path of seeing, which is by nature the sixteen moments of acceptance and knowledge of the truth of the path and the truth of cessation that are included in the four truths,

original: rnal 'byor pa chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pas sgyu ma mkhan bzhin du thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i lus can des spang bar bya ba'i dngos po'i gnyen po nyid du rnam par sgom par byed do zhes ston pa mthong ba'i
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pas sgyu ma mkhan bzhin du thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i lus can des spang bar bya ba'i dngos po'i gnyen po nyid du rnam par sgom par byed do zhes ston pa mthong ba'i
translated: is taught as the meditation on the antidote to the things to be eliminated by the yogi who has realized that all phenomena are devoid of inherent identity, who is like a magician and has no attachment to anything.

original: lam la 'doms pa dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag ngo bo gcig pa nyid kyis phan tshun tha dad par gdams par mi nus pa bzhin du /🔽ji skad bshad pa'i mthong ba'i lam gyis mngon sum du byas pa'i dngos po las tha mi dad pa la dmigs pa'i phyir mthong ba dang bsgom pa dag tha dad du gyur pa med pas bsgom pa'i lam mtshan nyid pa rnam par bzhag pa ni med kyi /
analyzed: lam la 'doms pa dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag ngo bo gcig pa nyid kyis phan tshun tha dad par gdams par mi nus pa bzhin du / ji skad bshad pa'i mthong ba'i lam gyis mngon sum du byas pa'i dngos po las tha mi dad pa la dmigs pa'i phyir mthong ba dang bsgom pa dag tha dad du gyur pa med pas bsgom pa'i lam mtshan nyid pa rnam par bzhag pa ni med kyi /
translated: Just as it is impossible to instruct that conditioned and unconditioned states are different since they are the same entity,🔽since the path of meditation focuses on the object directly perceived by the path of seeing, as explained, there is no difference between seeing and meditation.

original: 'on kyang de ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyis des spang bar bya ba'i dngos po'i gnyen po nyid du rnam par sgom par byed do zhes bsgom pa'i lam la 'doms pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyis des spang bar bya ba'i dngos po'i gnyen po nyid du rnam par sgom par byed do zhes bsgom pa'i lam la 'doms pa ste /
translated: Therefore there is no actual path of meditation, but it is instructed in the path of meditation since it meditates on the antidote to the object to be abandoned through the reality of dependent origination.

original: de ltar na byang chub kyi sems dang / des 'phangs pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sgrub pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa mi dmigs pa dang / de'i dmigs pa gang yin pa 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub kyi sems dang / des 'phangs pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sgrub pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa mi dmigs pa dang / de'i dmigs pa gang yin pa 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang /
translated: The object of observation of that practice is the four noble truths.

original: rten gang yin pa skyabs gsum dang khyad par du 'gro ba'i rgyu gang yin pa ma chags pa dang / mi ldog par 'gro ba'i rgyu gang yin pa yongs su mi ngal ba dang / theg pa gzhan gyis mi 'gro ba'i rgyu gang yin pa lam yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: rten gang yin pa skyabs gsum dang khyad par du 'gro ba'i rgyu gang yin pa ma chags pa dang / mi ldog par 'gro ba'i rgyu gang yin pa yongs su mi ngal ba dang / theg pa gzhan gyis mi 'gro ba'i rgyu gang yin pa lam yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
translated: The basis of that practice is the three jewels. The cause of its progress is nonattachment. The cause of its irreversible progress is not becoming weary. The cause of not going by another vehicle is the complete acceptance of the path.

original: gzhan gyis dring mi 'jog par 'gro @85b ba nyid kyi rgyu gang yin pa spyan lnga dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyu gang yin pa mngon par shes pa drug dang / mthar thug pa'i rgyu gang yin pa mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis dring mi 'jog par 'gro @85b ba nyid kyi rgyu gang yin pa spyan lnga dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyu gang yin pa mngon par shes pa drug dang / mthar thug pa'i rgyu gang yin pa mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag ste /
translated: The five eyes are the cause of going without being led by others. The six clairvoyances are the cause of perfecting omniscience. The paths of seeing and cultivation are the cause of the ultimate.

original: de dag thams cad gdams ngag gi skabs su bstan te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad gdams ngag gi skabs su bstan te /
translated: All of these are taught in the section on instructions.

original: 'di tsam kho nas don thams cad phun sum tshogs par 'gyur bas gdams ngag ni rnam pa bcu'o //
analyzed: 'di tsam kho nas don thams cad phun sum tshogs par 'gyur bas gdams ngag ni rnam pa bcu'o //
translated: Since all goals are perfected by just these, there are ten instructions.

original: dge 'dun dkon mchog gi skabs su bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po /
analyzed: dge 'dun dkon mchog gi skabs su bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po /
translated: In the section on the jewel of the Saṅgha, two verses in the middle are for easy understanding.

original: dbang po rtul dang rnon po dag / dad dang mthong thob rigs nas rigs //
analyzed: dbang po rtul dang rnon po dag / dad dang mthong thob rigs nas rigs //
translated: The dull and sharp faculties, faith and view, obtainment, family to family,

original: bar chad gcig par skyes nas dang // byed dang byed min 'og min 'gro //
analyzed: bar chad gcig par skyes nas dang // byed dang byed min 'og min 'gro //
translated: born once, nonreturner, going to the highest,

original: 'phar gsum srid rtse'i mthar thug 'gro //
analyzed: 'phar gsum srid rtse'i mthar thug 'gro //
translated: three abiders, and the peak of existence.

original: gzugs kyi chags bcom mthong ba yi //
analyzed: gzugs kyi chags bcom mthong ba yi //
translated: The form realm attachment is destroyed, and the Dharma is seen.

original: chos la zhi lus mngon sum byed //
analyzed: chos la zhi lus mngon sum byed //
translated: The body is made manifest in the peace.

original: bse ru dang ni nyi shu'o //
analyzed: bse ru dang ni nyi shu'o //
translated: The rhinoceros and the twenty.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: This is stated.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa nyid kyis bsdus pa mthong ba'i lam skad cig bcu drug la brten nas dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i bye brag gis 'bras bu dang po la zhugs pa rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa nyid kyis bsdus pa mthong ba'i lam skad cig bcu drug la brten nas dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i bye brag gis 'bras bu dang po la zhugs pa rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Based on the sixteen moments of the path of seeing, which are included in the knowledge of the path that will be explained, there are two types who enter the first result, due to the distinction of being followers of faith and followers of reality.

original: de'i 'og tu rgyun tu zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rgyun tu zhugs pa yin no //
translated: After that, they are stream-enterers.

original: de'i 'og tu de nyid lha dang mi'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba nyid kyis gzhan rnam pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de nyid lha dang mi'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba nyid kyis gzhan rnam pa gnyis yin no //
translated: After that, they are the other two types, due to being born in the lineage of gods and humans.

original: de'i 'og tu dbang po rtul po dang rnon po dad pa dang mthong bas thob pa dag 'bras bu gnyis pa la zhugs pa gcig kho na yin no //🔽de'i 'og tu lan cig phyir 'ong ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dbang po rtul po dang rnon po dad pa dang mthong bas thob pa dag 'bras bu gnyis pa la zhugs pa gcig kho na yin no // de'i 'og tu lan cig phyir 'ong ba yin no //
translated: After that, there is only one who enters the second result, the dull and sharp faculties who obtain by faith and seeing.🔽After that, they are once-returners.

original: de'i 'og tu de nyid gzhan bar chad gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de nyid gzhan bar chad gcig pa yin no //
translated: After that, they are the others who have one obstruction.

original: de'i 'og tu snga ma bzhin du dad pa dang mthong bas thob pa 'bras bu gsum pa la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu snga ma bzhin du dad pa dang mthong bas thob pa 'bras bu gsum pa la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Then, as previously, the one who is a candidate for the third fruit, by faith and by view.

original: de'i 'og tu phyir mi 'ong ba ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu phyir mi 'ong ba ste /
translated: Then, the non-returner.

original: bar mdo dang / skyes gnas dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa dang / mngon bar 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya ba rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: bar mdo dang / skyes gnas dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa dang / mngon bar 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya ba rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: There are four types: the one who obtains nirvāṇa in the interval, the one who obtains nirvāṇa by being born, the one who obtains nirvāṇa with effort, and the one who obtains nirvāṇa without effort.

original: de'i 'og tu de nyid 'og min gyi mthar thug par 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de nyid 'og min gyi mthar thug par 'gro ba ste /
translated: Then, the one who goes higher, up to Akaniṣṭha.

original: 'phar ba dang phyed du 'phar ba dang / gnas thams cad du 'pho ba nyid kyis gong du 'pho ba gzhan rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'phar ba dang phyed du 'phar ba dang / gnas thams cad du 'pho ba nyid kyis gong du 'pho ba gzhan rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: There are three other types of upward bound: the one who soars, the one who soars and lands, and the one who soars and goes everywhere.

original: de'i 'og tu de nyid srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug par 'gro ba ni gzugs @86a * //🔽kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de nyid srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug par 'gro ba ni gzugs @86a * // kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
translated: Then, the one who goes to the peak of existence, who is free from attachment to the form realm.

original: mthong ba'i chos la zhi ba dang lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa gzhan rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la zhi ba dang lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa gzhan rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: There are two other types: the one who obtains nirvāṇa in this life and the one who makes manifest with the body.

original: de'i 'og tu dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: After that, he is one who has entered the result of an arhat.

original: de'i 'og tu rang sangs rgyas te nyi shu'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rang sangs rgyas te nyi shu'o //
translated: After that, he is a pratyekabuddha.🔽The beginner who has thus obtained the instructions gives rise to the limbs of definite discrimination. Therefore, the limbs of definite discrimination are:🔽The object, the aspect,🔽the cause, the complete acceptance,

original: las dang po pa de ltar gdams ngag thob pa la nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag 'byung bas nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag / dmigs pa dang ni rnam pa dang // rgyu dang yongs su 'dzin pa dang // byang chub sems dpa' skyob pa yi //
analyzed: las dang po pa de ltar gdams ngag thob pa la nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag 'byung bas nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag / dmigs pa dang ni rnam pa dang // rgyu dang yongs su 'dzin pa dang // byang chub sems dpa' skyob pa yi //
translated: and the protection of the bodhisattva.

original: drod sogs bdag nyid ji bzhin du //
analyzed: drod sogs bdag nyid ji bzhin du //
translated: The heat and so forth are just like the self.

original: rnam rtog bzhi po ldan bsten pa //
analyzed: rnam rtog bzhi po ldan bsten pa //
translated: One should rely on the four conceptions.

original: chung dang 'bring dang chen po rnams //
analyzed: chung dang 'bring dang chen po rnams //
translated: The small, medium, and great🔽are superior to the śrāvakas, the rhinoceros-like,

original: nyan thos bse ru lta bu dang // bcas pa dag las khyad par 'phags //
analyzed: nyan thos bse ru lta bu dang // bcas pa dag las khyad par 'phags //
translated: and those with a group.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thos pa la sogs pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa thob pa thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dad pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i 'og tu bden pa bzhi rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa nges par 'byed
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thos pa la sogs pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa thob pa thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dad pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i 'og tu bden pa bzhi rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa nges par 'byed
translated: They are called the four aspects conducive to penetrative insight because they are in conformity with the realization of the four truths.🔽They are called the four roots of virtue because they are the roots of virtue that are in conformity with the realization of the four truths.🔽They are called the four aspects conducive to penetrative insight because they are in conformity with the realization of the four truths.🔽They are called the four roots of virtue because they are the roots of virtue that are in conformity with the realization of the four truths.🔽They are called the four aspects conducive to penetrative insight because they are in conformity with the realization of the four truths.

original: pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi po 'jig rten pa'i bsgoms pa las byung ba dro bar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / de'i 'og tu rtse mor gyur pa dang / de'i 'og tu bzod par gyur pa dang / de'i 'og tu chos kyi mchog ces bya ba chung ngu la sogs pa'i rim gyis skye bas sam /
analyzed: pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi po 'jig rten pa'i bsgoms pa las byung ba dro bar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / de'i 'og tu rtse mor gyur pa dang / de'i 'og tu bzod par gyur pa dang / de'i 'og tu chos kyi mchog ces bya ba chung ngu la sogs pa'i rim gyis skye bas sam /
translated: They are called the four roots of virtue because they are the roots of virtue that are in conformity with the realization of the four truths.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang 'brel pa'i dbang po rtul po la sogs pa gang zag gi bye brag gis chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po 'chad par 'gyur ba dmigs pa'i khyad par gyi ngo bo nyid bden pa bzhi'i dngos po la dmigs pa dang /🔽chos su lta ba'i gnyen po nyid kyis mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pa dang / theg pa gsum car rtogs pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen thabs la mkhas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su 'dzin pa dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang 'brel pa'i dbang po rtul po la sogs pa gang zag gi bye brag gis chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po 'chad par 'gyur ba dmigs pa'i khyad par gyi ngo bo nyid bden pa bzhi'i dngos po la dmigs pa dang / chos su lta ba'i gnyen po nyid kyis mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pa dang / theg pa gsum car rtogs pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen thabs la mkhas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su 'dzin pa dang ldan pa dang /
translated: The specific objects of those of dull faculty and so on who are related to bodhisattvas are explained to be small, medium and great.🔽They are the essence of specific objects, they focus on the four truths, they are the cause for realizing all three vehicles, they are possessed of the nature of nonattachment and so on, they are the antidote to the view of the transitory composite and they are possessed of the nature of being fully embraced by a spiritual friend who is skilled in methods.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi po 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul dang 'brel bar 'byung ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i dro ba la sogs pa las khyad par du 'phags pa yin no
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi po 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul dang 'brel bar 'byung ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i dro ba la sogs pa las khyad par du 'phags pa yin no
translated: They are superior to the heat and so on of sravakas and so on, since they arise in connection with the four types of conception of apprehendeds and apprehenders to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and meditation, as will be explained.

original: // de dag gi dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni /
analyzed: // de dag gi dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni /
translated: The roots of virtue of heat and so on of those bodhisattvas

original: lugs @86b las gzugs su rung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po'i bdag nyid kyi bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa dang / bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po nyid kyis mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pa dang / rang gi theg pa rtogs pa kho na'i ched du dang /
analyzed: lugs @86b las gzugs su rung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po'i bdag nyid kyi bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa dang / bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po nyid kyis mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pa dang / rang gi theg pa rtogs pa kho na'i ched du dang /
translated: focus on the four truths that are the nature of things characterized by suitability for form and so on, they engage impermanence and so forth since they are the antidote to the view of self, they arise for the purpose of realizing their own vehicle alone,

original: yongs su 'dzin pa dang bral ba dang / rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi dang mi ldan par 'byung ngo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa dang bral ba dang / rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi dang mi ldan par 'byung ngo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: they are free from grasping and they are not associated with the four types of conceptualization.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams ni /
translated: The factors conducive to penetrative insight of bodhisattvas

original: thabs mkhas pa'i stobs kyis kha cig tu ni rgyu'i sgo nas /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa'i stobs kyis kha cig tu ni rgyu'i sgo nas /
translated: are sometimes generated from the perspective of cause by the power of method.

original: kha cig tu ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas /🔽kha cig tu ni ngo bo nyid kyi sgo nas /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas / kha cig tu ni ngo bo nyid kyi sgo nas /
translated: Sometimes they are generated from the perspective of result.🔽Sometimes they are generated from the perspective of nature.

original: kha cig tu ni chos nyid kyi rnam pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni chos nyid kyi rnam pa'i sgo nas /
translated: Sometimes they are generated from the perspective of reality.

original: ji ltar srid pa bzhin bden pa bzhi'i dngos po la dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar srid pa bzhin bden pa bzhi'i dngos po la dmigs pa yin la /
translated: As there are existences, so there are the four noble truths as objects.

original: snga ma bzhin du rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang bden pa bzhi la kun du dmigs so zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang bden pa bzhi la kun du dmigs so zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: And as before, one should understand that the four noble truths are also apprehended in other aspects.

original: mdor bsdus te rnam par bkrol ba tsam du brjod par 'dod pas ma spros so //
analyzed: mdor bsdus te rnam par bkrol ba tsam du brjod par 'dod pas ma spros so //
translated: I have not elaborated, because I wanted to explain only the brief summary.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ni rnam par gzhag pa gzhan kho na yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ni rnam par gzhag pa gzhan kho na yin te /
translated: This is a different presentation.

original: de'i phyir theg pa gzhan la brten nas ni gang du yang sun 'byin pa brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir theg pa gzhan la brten nas ni gang du yang sun 'byin pa brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not criticize it on the basis of another vehicle.

original: dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What are the differences in their objects and aspects?

original: de'i phyir dmigs pa dang rnam pa dag bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa bdun gyis bshad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs pa dang rnam pa dag bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa bdun gyis bshad de /
translated: The next seven verses explain the differences in their objects and aspects.

original: dmigs pa mi rtag la sogs pa //
analyzed: dmigs pa mi rtag la sogs pa //
translated: The objects are impermanence, etc.

original: bden pa'i rten can de yi ni //
analyzed: bden pa'i rten can de yi ni //
translated: The aspects are based on the four noble truths.🔽Their aspects are the cessation of attachment, etc.

original: rnam pa mngon zhen la sogs 'gog / theg pa gsum car 'thob pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: rnam pa mngon zhen la sogs 'gog / theg pa gsum car 'thob pa'i rgyu //
translated: They are the causes of attaining the three vehicles.

original: gzugs sogs 'du 'god gnas bral dang // gnas dang btags dang brjod du med //
analyzed: gzugs sogs 'du 'god gnas bral dang // gnas dang btags dang brjod du med //
translated: Form, etc. are free from arrangement and disarrangement,🔽and are inexpressible as existent, non-existent, both, or neither.

original: ces bya'o // de la chung ngu'i dmigs pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa bzhi po la rten pa mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bcu drug yin no //
analyzed: ces bya'o // de la chung ngu'i dmigs pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa bzhi po la rten pa mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bcu drug yin no //
translated: The object of the weak is the sixteen aspects such as impermanence, based on the four noble truths such as the truth of suffering.

original: de'i rnam pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa la mngon par zhen pa dang dmigs pa la sogs pa 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa la mngon par zhen pa dang dmigs pa la sogs pa 'gog pa yin no //
translated: Its aspect is the cessation of the adherence to the truths such as suffering, and the cessation of the object, etc.

original: dro ba la sogs pa thams cad kyang theg pa gsum car rtogs pa 'thob pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo yin par khong du chud par bya'o //🔽'bring gi dmigs pa ni mos pa dang de kho na nyid yid la byed pa dag gis grangs bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa bsgrub pa dang / dgag @87a * //
analyzed: dro ba la sogs pa thams cad kyang theg pa gsum car rtogs pa 'thob pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo yin par khong du chud par bya'o // 'bring gi dmigs pa ni mos pa dang de kho na nyid yid la byed pa dag gis grangs bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa bsgrub pa dang / dgag @87a * //
translated: It should be understood that all heat, etc. are the nature of the cause for attaining the realization of the three vehicles.

original: pa dag mi dmigs shing ma mthong ba zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: pa dag mi dmigs shing ma mthong ba zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The object of the middling is the non-apprehension and non-seeing of the establishment and negation of form, etc. by means of interest and attention to reality, respectively.

original: rnam pa ni ming thams cad med pa nyid kyis rgyun mi 'dra ba dang rgyun 'dra bar 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid dag med pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa ni ming thams cad med pa nyid kyis rgyun mi 'dra ba dang rgyun 'dra bar 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid dag med pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The aspects are the nonexistence of the characteristics of engagement in the dissimilar and similar continua due to the nonexistence of all names.

original: chen po'i dmigs pa ni gzugs nas sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i bar chos thams cad brdar btags pa'i chos tha snyad pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chen po'i dmigs pa ni gzugs nas sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i bar chos thams cad brdar btags pa'i chos tha snyad pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The object of the great is all phenomena from form to buddha, which are conventional phenomena designated by signs.

original: rnam pa ni dge ba la sogs pa nyid kyi chos gang du yang brjod du med pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa ni dge ba la sogs pa nyid kyi chos gang du yang brjod du med pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The aspects are the inexpressibility of any phenomena as virtuous and so on.

original: de ltar na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi me'i snga ltas yin pa'i phyir dro bar gyur pa dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang ldan pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi me'i snga ltas yin pa'i phyir dro bar gyur pa dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang ldan pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Thus the state of heat is threefold, possessing objects and aspects, because it is a precursor of the fire of nonconceptual wisdom.

original: gzugs sogs mi gnas de dag ni //
analyzed: gzugs sogs mi gnas de dag ni //
translated: Form and so on do not abide in it.

original: de yi ngo bor rang bzhin med //
analyzed: de yi ngo bor rang bzhin med //
translated: They are not its nature and it has no intrinsic nature.🔽They are the same nature as it.

original: de dag gcig gi rang bzhin gcig / de mi rtag sogs par mi gnas //
analyzed: de dag gcig gi rang bzhin gcig / de mi rtag sogs par mi gnas //
translated: Impermanence and so on do not abide in it.

original: de rnams de yi ngo bos stong //
analyzed: de rnams de yi ngo bos stong //
translated: They are empty of its nature.

original: de dag gcig gi rang bzhin gcig / chos rnams mi 'dzin gang yin dang // de dag mtshan mar mi mthong phyir //
analyzed: de dag gcig gi rang bzhin gcig / chos rnams mi 'dzin gang yin dang // de dag mtshan mar mi mthong phyir //
translated: and because they are not seen as signs.

original: shes rab kyis ni yongs rtog pa //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni yongs rtog pa //
translated: They are fully investigated by wisdom.

original: thams cad dmigs su med par ro //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thams cad dmigs su med par ro // zhes bya ba la /
translated: All are not apprehended.

original: chung ngu'i dmigs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
analyzed: chung ngu'i dmigs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
translated: Here, the object of the small is form and so on, which is the nature of the absence of the entity of form and so on.

original: rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa la mi gnas pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa la mi gnas pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is said that because of the emptiness of its own entity, it does not abide in form and so on.

original: rnam pa ni don dam par gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dang / stong pa nyid dag phan tshun ngo bo gcig yin pas stong pa nyid la mi rtag pa la sogs pa med pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa de dag la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa nyid du mi gnas pa zhes bya ba yin no
analyzed: rnam pa ni don dam par gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dang / stong pa nyid dag phan tshun ngo bo gcig yin pas stong pa nyid la mi rtag pa la sogs pa med pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa de dag la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa nyid du mi gnas pa zhes bya ba yin no
translated: The aspect is that ultimately all phenomena such as form and emptiness are mutually the same entity, so it is said that because impermanence and so on do not exist in emptiness, they do not abide in those such as form as permanence and impermanence and so on.

original: // 'bring gi dmigs pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kyis mi rtag pa la sogs pa dang stong pa nyid rnams ni rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa yin pas /
analyzed: // 'bring gi dmigs pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kyis mi rtag pa la sogs pa dang stong pa nyid rnams ni rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa yin pas /
translated: The medium object is impermanence, etc. and emptiness, which are the nature of the realm of the Dharma, because they are essenceless.

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa dang stong pa nyid dag phan tshun bdag nyid gcig pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa dang stong pa nyid dag phan tshun bdag nyid gcig pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Impermanence, etc. and emptiness are said to be mutually identical in nature.

original: rnam pa ni ngo bo nyid bkag pas gzugs la sogs pa la rang gir mi byed pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa ni ngo bo nyid bkag pas gzugs la sogs pa la rang gir mi byed pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yin no //
translated: The aspect is that which is said to not make form, etc. one's own by negating the entity.

original: chen po'i dmigs pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa de dag la sngon po la sogs pa'i mtshan @87b mar mi mthong ba zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chen po'i dmigs pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa de dag la sngon po la sogs pa'i mtshan @87b mar mi mthong ba zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The great object is the non-seeing of those forms, etc. as blue, etc. by way of their essencelessness.

original: rnam pa ni shes rab kyis yang dag par chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pas dngos po thams cad mi dmigs par nges par rtog pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa ni shes rab kyis yang dag par chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pas dngos po thams cad mi dmigs par nges par rtog pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The aspect is the ascertainment of the non-observation of all things by means of the wisdom that thoroughly differentiates phenomena.

original: de ltar na dge ba'i rtsa ba g-yo ba'i rtse mo yin pa'i phyir rtse mor gyur pa dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang ldan pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de ltar na dge ba'i rtsa ba g-yo ba'i rtse mo yin pa'i phyir rtse mor gyur pa dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang ldan pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Thus, the summit is threefold, having an object and an aspect, because the root of the wholesome is the summit.

original: gzugs sogs ngo bo nyid med nyid //
analyzed: gzugs sogs ngo bo nyid med nyid //
translated: The nature of form, etc. is unreality.

original: de med pa nyid ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: de med pa nyid ngo bo nyid //
translated: The unreality of that is reality.

original: de dag skye med nges 'byung med //
analyzed: de dag skye med nges 'byung med //
translated: They are non-production and non-extinction.

original: dag dang de dag mtshan ma med //
analyzed: dag dang de dag mtshan ma med //
translated: They are pure and signless.

original: de yi mtshan mar mi rten pas //🔽mos min 'du shes med pa yin //

translated: The basis of engagement is called the lineage.🔽

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The support of engagement is called the lineage.

original: re zhig dang por 'jig rten pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams so //
analyzed: re zhig dang por 'jig rten pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams so //
translated: First, there are the mundane aids to penetration.

original: de'i 'og tu 'jig rten las 'das pa mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam dag go //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'jig rten las 'das pa mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam dag go //
translated: After that, there is the supramundane path of insight and the path of cultivation.

original: de'i 'og tu de dag skyes pa'i stobs kyis rkun po phyung ba dang sgo 'phar bcad pa ltar dus mnyam du gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs skye ba dang 'gag pa dag go //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de dag skyes pa'i stobs kyis rkun po phyung ba dang sgo 'phar bcad pa ltar dus mnyam du gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs skye ba dang 'gag pa dag go //
translated: After that, by the power of their arising, the antidotes and their resistant tendencies cease simultaneously, like a thief and his hole.

original: de'i 'og tu de dag mi dmigs pas de dag skye ba dang 'gag pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de dag mi dmigs pas de dag skye ba dang 'gag pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'o //
translated: After that, by not objectifying those, one abandons the conceptual thoughts associated with their arising and cessation.

original: de'i 'og tu sngon gyi smon lam dang sbyin pa la sogs pa thabs la mkhas @89b pa'i stobs kyis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi shes rab dang thabs so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sngon gyi smon lam dang sbyin pa la sogs pa thabs la mkhas @89b pa'i stobs kyis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi shes rab dang thabs so //
translated: After that, by the power of skill in means, such as one's former prayers and generosity, there is wisdom and means, which are characterized by nonabiding in either cyclic life or in nirvana.

original: de'i 'og tu de dag skyes pas nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i chos so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de dag skyes pas nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i chos so //
translated: Then, after that, the generation of those, the Dharma that is not shared with the sravakas, etc.

original: de'i 'og tu bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzhug pa la sogs pa la ldem por dgongs pa'i sgo nas theg pa gsum gyi lam la dgod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhan gyi don gyi go rims so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzhug pa la sogs pa la ldem por dgongs pa'i sgo nas theg pa gsum gyi lam la dgod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhan gyi don gyi go rims so //
translated: Then, after that, the order of the benefit of others, which has the characteristic of establishing in the path of the three vehicles by means of indirect expression, such as the introduction according to the desire of the disciple.

original: de'i 'og tu 'khor ba ji srid par mtshan ma med cing lhun gyis grub par gzhan gyi don gyi ye shes 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'khor ba ji srid par mtshan ma med cing lhun gyis grub par gzhan gyi don gyi ye shes 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Then, after that, the arising of the knowledge of the benefit of others, signless and spontaneous, for as long as cyclic existence lasts.

original: 'di ni go rims yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni go rims yin no //
translated: This is the order.

original: 'dis kyang skyes bu'i don thams cad phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang skyes bu'i don thams cad phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: And this is the perfection of all the aims of man.

original: sgrub pa'i chos kyi gnas skabs tha dad pa'i bye brag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa bcu gsum po ji skad du bshad pa'i chos kyi gzhir gyur pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kho na la rigs zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos kyi gnas skabs tha dad pa'i bye brag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa bcu gsum po ji skad du bshad pa'i chos kyi gzhir gyur pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kho na la rigs zhes bstan to //
translated: The word gotra is taught in the nature of the dharmadhatu, which is the basis of the Dharma, just as it was explained, of the thirteen kinds of bodhisattvas, by way of the different stages of the Dharma of practice.

original: gal te chos kyi dbyings kho na 'phags pa'i chos rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid can gyi byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs yin na /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi dbyings kho na 'phags pa'i chos rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid can gyi byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs yin na /
translated: If the dharmadhatu alone is the cause of the realization of the qualities of the aryas, then the bodhisattva who has the nature of that dharmadhatu is the gotra that is the nature of the unsurpassed qualities of a buddha.🔽If that is so, then at that time, it is not just the bodhisattva who abides in that nature, but in general, all sentient beings abide in that nature.

original: 'o na ni de'i tshe de ni spyir gnas pa yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' kho na ma yin no snyam pa'i skye bo blo dman pa'i ngor dogs pa bsu nas bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: 'o na ni de'i tshe de ni spyir gnas pa yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' kho na ma yin no snyam pa'i skye bo blo dman pa'i ngor dogs pa bsu nas bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: To anticipate the qualm of a person of inferior intellect who thinks that, the verse in the middle states:

original: chos kyi dbyings la dbyer med phyir //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la dbyer med phyir //
translated: Because there is no division in the dharmadhatu,

original: rigs ni tha dad rung ma yin //
analyzed: rigs ni tha dad rung ma yin //
translated: gotra is not suitable as different.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //🔽ji ltar nyan thos kyi theg pa la sogs pa rtogs pa'i rim gyis dmigs pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so // ji ltar nyan thos kyi theg pa la sogs pa rtogs pa'i rim gyis dmigs pa de bzhin du /
translated: Thus it is said.🔽Just as the stages of realization in the sravaka vehicle and so on are objects of observation,

original: 'phags pa'i chos rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in the same way, in order to realize the qualities of the aryas,

original: chos kyi dbyings rgyu'i ngo bor rnam par 'jog pa'i sgo nas rigs nyid du tha snyad 'dogs so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rgyu'i ngo bor rnam par 'jog pa'i sgo nas rigs nyid du tha snyad 'dogs so //
translated: The dharmadhatu is designated as the lineage by way of being posited as the entity of the cause.

original: zhes bya ba'i lan zhig kyang gzigs mod kyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i lan zhig kyang gzigs mod kyi /
translated: Although he saw that answer,

original: sla chos nyid du 'jig rten pa'i dngags kyis lan gzhan du /
analyzed: sla chos nyid du 'jig rten pa'i dngags kyis lan gzhan du /
translated: he gave another answer in a worldly example, in a way that is easy to understand:

original: rten pa'i chos kyi bye brag gis //🔽de yi dbye ba yongs su brjod //
analyzed: rten pa'i chos kyi bye brag gis // de yi dbye ba yongs su brjod //
translated: The different supported phenomena

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /🔽dper na 'jim pa gcig las mngon par grub cing me lce gcig gis so btang ba'i rten bum pa la sogs pa /🔽brten pa sbrang rtsi dang li kha ra la sogs pa'i snod nyid kyis tha dad pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te / dper na 'jim pa gcig las mngon par grub cing me lce gcig gis so btang ba'i rten bum pa la sogs pa / brten pa sbrang rtsi dang li kha ra la sogs pa'i snod nyid kyis tha dad pa de bzhin du /
translated: are said to be its different aspects.

original: rten @90a * //🔽pa'i chos theg pa gsum gyis bsdus pa /
analyzed: rten @90a * // pa'i chos theg pa gsum gyis bsdus pa /
translated: For example, a single lump of clay is fully established, and the supported phenomena, the vessels such as pots, are differentiated by the supported substances such as honey and pomegranate juice that are put into the single flame of a fire.

original: rtogs par bya ba tha dad pa nyid kyis rten tha dad pa nyid do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba tha dad pa nyid kyis rten tha dad pa nyid do zhes bstan to //
translated: In the same way, the different supports are taught to be different by the different things to be realized, the supported phenomena included in the three vehicles.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i sgrub pa'i rten gyi dmigs pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i sgrub pa'i rten gyi dmigs pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the object of observation that is the support of the practice as it has been explained?

original: dmigs pa / dmigs pa chos rnams thams cad de //
analyzed: dmigs pa / dmigs pa chos rnams thams cad de //
translated: The object is all phenomena.

original: de yang dge la sogs pa yin //
analyzed: de yang dge la sogs pa yin //
translated: They are virtuous and so on.🔽Those that are mundane realizations,🔽those that are asserted to be supramundane,🔽those that are contaminated and uncontaminated,

original: 'jig rten pa yi rtogs pa dang // gang dag 'jig rten 'das 'dod dang // zag bcas zag pa med chos dang // gang dag 'dus byas 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi rtogs pa dang // gang dag 'jig rten 'das 'dod dang // zag bcas zag pa med chos dang // gang dag 'dus byas 'dus ma byas //
translated: those that are conditioned and unconditioned,🔽those that are shared in common with trainees,

original: slob mthun mong chos rnams dang // gang dag thub pa'i thun mong min //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: slob mthun mong chos rnams dang // gang dag thub pa'i thun mong min // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: and those that are not shared in common with trainees.🔽The object of the Muni's knowledge is all phenomena.

original: re zhig dang por spyir dge ba dang ma dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa ste go rims bzhin du dge sbyong gi tshul nyid dang srog gcod pa la sogs pa dang lung du ma bstan pa'i lus kyi las la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: re zhig dang por spyir dge ba dang ma dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa ste go rims bzhin du dge sbyong gi tshul nyid dang srog gcod pa la sogs pa dang lung du ma bstan pa'i lus kyi las la sogs pa'o //
translated: First, in general, virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral phenomena are, respectively, the nature of the way of virtuous asceticism, such as killing and so on, and neutral bodily actions and so on.

original: de'i 'og tu de dag nyid la 'jig rten pa la sogs pa rnam pa gnyis po'i dbye ba bzhi nyid kyis lhag ma rnams te grangs bzhin du byis pa'i skye po thams cad dang 'brel pa'i phung po lnga dang / 'phags pa'i skye bo thams cad kyis bsdus pa'i bsam gtan bzhi dang /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de dag nyid la 'jig rten pa la sogs pa rnam pa gnyis po'i dbye ba bzhi nyid kyis lhag ma rnams te grangs bzhin du byis pa'i skye po thams cad dang 'brel pa'i phung po lnga dang / 'phags pa'i skye bo thams cad kyis bsdus pa'i bsam gtan bzhi dang /
translated: The first four are the five aggregates related to all ordinary beings, the four concentrations subsumed by all ārya beings,🔽the five appropriated aggregates that are not the antidote to the view of self, and the four establishments of mindfulness that are the antidote to that view.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dang / der lta ba'i gnyen po dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / rgyu dang rkyen la rag las pa 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa dang / rgyu la mi ltos pa de bzhin nyid dang /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dang / der lta ba'i gnyen po dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / rgyu dang rkyen la rag las pa 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa dang / rgyu la mi ltos pa de bzhin nyid dang /
translated: The next four are the desire realm and so on, which are dependent on causes and conditions, suchness, which is not dependent on causes,

original: 'phags pa'i skye bo thams cad kyi rgyud la 'byung ba'i bsam gtan bzhi dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rgyud la 'byung ba'i chos can stobs bcu ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i skye bo thams cad kyi rgyud la 'byung ba'i bsam gtan bzhi dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rgyud la 'byung ba'i chos can stobs bcu ste /
translated: and the four concentrations that arise in the mindstreams of all ārya beings and the ten powers that arise in the mindstream of a perfect buddha.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i rim gyis dmigs pas na /
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i rim gyis dmigs pas na /
translated: Thus, through the stages of realizing all phenomena just as they are,

original: dmigs pa rnam pa bcu gcig go //
analyzed: dmigs pa rnam pa bcu gcig go //
translated: there are eleven topics.

original: dmigs pa de lta bu la sgrub pa'i ched du bya ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa de lta bu la sgrub pa'i ched du bya ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the purpose of such topics?

original: ched du bya ba /
analyzed: ched du bya ba /
translated: The purpose is🔽the supreme thought for all beings,

original: sems can kun mchog nyid sems dang // spong dang rtogs dang gsum po la //
analyzed: sems can kun mchog nyid sems dang // spong dang rtogs dang gsum po la //
translated: abandonment, and realization.

original: chen po gsum gyi rang 'byung gi //
analyzed: chen po gsum gyi rang 'byung gi //
translated: The three greatnesses are

original: ched du bya ba 'di shes bya //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //🔽rnam pa thams cad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su shes pa'i sgo nas 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i @90b sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyid kyi /
analyzed: ched du bya ba 'di shes bya // zhes bya ba gsungs so // rnam pa thams cad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su shes pa'i sgo nas 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i @90b sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyid kyi /
translated: to be known as the purpose.🔽The purpose is to be known as the three greatnesses: the greatness of the thought, the greatness of abandonment, and the greatness of realization.

original: sems can thams cad sems can kun gyi mchog nyid kyi sems chen po nyid dang / spong ba chen po nyid dang / rtogs pa chen po nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sems can kun gyi mchog nyid kyi sems chen po nyid dang / spong ba chen po nyid dang / rtogs pa chen po nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: The greatness of the thought is the supreme thought for all beings.🔽The greatness of abandonment is the abandonment of the two obscurations.🔽The greatness of realization is the realization of all aspects of the two kinds of no-self.

original: de ltar sgrub pa la 'jug pa de'i phyir chen po nyid gsum dang ldan phas tshad du bya ba gsum du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sgrub pa la 'jug pa de'i phyir chen po nyid gsum dang ldan phas tshad du bya ba gsum du shes par bya'o //
translated: Since one engages in practice in that way, one should understand that the three greatnesses are the three objects of practice.

original: de ltar sgrub pa'i rten du gyur pa la sogs pa brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar sgrub pa'i rten du gyur pa la sogs pa brjod nas /
translated: Having described the support for practice and so forth,

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo gang yin zhe na /
translated: what is its own nature?

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi yul la spyir dge ba'i chos kyi rten can dang rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la sogs pa mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa bzhi la /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi yul la spyir dge ba'i chos kyi rten can dang rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la sogs pa mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa bzhi la /
translated: In general, the support for virtuous dharmas in the field of the three omnisciences, and in the four realizations such as the complete realization of all aspects,

original: mngon par rtogs pa re re zhing pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi rten can gyi bya ba ni sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa re re zhing pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi rten can gyi bya ba ni sgrub pa ste /
translated: the practice is the activity that is the support of the six perfections in each realization.

original: de ltar ji lta ba bzhin du sbyor ba dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang khyad par gyi lam gyi ngo bo nyid kyi sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid go cha dang 'jug pa dang tshogs dang nges par 'byung ba rnams kyi nang nas brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo nyid🔽kyis dang po go cha'i sgrub pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar ji lta ba bzhin du sbyor ba dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang khyad par gyi lam gyi ngo bo nyid kyi sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid go cha dang 'jug pa dang tshogs dang nges par 'byung ba rnams kyi nang nas brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo nyid kyis dang po go cha'i sgrub pa gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, the armor practice, the practice of engagement, the practice of accumulation, and the practice of definite emergence, which are the characteristics of the practice that is the nature of the paths of preparation, seeing, meditation, and no-more-learning, respectively, are taught.

original: de dag so sor sbyin la sogs //🔽rnam pa drug tu bsdus pa yis //
analyzed: de dag so sor sbyin la sogs // rnam pa drug tu bsdus pa yis //
translated: From among them, the practice that is the nature of the path of preparation is taught first.

original: go cha'i sgrub pa gang yin de //🔽drug tshan drug gis ji bzhin bshad //
analyzed: go cha'i sgrub pa gang yin de // drug tshan drug gis ji bzhin bshad //
translated: The practice of armor is the practice of the six perfections🔽that are included in the six sets of six.

original: ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba yin te /
translated: It is explained by the six sets of six.🔽The practice of armor is the practice of the six perfections generosity and so on.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa sbyin par byed pa na /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa sbyin par byed pa na /
translated: When one is practicing generosity, such as the generosity of Dharma,

original: nyan thos kyi yid la byed pa la sogs spong ba dang / skye bo thams cad kyis mi snyan par smra ba nyid bzod pa dang / 'dun pa skyed pa dang / theg pa gzhan dang ma 'dres pa'i rtse gcig pa nyid dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo ba rnams /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi yid la byed pa la sogs spong ba dang / skye bo thams cad kyis mi snyan par smra ba nyid bzod pa dang / 'dun pa skyed pa dang / theg pa gzhan dang ma 'dres pa'i rtse gcig pa nyid dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo ba rnams /
translated: They are the armor of the transcendent perfections, the armor of the levels, the armor of the elements leading to enlightenment, the armor of the transcendent perfections, the armor of the four ways of attracting disciples and the armor of the four means of gathering disciples.

original: go rims bzhin du sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i go cha nyid kyis byed pa dang / de bzhin du tshul khrims srung bar byed /🔽bzod pa rdzogs par byed /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i go cha nyid kyis byed pa dang / de bzhin du tshul khrims srung bar byed / bzod pa rdzogs par byed /
translated: The armor of the transcendent perfections is the practice of generosity and so on, from the transcendent perfection of generosity up to the transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom /🔽bsam gtan sgrub /🔽shes rab sgom par byed do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom / bsam gtan sgrub / shes rab sgom par byed do //
translated: The armor of the levels is the practice of the ten levels.🔽The armor of the elements leading to enlightenment is the practice of the thirty seven elements leading to enlightenment.

original: de ltar sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa so sor sbyin pa la sogs pa bsdus pas na drug tshan drug gis /
analyzed: de ltar sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa so sor sbyin pa la sogs pa bsdus pas na drug tshan drug gis /
translated: The armor of the transcendent perfections is the practice of the six transcendent perfections.🔽The armor of the four ways of attracting disciples is the practice of the four ways of attracting disciples generosity, speaking pleasantly, meaning by which one attracts disciples and being consistent in one's deeds.

original: rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug yin mod kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa drug chos mthun pa'i phyir go cha'i sgrub pa rnam pa drug go //🔽/ bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug yin mod kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa drug chos mthun pa'i phyir go cha'i sgrub pa rnam pa drug go // / bam po gnyis pa /
translated: Although there are thirty-six aspects, the six such as giving are similar in type, so the armor practice has six aspects.

original: de ltar go bgos pa la @91a * //
analyzed: de ltar go bgos pa la @91a * //
translated: Thus, the one who is armored🔽engages in the practice of engaging.

original: 'jug pa 'byung bas gnyis pa 'jug pa'i sgrub pa /
analyzed: 'jug pa 'byung bas gnyis pa 'jug pa'i sgrub pa /
translated: The practice of engaging is the Great Vehicle🔽of the concentrations, the formless states, giving, and so on,🔽the path, love, and so on,🔽the objectless, the possessed,🔽the purity of the three spheres,

original: bsam gtan gzugs med sbyin sogs dang // lam dang byams la sogs pa dang // dmigs pa med dang ldan pa dang // 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa dang // ched du bya dang mngon shes drug /
analyzed: bsam gtan gzugs med sbyin sogs dang // lam dang byams la sogs pa dang // dmigs pa med dang ldan pa dang // 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa dang // ched du bya dang mngon shes drug /
translated: the aim, the six superknowledges,

original: rnam kun mkhyen pa'i tshul la ni //🔽'jug pa'i sgrub pa theg chen la //
analyzed: rnam kun mkhyen pa'i tshul la ni // 'jug pa'i sgrub pa theg chen la //
translated: and the way of the knower of all aspects.🔽The practice of engaging is to be known

original: 'dzeg pa yin par shes par bya //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dzeg pa yin par shes par bya //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: as the ascent to the Great Vehicle.🔽Thus, the one who is armored engages in the practice of engaging.

original: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyom par 'jug pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mi slob pa dang khyad par gyi lam dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyom par 'jug pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mi slob pa dang khyad par gyi lam dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang /
translated: The concentrations, the formless absorptions, the six perfections such as generosity, the paths of seeing, meditation and no more learning, the four immeasurables,

original: mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa dang / dngos po thams cad la 'khor gsum dag pa dang / ched du bya ba dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dag la yang dag par gnas pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa dang / dngos po thams cad la 'khor gsum dag pa dang / ched du bya ba dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dag la yang dag par gnas pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: the possession of nonapprehending, the purity of the three spheres with regard to all things, the object, the six kinds of preternatural knowledge and the knowledge of all aspects are the defining characteristics of the Great Vehicle's practice of perfect progress.

original: theg pa chen po'i chos mtha' dag gnon pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas 'jug pa'i sgrub pa rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos mtha' dag gnon pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas 'jug pa'i sgrub pa rnam pa dgu'o //
translated: Since it is the very essence of the Great Vehicle's practice of perfect progress, it is the ninefold practice of engagement.

original: de ltar 'jug pa byas pa la tshogs skye bas gsum pa tshogs kyi sgrub pa /
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pa byas pa la tshogs skye bas gsum pa tshogs kyi sgrub pa /
translated: Since the accumulations are produced in one who has thus engaged in the practice, the third is the practice of accumulation.

original: brtse dang sbyin la sogs pa drug / zhi gnas lhag mthong bcas pa dang // zung du 'brel ba'i lam gang dang // thabs la mkhas pa gang yin dang // ye shes dang ni bsod nams dang // lam dang gzungs dang sa bcu dang // gnyen po'i tshogs kyi sgrub pa yi //
analyzed: brtse dang sbyin la sogs pa drug / zhi gnas lhag mthong bcas pa dang // zung du 'brel ba'i lam gang dang // thabs la mkhas pa gang yin dang // ye shes dang ni bsod nams dang // lam dang gzungs dang sa bcu dang // gnyen po'i tshogs kyi sgrub pa yi //
translated: wisdom and merit,🔽the path, the powers, and the ten grounds,

original: rim pa yin par shes par bya //
analyzed: rim pa yin par shes par bya //
translated: are the stages of the accumulations🔽of antidotes.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated in the following:

original: snying rje chen po dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / zung du 'brel ba'i lam dang / thabs mkhas pa dang /
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / zung du 'brel ba'i lam dang / thabs mkhas pa dang /
translated: Great compassion, giving, ethics, patience, effort, concentration, wisdom, calm abiding, insight, the path of union, and skill in means,

original: ye shes dang / bsod nams dang / mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam dang / tshig la sogs pa'i gzungs dang / sa dang gnyen po rnams mi dmigs pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa las mi 'da' bar theg pa chen po'i don mtha' dag sgrub pas snying rje la sogs pa 'di dag gis yang dag par 'grub pa'i ngo bos byang chub chen po 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir na
analyzed: ye shes dang / bsod nams dang / mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam dang / tshig la sogs pa'i gzungs dang / sa dang gnyen po rnams mi dmigs pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa las mi 'da' bar theg pa chen po'i don mtha' dag sgrub pas snying rje la sogs pa 'di dag gis yang dag par 'grub pa'i ngo bos byang chub chen po 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir na
translated: Since they accomplish the entire meaning of the Mahāyāna without transgressing conventional truth by not observing the paths of wisdom, merit, and vision, and the dhāraṇīs of words and so on, the levels, and the antidotes,🔽they are the essence that is accomplished by these such as compassion.

original: snying rje @91b chen po la sogs pa ni tshogs yin pas /
analyzed: snying rje @91b chen po la sogs pa ni tshogs yin pas /
translated: Since they hold the essence of great enlightenment,

original: tshogs kyi sgrub pa rnam pa bcu bdun no //
analyzed: tshogs kyi sgrub pa rnam pa bcu bdun no //
translated: there are seventeen kinds of accomplishment of the accumulations.

original: de la ye shes kyi tshogs ni /
analyzed: de la ye shes kyi tshogs ni /
translated: The accumulation of wisdom

original: nang dang / phyi dang / de gnyis ka dang / stong pa dang / chen po dang / don dam pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / mtha' las 'das pa dang / thog ma dang / tha ma med pa dang /
analyzed: nang dang / phyi dang / de gnyis ka dang / stong pa dang / chen po dang / don dam pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / mtha' las 'das pa dang / thog ma dang / tha ma med pa dang /
translated: is inner, outer, both, emptiness, greatness, the ultimate, conditioned, unconditioned, beyond extremes, without beginning or end,

original: dor ba med pa dang / rang bzhin dang / chos thams cad dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang / mi dmigs pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang / rang gi ngo bo dang /
analyzed: dor ba med pa dang / rang bzhin dang / chos thams cad dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang / mi dmigs pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang / rang gi ngo bo dang /
translated: The emptiness of non-rejection, the emptiness of nature, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of individual characteristics, the emptiness of non-observation, the emptiness of the essence of non-things, the emptiness of things and non-things, the emptiness of one’s own nature,

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo stong pa nyid kyi bye brag gis rnam pa nyi shu'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo stong pa nyid kyi bye brag gis rnam pa nyi shu'o //
translated: and the emptiness of the nature of other—these are the twenty aspects.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: nang dang phyi rol rnams dang ni //
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol rnams dang ni //
translated: The inner and outer,🔽The two, the entity of emptiness,🔽The directions, nirvana, the path,🔽Arising from conditions, the opposite,

original: gnyis dang stong pa'i dngos po dang // phyogs dang mya ngan 'das lam dang // rkyen las skyes dang cig shos dang // mtha' 'das thog ma dor ba med //
analyzed: gnyis dang stong pa'i dngos po dang // phyogs dang mya ngan 'das lam dang // rkyen las skyes dang cig shos dang // mtha' 'das thog ma dor ba med //
translated: Beyond extremes, beginningless, non-rejection,🔽Nature, all phenomena,🔽The arising of phenomena, and so on, beyond and so on,🔽Possession, the opposite, essence,🔽Space, emptiness, and so on,

original: rang bzhin dang ni chos kun dang // chos skye la sogs 'das sogs dang // ldan dang cig shos ngo bo dang // mkha' dang stong pa zhes bya dang // chos kyi gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang ni chos kun dang // chos skye la sogs 'das sogs dang // ldan dang cig shos ngo bo dang // mkha' dang stong pa zhes bya dang // chos kyi gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid //
translated: And the nature of other phenomena—

original: rang rang ngo bos stong pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rang rang ngo bos stong pa'i phyir //
translated: Because each is empty of its own essence.

original: stong pa nyid ni nyi shur 'dod //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni nyi shur 'dod //
translated: Emptiness is asserted to be twentyfold.

original: sa'i tshogs la sa gang gi yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ba'i chos gang dag yin pa de dag bstan pa'i phyir bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu rtsa gsum gsungs pa /🔽yongs su sbyong ba rnam bcu yis //
analyzed: sa'i tshogs la sa gang gi yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ba'i chos gang dag yin pa de dag bstan pa'i phyir bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu rtsa gsum gsungs pa / yongs su sbyong ba rnam bcu yis //
translated: In order to teach which dharmas are purified on which level of the accumulations, twenty-three verses are taught.

original: sa ni dang po 'thob 'gyur te //
analyzed: sa ni dang po 'thob 'gyur te //
translated: The first level is attained through ten purifications.🔽The nature of aspiration and benefit,

original: bsam dang phan pa'i dngos nyid dang // sems can rnams la sems mnyam nyid //
analyzed: bsam dang phan pa'i dngos nyid dang // sems can rnams la sems mnyam nyid //
translated: the equality of mind toward sentient beings,🔽giving, relying on spiritual friends,🔽seeking the object of the sublime Dharma,🔽always having the mind of renunciation,🔽desiring the body of the Buddha,

original: gtong dang bshes gnyen sten pa dang // dam chos dmigs pa tshol ba dang // rtag tu nges 'byung sems nyid dang // sangs rgyas skur 'dod dga' ba dang // chos ston pa dang bden pa yi //
analyzed: gtong dang bshes gnyen sten pa dang // dam chos dmigs pa tshol ba dang // rtag tu nges 'byung sems nyid dang // sangs rgyas skur 'dod dga' ba dang // chos ston pa dang bden pa yi //
translated: teaching the Dharma, and the truth

original: tshig ni bcu pa yin par 'dod //🔽'di dag rang bzhin mi dmigs pas //🔽yongs su sbyong bar shes par bya //
analyzed: tshig ni bcu pa yin par 'dod // 'di dag rang bzhin mi dmigs pas // yongs su sbyong bar shes par bya //
translated: are asserted to be the ten words.🔽These are to be known as purifications

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: through the non-observation of intrinsic nature.🔽This is the explanation of the first level.

original: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin gzhi thams cad la gya gyu med pa'i bsam pa dang / rang dang gzhan gyi dgos pa la phan pa nyid dang / sems can thams cad la sems gcig pa nyid dang / bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba dang /🔽dge ba'i @92a * //
analyzed: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin gzhi thams cad la gya gyu med pa'i bsam pa dang / rang dang gzhan gyi dgos pa la phan pa nyid dang / sems can thams cad la sems gcig pa nyid dang / bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba dang / dge ba'i @92a * //
translated: Translation: རིམ་པ་ཇི་ལྟ་བ་བཞིན་དུ་གཞི་ཐམས་ཅད་ལ་གྱ་གྱུ་མེད་པའི་བསམ་པ་དང་། རང་དང་གཞན་གྱི་དགོས་པ་ལ་ཕན་པ་ཉིད་དང་། སེམས་ཅན་ཐམས་ཅད་ལ་སེམས་གཅིག་པ་ཉིད་དང་། བདོག་པ་ཐམས་ཅད་ཡོངས་སུ་གཏོང་བ་དང་།

original: bshes gnyen mgu bar byed pa dang / theg pa gsum du gtogs pa'i dam pa'i chos kyi dmigs pa 'dod pa dang / khyim na gnas pa la mngon par mi dga' ba dang / bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku 'dod pa dang / dam pa'i chos rab tu ston pa dang /🔽bden par smra ba nyid ces bya ba de lta bu'i mtshan nyid kyi chos bcus rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bshes gnyen mgu bar byed pa dang / theg pa gsum du gtogs pa'i dam pa'i chos kyi dmigs pa 'dod pa dang / khyim na gnas pa la mngon par mi dga' ba dang / bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku 'dod pa dang / dam pa'i chos rab tu ston pa dang /🔽bden par smra ba nyid ces bya ba de lta bu'i mtshan nyid kyi chos bcus rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The ten qualities that are to be generated are: (1) the wish to see the spiritual master, (2) the wish to listen to the Dharma, (3) the wish to practice the Dharma, (4) the wish to practice in solitude, (5) the wish to practice meditation, (6) the wish to please the spiritual master, (7) the wish to focus on the sacred Dharma that is included in the three vehicles, (8) the wish to not delight in living at home, (9) the wish for the unsurpassed body of a buddha, and (10) the wish to teach the sacred Dharma.🔽These ten qualities that are to be generated are characterized by the wish to see the spiritual master and so forth.🔽

original: yongs su sbyong ba'i rgyu'i khyad par ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pas khyad par du byas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yongs su sbyong ba dag kho nas sa dang po rab tu dga' ba 'thob pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su sbyong ba'i rgyu'i khyad par ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pas khyad par du byas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yongs su sbyong ba dag kho nas sa dang po rab tu dga' ba 'thob pa yin no //
translated: One attains the first level, that of The Utterly Joyful One, solely through the thorough training in the nature of phenomena, which is the special cause for the thorough training.🔽The thorough training in discipline,🔽gratitude,

original: tshul khrims byas pa gzo dang bzod //
analyzed: tshul khrims byas pa gzo dang bzod //
translated: patience,🔽keen interest,

original: rab tu dga' dang snying brtse che //
analyzed: rab tu dga' dang snying brtse che //
translated: great compassion,🔽respect for teachers,

original: bkur sti bla ma la gus nyan //
analyzed: bkur sti bla ma la gus nyan //
translated: and listening to them,

original: brgyad pa sbyin la sogs la brtson //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: brgyad pa sbyin la sogs la brtson // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and the thorough training in being diligent in generosity and the other transcendent perfections are the eight that are related to the transcendent perfections.

original: dge ba'i chos dang / sems can gyi don bya ba dang / sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / gzhan gyis phan pa byas pa dran pa dang / gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa la sogs pa bzod pa dang / dge ba'i chos sgrub pa la 'gyod pa med pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos dang / sems can gyi don bya ba dang / sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / gzhan gyis phan pa byas pa dran pa dang / gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa la sogs pa bzod pa dang / dge ba'i chos sgrub pa la 'gyod pa med pa dang /
translated: These are the thorough training in positive qualities, in working for the benefit of sentient beings, in the discipline of restraint, in being grateful for any help one has received from others, in being patient with harm that others do and so on, in never having regrets about practicing positive qualities, in being diligent in practicing virtue and in being skilled in the means of resting in meditative concentration.

original: skye bo thams cad la byams pa dang / mkhan po la sogs pa la 'dud pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bstan pa'i chos sgrub pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spro ba zhes bya ba de lta bu'i yongs su sbyong ba snga ma bzhin yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i khyad par rnam pa brgyad kyis sa gnyis pa dri ma med pa 'thob pa yin no //
analyzed: skye bo thams cad la byams pa dang / mkhan po la sogs pa la 'dud pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bstan pa'i chos sgrub pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spro ba zhes bya ba de lta bu'i yongs su sbyong ba snga ma bzhin yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i khyad par rnam pa brgyad kyis sa gnyis pa dri ma med pa 'thob pa yin no //
translated: The second ground is attained through the eight specific purifications, as before: loving kindness toward all beings, respect for abbots and so forth, practicing the Dharma taught by the spiritual master, enthusiasm for the six perfections such as generosity.

original: thos pas mi ngoms nyid dang ni //
analyzed: thos pas mi ngoms nyid dang ni //
translated: Unsatisfied with listening,🔽Giving the Dharma without material motive,🔽purifying all buddhafields,🔽not being discouraged by samsara,

original: zang zing med par chos sbyin dang // sangs rgyas zhing kun sbyong ba dang // 'khor bas yongs su mi skyo dang // ngo tsha khrel yod ces bya ba //🔽rlom med bdag nyid de rnam lnga /
analyzed: zang zing med par chos sbyin dang // sangs rgyas zhing kun sbyong ba dang // 'khor bas yongs su mi skyo dang // ngo tsha khrel yod ces bya ba // rlom med bdag nyid de rnam lnga /
translated: and having a sense of shame and decency.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: These five are the self-assured ones.

original: dam pa'i chos mnyan pas ngoms mi shes pa dang / rnyed pa la sogs pa la mi lta ba'i sems kyis dam pa'i chos rab tu ston pa dang / rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing rten dang brten pa kun du sbyong ba dang / phan btags pa'i sems can mi mthun pa la sogs pa mthong bas yongs su mi skyo ba dang /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos mnyan pas ngoms mi shes pa dang / rnyed pa la sogs pa la mi lta ba'i sems kyis dam pa'i chos rab tu ston pa dang / rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing rten dang brten pa kun du sbyong ba dang / phan btags pa'i sems can mi mthun pa la sogs pa mthong bas yongs su mi skyo ba dang /
translated: They are insatiable in listening to the holy Dharma, they teach the holy Dharma with a mind that does not seek gain and so forth, they purify their own buddhaverse, the place and the inhabitants, and they are not discouraged by seeing sentient beings who are difficult to train and so on.

original: rang dang gzhan la ltos nas mi @92b dge ba'i chos mi byed pa zhes bya ba de lta bu'i yongs su sbyong ba rnam pa lnga po //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan la ltos nas mi @92b dge ba'i chos mi byed pa zhes bya ba de lta bu'i yongs su sbyong ba rnam pa lnga po //
translated: These five kinds of thorough training are to be understood as the causes for the bodhisattvas' realization of the third ground, The Luminous.

original: snga ma bzhin du ngo bo nyid du mi rtog pas yongs su sbyang ba byas pas sa gsum pa 'od byed pa rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du ngo bo nyid du mi rtog pas yongs su sbyang ba byas pas sa gsum pa 'od byed pa rtogs pa yin no //
translated: As before, by thoroughly training in nonconceptuality in its essence, they realize the third ground, The Luminous.

original: nags gnas 'dod chung chog shes pa dang // sbyangs pa yang dag sdom bsten dang // bslab pa yongs su mi gtong dang // 'dod pa rnams la smod pa dang // mya ngan 'das dang bdog kun gtong //
analyzed: nags gnas 'dod chung chog shes pa dang // sbyangs pa yang dag sdom bsten dang // bslab pa yongs su mi gtong dang // 'dod pa rnams la smod pa dang // mya ngan 'das dang bdog kun gtong //
translated: renouncing all,

original: mi zhum pa dang lta ba med //
analyzed: mi zhum pa dang lta ba med //
translated: not being discouraged, and not looking at others.

original: ces bya ba ni /🔽dgon par gnas pa dang / rnyed pa ma thob pa la mngon par 'dod pa med pa dang // rnyed pa thob pa la lhag par don du gnyer ba med pa dang / bsod snyoms pa nyid la sogs pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan yang dag par sdom pa dang /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni / dgon par gnas pa dang / rnyed pa ma thob pa la mngon par 'dod pa med pa dang // rnyed pa thob pa la lhag par don du gnyer ba med pa dang / bsod snyoms pa nyid la sogs pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan yang dag par sdom pa dang /
translated: This is explained as follows.🔽Living in the forest, not aspiring for gain, not pursuing gain, observing pure conduct such as being a beggar,🔽not abandoning the trainings even for the sake of one's life, condemning sense objects by seeing their faults, dedicating disciples to nirvana, giving away all one's possessions,

original: bslab pa blangs pa srog la sogs pa'i phyir yang yongs su mi gtong ba dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan la nyes dmigs su lta bas smod pa dang / gdul bya dang 'tsham par mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol bar byed pa dang / bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba dang /
analyzed: bslab pa blangs pa srog la sogs pa'i phyir yang yongs su mi gtong ba dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan la nyes dmigs su lta bas smod pa dang / gdul bya dang 'tsham par mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol bar byed pa dang / bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba dang /
translated: not being discouraged by the faults of disciples, and not looking at others for the sake of one's own livelihood.

original: dge ba sgrub pa la sems mi zhum pa dang / dngos po thams cad la mi lta ba zhes bya ba de lta bu'i yongs su sbyong ba snga ma lta bu rnam pa bcus sa bzhi pa 'od 'phro ba can gnon pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba sgrub pa la sems mi zhum pa dang / dngos po thams cad la mi lta ba zhes bya ba de lta bu'i yongs su sbyong ba snga ma lta bu rnam pa bcus sa bzhi pa 'od 'phro ba can gnon pa yin no //
translated: The fourth ground, The Radiant, is attained by ten aspects of thorough training, such as not being discouraged in accomplishing virtue and not being concerned with material things.🔽Familiarity, attachment to home,

original: 'dris dang khyim la 'khren pa dang // 'du 'dzir gyur pa'i gnas dang ni //
analyzed: 'dris dang khyim la 'khren pa dang // 'du 'dzir gyur pa'i gnas dang ni //
translated: and dwelling in a place of distraction,🔽praising oneself, disparaging others,🔽the ten nonvirtuous actions,🔽conceit from pride, error,

original: bdag bstod gzhan la brnyas pa dang // mi dge'i las kyi lam bcu dang // rlom pas khengs dang phyin ci log / blo ngan dang ni nyon mongs bzod //
analyzed: bdag bstod gzhan la brnyas pa dang // mi dge'i las kyi lam bcu dang // rlom pas khengs dang phyin ci log / blo ngan dang ni nyon mongs bzod //
translated: bad thoughts, and the afflictions,

original: bcu po 'di ni rnam spangs na //
analyzed: bcu po 'di ni rnam spangs na //
translated: having completely abandoned these ten,

original: sa lnga pa ni yang dag 'thob //
analyzed: sa lnga pa ni yang dag 'thob //
translated: one attains the fifth ground.

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: This is stated in the following:

original: rnyed pa la sogs pa'i don du rab tu byung ba la sogs pa dang 'grogs pa dang / dad pa can gyi khyim nye bar mi ston pa dang / skye bo mang po'i grong la sogs pa dang / bdag la bsngags pa dang / gzhan la smod pa dang /
analyzed: rnyed pa la sogs pa'i don du rab tu byung ba la sogs pa dang 'grogs pa dang / dad pa can gyi khyim nye bar mi ston pa dang / skye bo mang po'i grong la sogs pa dang / bdag la bsngags pa dang / gzhan la smod pa dang /
translated: Associating with those who have gone forth for the sake of material gain and so on, not showing the faithful one’s home, dwelling in a place of many people and so on, praising oneself, disparaging others,

original: mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu dang / thos pa la sogs pas rlom zhing gzhan la mi 'dud pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba la bzlog ste mngon par zhen pa dang / log par lta ba la sogs pa blo gros ngan pa dang /
