original: gang gis sangs rgyas sar gnas pa //🔽de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa //
analyzed: gang gis sangs rgyas sar gnas pa // de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa //
translated: abides on the ground of buddhahood.🔽That is to be understood as the

original: bcu pa yin par shes par bya //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bcu pa yin par shes par bya // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: bodhisattva’s tenth ground.🔽The six grounds of śrāvakas and so on are the lineage of śrāvakas, the lineage of pratyekabuddhas, and the lineage of buddhas; the four grounds of entering the result, the result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner, and the result of nonreturner; and the result of arhat.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs dang / 'bras bu dang po la zhugs pa dang / rgyun tu zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid ces bya ba drug dang / tshul gsum rnam par bzhag par dgongs pas bsdus pa lhag ma zhugs pa gsum dang /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs dang / 'bras bu dang po la zhugs pa dang / rgyun tu zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid ces bya ba drug dang / tshul gsum rnam par bzhag par dgongs pas bsdus pa lhag ma zhugs pa gsum dang /
translated: The three remaining grounds are the three grounds of enterer that are included in the intention of the presentation of the three vehicles.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams go rims bzhin du /
translated: The grounds of pratyekabuddhas are as follows.

original: rigs dang / brgyad pa dang / mthong ba dang / bsrabs pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / byas pa rtogs pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa rnams dang / ji skad bshad pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnam pa dgu po gcig kho na ste /
analyzed: rigs dang / brgyad pa dang / mthong ba dang / bsrabs pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / byas pa rtogs pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa rnams dang / ji skad bshad pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnam pa dgu po gcig kho na ste /
translated: The stages are the stage of the lineage, the eighth stage, the stage of seeing, the stage of thinning, the stage of separation from passion, the stage of ending, the stage of the śrāvaka, the stage of the pratyekabuddha, and the one stage of the bodhisattva as previously explained.

original: de ltar sa dgu 'das nas sa bcu pa la ni byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kho nar brjod par bya'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni ma yin no //🔽zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar sa dgu 'das nas sa bcu pa la ni byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kho nar brjod par bya'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni ma yin no // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: After passing beyond these nine stages, on the tenth stage the bodhisattva is called a buddha, but not a perfect buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa de la smon lam shes pa gang gis gnas pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa yin par shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa de la smon lam shes pa gang gis gnas pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa yin par shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: The stage of the buddha is the tenth stage of the bodhisattva, on which he is called a bodhisattva by reason of his vow and knowledge.

original: gnyen po'i tshogs la bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: gnyen po'i tshogs la bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: An intermediate verse on the collection of antidotes

original: mthong dang goms pa'i lam dag la //
analyzed: mthong dang goms pa'i lam dag la //
translated: On the paths of seeing and cultivation,

original: gzung dang 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog rnams //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog rnams //
translated: the discriminations of subject and object

original: nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: For the sake of complete pacification,

original: gnyen po rnam pa brgyad ces bya //
analyzed: gnyen po rnam pa brgyad ces bya //
translated: there are eight kinds of antidotes.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos po tsam dang gnyen po'i @95a * //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos po tsam dang gnyen po'i @95a * //
translated: The two kinds of concepts of the apprehended are the basis of the mere entity of defilement and the basis of the antidote.

original: rten can gnyis dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang zag rdzas su yod pa dang skyes bu btags pa'i rten can gnyis so sor mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam la spong bas /
analyzed: rten can gnyis dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang zag rdzas su yod pa dang skyes bu btags pa'i rten can gnyis so sor mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam la spong bas /
translated: The two kinds of concepts of the apprehender are the basis of the substantial person and the basis of the imputed person. By abandoning these eight concepts of the apprehended and the apprehender on the path of seeing and the path of meditation,

original: bzung ba dang 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa brgyad nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bzung ba dang 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa brgyad nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: for the sake of completely pacifying the eight concepts of the apprehended and the apprehender,

original: bden pa gnyis ka'i rnam pa la brten nas mngon du bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rab tu dbye bas lam gnyis po kho na'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par gnyen po rnam pa brgyad do //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis ka'i rnam pa la brten nas mngon du bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rab tu dbye bas lam gnyis po kho na'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par gnyen po rnam pa brgyad do //
translated: there are eight kinds of antidotes, which are the specific states of the two paths alone, based on the aspects of the two truths.

original: de ltar tshogs bsags pa la nges par 'byung bas bzhi pa nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa /
analyzed: de ltar tshogs bsags pa la nges par 'byung bas bzhi pa nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa /
translated: Thus, the fourth chapter on the accomplishment of definite emergence is the definite emergence of the accumulation of the collections.

original: ched du bya dang mnyam nyid dang // sems can don dang 'bad med dang // mtha' las 'das par nges 'byung dang // thob pa'i mtshan nyid nges 'byung dang // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen nyid dang // lam gyi yul can nges 'byung ste //
analyzed: ched du bya dang mnyam nyid dang // sems can don dang 'bad med dang // mtha' las 'das par nges 'byung dang // thob pa'i mtshan nyid nges 'byung dang // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen nyid dang // lam gyi yul can nges 'byung ste //
translated: definite emergence with the path as its object.🔽This is definite emergence

original: rnam pa brgyad kyi bdag nyid 'di //🔽nges 'byung bsgrub pa yin zhes bya //
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad kyi bdag nyid 'di // nges 'byung bsgrub pa yin zhes bya //
translated: with a nature of eight aspects.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said.

original: ched du bya ba ji skad bshad pa dang / chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid dang / sems can gyi don phyad par byed pa dang / mtshan ma med par thams cad byed pa nyid kyis lhun gyis grub pa dang / rtag pa dang chad pa dang bral ba'i ngo bo'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par dang /
analyzed: ched du bya ba ji skad bshad pa dang / chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid dang / sems can gyi don phyad par byed pa dang / mtshan ma med par thams cad byed pa nyid kyis lhun gyis grub pa dang / rtag pa dang chad pa dang bral ba'i ngo bo'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par dang /
translated: The purpose is as explained, the sameness of all phenomena, the benefit for sentient beings, the effortless performance of everything by being without signs, the state of the nature free from eternalism and nihilism,

original: theg pa gsum gyi don thams cad 'thob pa dang / ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / de'i khyad par gyi lam ste /
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyi don thams cad 'thob pa dang / ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / de'i khyad par gyi lam ste /
translated: Because there is no other doctrine superior to these bases of the three vehicles, which are the bases of the three vehicles, the attainment of all the goals of the three vehicles, the knowledge of all aspects as it has been explained, and the special path to that, for the purpose of renunciation, one should renounce all things by not apprehending anything.

original: nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i gzhi de lta bu dag las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos gzhan med pa'i phyir thams cad mi dmigs pa nyid kyis nges par 'byung ba rnam pa brgyad yin pas nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa ni rnam pa brgyad yin no //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan ces bya ba las /
analyzed: nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i gzhi de lta bu dag las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos gzhan med pa'i phyir thams cad mi dmigs pa nyid kyis nges par 'byung ba rnam pa brgyad yin pas nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa ni rnam pa brgyad yin no // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan ces bya ba las /
translated: Thus, the practice of renunciation is eightfold, because renunciation is eightfold.

original: skabs dang po'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: skabs dang po'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary to the first chapter of the Treatise on the Ornament of Clear Realization, the Ornament of the Perfection of Wisdom, called “The Ground of Perfect Joy.”

original: // / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtogs pa ni lam shes pa nyid yongs su shes pa med na med pas lam shes pa nyid /
analyzed: // / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtogs pa ni lam shes pa nyid yongs su shes pa med na med pas lam shes pa nyid /
translated: The realization of the knowledge of all aspects is not without the knowledge of the path. Therefore, the knowledge of the path

original: lha rnams rung bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: lha rnams rung bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: is taught for the sake of the gods.

original: 'od kyis mog mog por mdzad dang // yul nges pa dang khyab pa dang // rang bzhin dang ni de yi las //
analyzed: 'od kyis mog mog por mdzad dang // yul nges pa dang khyab pa dang // rang bzhin dang ni de yi las //
translated: The light of the Tathagatas obscures the light of the gods, etc.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The light of the Tathagatas obscures the light of the gods, etc.

original: lam @95b shes pa nyid skye bar rung ba nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lam @95b shes pa nyid skye bar rung ba nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to establish the suitability of the arising of the knowledge of the path,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od dag gi sa lha la sogs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'od mog mog por mdzad pa ni nga rgyal bcom pa'i rgyud kho na la rtogs pa skye'o zhes bya bar shes par bya ba'i phyir mdzad de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od dag gi sa lha la sogs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'od mog mog por mdzad pa ni nga rgyal bcom pa'i rgyud kho na la rtogs pa skye'o zhes bya bar shes par bya ba'i phyir mdzad de /
translated: the light of the Tathagatas obscures the light of the gods, etc. that is the result of evolution of the gods, etc. This is done in order to generate understanding in just those who have conquered pride.

original: de'i phyir tshig zur gyis rten brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig zur gyis rten brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the basis is indirectly mentioned.

original: de yang byang chub tu sems bskyed pa kho na yin pas yul so sor nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang byang chub tu sems bskyed pa kho na yin pas yul so sor nges pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is individually determined in terms of the object, because it is only the generation of the mind of enlightenment.

original: theg pa gsum rnam par bzhag pa ni dgongs pa can yin gyi /
analyzed: theg pa gsum rnam par bzhag pa ni dgongs pa can yin gyi /
translated: The presentation of the three vehicles is intentional.

original: mtshan nyid pa ni ma yin no zhes lugs las 'byung bas skye bo thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi mthar thug pa can yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid pa ni ma yin no zhes lugs las 'byung bas skye bo thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi mthar thug pa can yin te /
translated: Thus, all beings are destined for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / cig shos kyi rnal 'byor pas kyang sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir lam shes pa nyid bsgom par bya ba yin pas khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / cig shos kyi rnal 'byor pas kyang sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir lam shes pa nyid bsgom par bya ba yin pas khyab pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that the yogi/nis who are free from attachment and those who are not free from attachment should cultivate the knowledge of the path in order to attain buddhahood.

original: byang chub sems bskyed pa ni 'khor ba ji srid par sems can gyi don byed par zhugs pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems bskyed pa ni 'khor ba ji srid par sems can gyi don byed par zhugs pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin yin no //
translated: The generation of the Thought of Enlightenment is the nature of the bodhisattva, because it is the entrance into the performance of the aims of sentient beings for as long as the world exists, and because it is not the abandonment of the addictions in every way.

original: de'i 'og tu de lta bu'i rang bzhin can gyi las ni yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa dang shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pas sems can yongs su ma bsdus pa yongs su sdud pa la sogs pa yin pas byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de lta bu'i rang bzhin can gyi las ni yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa dang shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pas sems can yongs su ma bsdus pa yongs su sdud pa la sogs pa yin pas byed pa yin no //
translated: After that, such karma does not manifest the limit of reality, but it is active because it gathers sentient beings not yet gathered by means of wisdom and skill in means.

original: de ltar rten la sogs pa brjod nas lam shes pa nyid kyi skabs su lam thams cad rdzogs par bya dgos pas /
analyzed: de ltar rten la sogs pa brjod nas lam shes pa nyid kyi skabs su lam thams cad rdzogs par bya dgos pas /
translated: Having thus described the basis and so forth, since all paths must be completed in the context of knowledge of paths,

original: nyan thos kyi lam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam /
translated: the path of the śrāvakas🔽is taught in the line:

original: lam shes nyid kyi tshul la ni //🔽'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dag gi //
analyzed: lam shes nyid kyi tshul la ni // 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dag gi //
translated: In the system of knowledge of paths,🔽the path of the śrāvakas is to be known🔽through the nonobservation of the aspects

original: rnam pa mi dmigs sgo nas ni //🔽nyan thos lam 'di shes par bya //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam pa mi dmigs sgo nas ni // nyan thos lam 'di shes par bya // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: of the four noble truths.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i go rims bzhin du /
translated: Here, in order, the truth of suffering is taught to be impermanent,

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa ste /
translated: suffering, empty, and selfless.

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid zhi ba'i rnam pa bzhi dag dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid dang / nad dang / 'bras dang / zug rngu dang /
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid zhi ba'i rnam pa bzhi dag dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid dang / nad dang / 'bras dang / zug rngu dang /
translated: the aspect of peace, the aspect of the truth of origin, the aspect of origin, the aspect of full arising, the aspect of condition, the aspect of disease, the aspect of boil, the aspect of pricking pain,

original: sdig pa'i rnam pa rnams dang / yid 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba dang / 'gog @96a * //🔽pa'i phyir zhugs pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sdig pa'i rnam pa rnams dang / yid 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba dang / 'gog @96a * // pa'i phyir zhugs pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: the aspect of the sinful, the aspect of disgust, the aspect of freedom from attachment and the aspect of entry to cessation.🔽The aspects of the truths of suffering and origin are the four aspects of their characteristics:🔽the aspect of peace, the aspect of the truth of origin, the aspect of origin and the aspect of full arising.🔽The aspects of the truths of cessation and path are the four aspects of their nature:🔽the aspect of condition, the aspect of disease, the aspect of boil and the aspect of pricking pain.🔽The aspects of the truths of suffering and origin are the four aspects of their nature:

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa de dag nyid so so'i yid 'byung ba dag gi mtshan nyid kyi pha rol dang 'jig pa'i chos can gyi rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid dag dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dag gi ngo bo g-yo ba dang rab tu 'jig pa'i rnam pa dag dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa de dag nyid so so'i yid 'byung ba dag gi mtshan nyid kyi pha rol dang 'jig pa'i chos can gyi rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid dag dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dag gi ngo bo g-yo ba dang rab tu 'jig pa'i rnam pa dag dang /
translated: the aspect of the sinful, the aspect of disgust, the aspect of freedom from attachment and the aspect of entry to cessation.

original: 'gog pa'i rang gi ngo bo 'jigs pa dang nad 'go ba dang 'tshe ba'i rnam pa rnams dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa'i 'gog pa'i rang gi ngo bo bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang gya nom pa'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid dben pa dang /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i rang gi ngo bo 'jigs pa dang nad 'go ba dang 'tshe ba'i rnam pa rnams dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa'i 'gog pa'i rang gi ngo bo bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang gya nom pa'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid dben pa dang /
translated: The nature of cessation is the aspects of fear, the onset of illness, and harm.🔽The nature of the truth of cessation is the identity of emptiness, freedom, and peace, and the aspects of the characteristics of definite emergence, namely, emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, and the absence of formation.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa dang mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i rnam pa dag dang / lam gyi bden pa'i lam dang / rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa rnams /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa dang mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i rnam pa dag dang / lam gyi bden pa'i lam dang / rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa rnams /
translated: The aspects of the truth of the path are the path, appropriateness, accomplishment, and definite emergence.

original: ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas lam shes pa nyid kyi skabs su nyan thos rnams kyi lam yin par byang chub sems dpas de ltar yongs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas lam shes pa nyid kyi skabs su nyan thos rnams kyi lam yin par byang chub sems dpas de ltar yongs su shes par bya'o //
translated: In the context of the knowledge of the path, the bodhisattvas should fully understand that the path of the hearers is the path that leads to the cessation of the suffering of the three realms.

original: bden pa bzhi yongs su shes pa ni /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi yongs su shes pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of the four truths is as follows.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rtogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pas lam brjod nas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rtogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pas lam brjod nas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa /
translated: Since the factors conducive to penetrative insight are preceded by the realization of the four truths, after the path, the factors conducive to penetrative insight are mentioned.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos lam la ni //🔽gzugs la sogs pa stong pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos lam la ni // gzugs la sogs pa stong pa'i phyir //
translated: The noble listeners’ path🔽is the realization of the four truths.🔽Since form and so on are empty,

original: stong pa nyid rnams dbyer med pas //
analyzed: stong pa nyid rnams dbyer med pas //
translated: emptiness is indivisible.

original: dro ba de dag mi dmigs pas //
analyzed: dro ba de dag mi dmigs pas //
translated: Since heat is the nonobservation of that,

original: rtse mor gyur pa dag tu 'dod //🔽de la rtag la sogs tshul gyis //
analyzed: rtse mor gyur pa dag tu 'dod // de la rtag la sogs tshul gyis //
translated: it is held to be the peak.🔽The acceptance of phenomena is explained to be🔽the supreme mundane state🔽through the method of abiding in permanence and so on,

original: gnas pa bkag pas bzod pa rnams //
analyzed: gnas pa bkag pas bzod pa rnams //
translated: which is the negation of impermanence and so on.🔽The supreme mundane state is explained to be🔽the acceptance of phenomena

original: sa bcu dag las brtsams nas ni //
analyzed: sa bcu dag las brtsams nas ni //
translated: that arises from the ten levels

original: mi gnas rgyas par bstan pa yis //🔽chos kyi mchog tu 'gyur bshad de //
analyzed: mi gnas rgyas par bstan pa yis // chos kyi mchog tu 'gyur bshad de //
translated: and is taught extensively as nonabiding.

original: ci phyir zhe na sangs rgyas kyis //
analyzed: ci phyir zhe na sangs rgyas kyis //
translated: Why is that? Because the Buddha,

original: mkhyen nas chos rnams ma gzigs phyir //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: mkhyen nas chos rnams ma gzigs phyir //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: having known, did not see phenomena.🔽The explanation of the factors conducive to penetrative insight is complete.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rang rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir stong pa nyid rnams phan tshun tha dad pa med pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du mi dmigs pa dang de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa la rtag pa'ang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin no zhes dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas pa bkag pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rang rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir stong pa nyid rnams phan tshun tha dad pa med pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du mi dmigs pa dang de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa la rtag pa'ang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin no zhes dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas pa bkag pa dang /

analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo gnyug ma rang bzhin kho nas stong pa nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang mnyam pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi 'bras bu de bzhin gshegs pa nyid 'thob pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par gnyen po rnams rnam pa thams cad du bsdus pa dang /
translated: The essence of form and so on is empty by its very nature, the attainment of the Tathagata is the result of the roots of virtue that are equal to the dharmadhatu, and the paramita of wisdom includes all the antidotes.

original: de nyid kyis phyi dang nang gi 'tshe ba rab tu zhi ba zhes bya ba de lta bu ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis phyi dang nang gi 'tshe ba rab tu zhi ba zhes bya ba de lta bu ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa dag yin no //
translated: The pacification of all harm to the outer and inner is the aspect of the truth of cessation.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa sgom pa kho nas gzugs la sogs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par zhen pa zhi ba dang / shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pa la zhugs pa la sangs rgyas rnams kyis bsrung ba dang bskyab pa dang sba ba dag mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa sgom pa kho nas gzugs la sogs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par zhen pa zhi ba dang / shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pa la zhugs pa la sangs rgyas rnams kyis bsrung ba dang bskyab pa dang sba ba dag mdzad pa dang /
translated: The pacification of clinging to form and so on and to nirvana through the meditation on the absence of nature, the protection, guarding and concealment of the buddhas for those who are skilled in wisdom and means,

original: sangs rgyas nyid mngon par 'dod pas bdag nyid srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas nas de nyid la gzhan dag 'god pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa mi zad par byed 'dod pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya @98b ba de lta bu ni lam gyi bden pa'i rnam pa dag yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid mngon par 'dod pas bdag nyid srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas nas de nyid la gzhan dag 'god pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa mi zad par byed 'dod pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya @98b ba de lta bu ni lam gyi bden pa'i rnam pa dag yin te /
translated: Since one desires to manifest buddhahood, one should abandon taking life and so on, and one should establish others in omniscience itself and one should dedicate to complete enlightenment the desire to make generosity and so on inexhaustible.

original: de lta bu ni lam shes pa nyid kyi skad cig ma dag yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni lam shes pa nyid kyi skad cig ma dag yin no //
translated: Such are the aspects of the truth of path.

original: kha cig ni 'dir tshig le'ur byas pa'i don nye bar mtshon pa lhur len pa'i gzhung gis rnam pa'i don ma bshad par mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma bcu drug nye bar mtshon pa nyi tshe mdzad pa zad de /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'dir tshig le'ur byas pa'i don nye bar mtshon pa lhur len pa'i gzhung gis rnam pa'i don ma bshad par mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma bcu drug nye bar mtshon pa nyi tshe mdzad pa zad de /
translated: Some see that the meaning of the aspects is not explained here in the treatise that emphasizes the illustration of the meaning of the verses, and so they conclude that only the illustration of the sixteen moments of the path of seeing is presented here.

original: bshad pa dang ma bshad pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa'i don gyi tshig le'ur byas pa rnams su'ang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bshad pa dang ma bshad pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa'i don gyi tshig le'ur byas pa rnams su'ang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: And in the verses of the meaning of the factors conducive to penetrations, etc., which are explained and not explained, one should see it in the same way.

original: gzhan dag na re de dag gis ni bsgom pa'i rim pa la sogs pa ma bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de dag gis ni bsgom pa'i rim pa la sogs pa ma bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Others say: They do not teach the stages of meditation, etc.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i rim pa cung zad kyang ma bstan to //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i rim pa cung zad kyang ma bstan to //
translated: Therefore, they do not teach even a little of the stages of realization.

original: gzhan yang dmigs pa dang ni rnam pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i don kyang ji ltar drang zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang dmigs pa dang ni rnam pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i don kyang ji ltar drang zhes zer ro //
translated: Moreover, how do they interpret the meaning of the verse beginning, “With reference to the object and aspect”?

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi mjug thogs su bsgom pa'i lam brjod par bya ba yin pa las /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi mjug thogs su bsgom pa'i lam brjod par bya ba yin pa las /
translated: After the path of seeing, the path of meditation should be explained.

original: brjod par bya ba nyung ba nyid dang gdul bya 'bras bu la gzhol ba nyid du zhugs pa'i phyir re zhig de'i byed pa /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba nyung ba nyid dang gdul bya 'bras bu la gzhol ba nyid du zhugs pa'i phyir re zhig de'i byed pa /
translated: But because there is little to be said and because trainees are engaged in striving for the result, the function of that path is stated first:

original: kun nas zhi dang thams cad la //
analyzed: kun nas zhi dang thams cad la //
translated: Complete pacification and all

original: 'dud dang nyon mongs las rgyal dang / gnod pas brdzi ba med nyid dang // byang chub dang ni rten mchod nyid //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te ;🔽rnam pa thams cad du sems la rang dbang nyid du byed pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa skye bo thams cad la 'dud pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa zil gyis gnon pa dang / pha rol gyis byas pa'i gnod pa rjes su sgrub pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid dang /🔽yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sgrub pa dang / rten gyi yul mchod par bya ba nyid du byed pa zhes bya ba byed pa rnam pa drug yin no //
analyzed: 'dud dang nyon mongs las rgyal dang / gnod pas brdzi ba med nyid dang // byang chub dang ni rten mchod nyid // ces bya ba gsungs te ; rnam pa thams cad du sems la rang dbang nyid du byed pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa skye bo thams cad la 'dud pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa zil gyis gnon pa dang / pha rol gyis byas pa'i gnod pa rjes su sgrub pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sgrub pa dang / rten gyi yul mchod par bya ba nyid du byed pa zhes bya ba byed pa rnam pa drug yin no //
translated: 1. bowing, 2. conquering the addictions, 3. being unassailable by harm, 4. enlightenment, and 5. worship of the support.🔽🔽These are the six functions.🔽1. One has complete control over one's mind in every respect. 2. One bows to all beings, such as the spiritual teacher. 3. One conquers attachment, etc. 4. One is not a fit object for harm done by others.🔽5. One accomplishes perfect enlightenment. 6. One makes the support, the body, an object of worship.🔽

original: byed pa'i 'og tu bsgom pa'i lam ste /🔽de yang zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: byed pa'i 'og tu bsgom pa'i lam ste /🔽de yang zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //

original: de'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam zag pa dang bcas pa mos pa dang / bsngo ba dang rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa zhes bya ba rnams kyi nang nas bsgom pa'i lam dang po mos pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam zag pa dang bcas pa mos pa dang / bsngo ba dang rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa zhes bya ba rnams kyi nang nas bsgom pa'i lam dang po mos pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ba /
translated: Therefore, from among the mental contemplations of the contaminated path of meditation, aspiration, dedication and rejoicing, the first path of meditation is called mental contemplation of aspiration.

original: mos pa rang gi don dang ni //
analyzed: mos pa rang gi don dang ni //
translated: Aspiration is for one's own purpose,🔽for one's own and others' purpose, for others' purpose,

original: rang gzhan don dang gzhan don dang // rnam gsum shes bya de yang ni //
analyzed: rang gzhan don dang gzhan don dang // rnam gsum shes bya de yang ni //
translated: and for the three, and it is also

original: @99a * // chung dang 'bring dang chen po ste //
analyzed: @99a * // chung dang 'bring dang chen po ste //
translated: small, medium and great.

original: so sor rnam pa gsum du 'dod //🔽chung ngu'i chung sogs dbye ba yis //
analyzed: so sor rnam pa gsum du 'dod // chung ngu'i chung sogs dbye ba yis //
translated: Each is asserted to have three types,🔽and each is divided into small, medium and great,🔽making nine.

original: de yang rnam gsum de ltar na //
analyzed: de yang rnam gsum de ltar na //
translated: Since each of those is also divided into small, medium and great,

original: rnam pa nyi shu bdun du 'dod //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu bdun du 'dod //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: there are twenty seven types.

original: rang dang gnyis ka dang gzhan gyi don la dmigs pa nyid ji ltar mos pa bzhin mthong ba'i dge ba'i chos kyi rten yin na yang bsgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas pa las dang por mngon du mi byed pa'i ngo bo yang rnam pa gsum mo //🔽de dag kyang re re zhing chung ngu la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum yin la /
analyzed: rang dang gnyis ka dang gzhan gyi don la dmigs pa nyid ji ltar mos pa bzhin mthong ba'i dge ba'i chos kyi rten yin na yang bsgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas pa las dang por mngon du mi byed pa'i ngo bo yang rnam pa gsum mo // de dag kyang re re zhing chung ngu la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum yin la /
translated: The path of meditation is not the first to manifest, but is the basis of the virtuous qualities that are the basis of the path of meditation.🔽The path of meditation is also threefold in terms of the basis, in terms of the object of observation, and in terms of the subjective aspect.🔽Each of those is threefold, in terms of lesser, etc., distinctions.

original: de yang so sor chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum yin te /
analyzed: de yang so sor chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum yin te /
translated: And each of those is threefold, in terms of the distinctions of lesser, lesser, etc.

original: de ltar na dgu tshan gsum gyis mos pa rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: de ltar na dgu tshan gsum gyis mos pa rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun no //
translated: Thus, there are twenty-seven aspects of aspiration in three groups of nine.

original: de sgom pa'i byang chub sems dpa' spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de sgom pa'i byang chub sems dpa' spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to encourage the bodhisattva who is cultivating those,

original: de ltar mos pa la sangs rgyas la sogs pas bstod pa la sogs pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de ltar mos pa la sangs rgyas la sogs pas bstod pa la sogs pa mdzad do //
translated: the buddhas, etc., praise, etc., those who aspire in that way.

original: zhes bstod pa dang bkur ba dang bsngags pa /
analyzed: zhes bstod pa dang bkur ba dang bsngags pa /
translated: Praise, honor, and acclaim

original: shes rab pha rol phyin pa la //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin pa la //
translated: in the perfection of wisdom

original: mos pa'i gnas skabs rnams la ni //
analyzed: mos pa'i gnas skabs rnams la ni //
translated: in the stages of aspiration

original: dgu tshan gsum gyis bstod pa dang // bkur ba dang ni bsngags par 'dod //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dgu tshan gsum gyis bstod pa dang // bkur ba dang ni bsngags par 'dod // ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: One wishes to praise, honor, and extol the one who has entered the perfection of wisdom, the reality of the Dharma, as much as one can.

original: ji ltar mos pa bzhin mthong ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhugs pa'i mos pa yid la byed pa dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar mos pa bzhin mthong ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhugs pa'i mos pa yid la byed pa dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa ste /
translated: The first, second, and third mental attentions are the attentions of aspiration, which is the wish to see the reality of the Dharma as much as one can.

original: gnas skabs dgu dag tu so sor rnam pa dgus go rims bzhin du gong nas gong du mngon par dga' bar byed cing bstod pa dang / bkur ba dang / bsngags par 'dod de des na bstod pa la sogs pa 'di dag ni don yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can yin gyi gcam bu'i ngo bo ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs dgu dag tu so sor rnam pa dgus go rims bzhin du gong nas gong du mngon par dga' bar byed cing bstod pa dang / bkur ba dang / bsngags par 'dod de des na bstod pa la sogs pa 'di dag ni don yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can yin gyi gcam bu'i ngo bo ni ma yin no //
translated: In nine stages, one has nine different types of attention, which are progressively more exalted. One wishes to praise, honor, and extol the one who has entered the perfection of wisdom, the reality of the Dharma, as much as one can. Therefore, these praises and so forth have the characteristic of realizing the perfect meaning as it is, and they are not of the nature of flattery.

original: de ltar mos pa la bsngo ba 'byung bas gnyis pa bsngo ba yid la byed pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: de ltar mos pa la bsngo ba 'byung bas gnyis pa bsngo ba yid la byed pa zhes bya ba /
translated: Thus, since dedication arises from aspiration, the second is called the mental attention of dedication.

original: yongs su bsngo ba khyad par can //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba khyad par can //
translated: The special dedication

original: de yi byed pa mchog yin no //🔽de ni dmigs med rnam pa can //
analyzed: de yi byed pa mchog yin no // de ni dmigs med rnam pa can //
translated: This is its supreme function.🔽It has the aspect of nonapprehension.

original: phyin ci ma log mtshan nyid do //🔽dben dang sangs rgyas bsod nams tshogs //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log mtshan nyid do // dben dang sangs rgyas bsod nams tshogs //
translated: It has the characteristic of nonerror.🔽It is the domain of mindfulness of the Buddha’s virtue,

original: rang bzhin dran pa'i spyod yul can //
analyzed: rang bzhin dran pa'i spyod yul can //
translated: the accumulation of merit, and the nature of emptiness.🔽It is the absence of signs, together with the means.🔽It is rejoicing in the buddhas,🔽and not belonging to the three realms.

original: thabs bcas mtshan ma med pa dang // sangs rgyas rjes su yi rang dang // khams gsum @99b gtogs pa ma yin dang // chung dang 'bring dang chen po yi //
analyzed: thabs bcas mtshan ma med pa dang // sangs rgyas rjes su yi rang dang // khams gsum @99b gtogs pa ma yin dang // chung dang 'bring dang chen po yi //
translated: It is the dedication of the small, middling, and great.

original: bsngo ba gzhan ni rnam gsum po //
analyzed: bsngo ba gzhan ni rnam gsum po //
translated: It is the other three kinds of dedication.

original: bsod nams che 'byung bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bsod nams che 'byung bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of the arising of great merit.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i mos pa khyad par can dang / mi dmigs pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa dang / dben pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs kyi rang bzhin dran pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i mos pa khyad par can dang / mi dmigs pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa dang / dben pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs kyi rang bzhin dran pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa dang bcas pa dang /
translated: It is the special interest as it has been explained, nonapprehension, nonerror, solitude, the nature of the mindfulness of the roots of virtue of the Tathāgata’s accumulation of merit, together with skillful means, and the absence of signs.

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba dang / khams gsum par ma gtogs pa dang / chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba dang / khams gsum par ma gtogs pa dang / chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po ste /
translated: the small, the medium and the great.

original: bsod nams chen po 'byung ba zhes bya ba de ltar ming du btags pa'i yid la byed pa go rims bzhin du bla na med pa'i byang chub dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po dang / sngo bar byed pa'i sems dang / bdag la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i dngos po dang /
analyzed: bsod nams chen po 'byung ba zhes bya ba de ltar ming du btags pa'i yid la byed pa go rims bzhin du bla na med pa'i byang chub dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po dang / sngo bar byed pa'i sems dang / bdag la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i dngos po dang /
translated: The mental attention that is designated by the name 'arising of great merit' is, respectively, the non-apprehension of the unsurpassed enlightenment, the aggregates of morality, etc., the mind of dedication, the entity endowed with self, etc.,

original: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi dge ba dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa dang / mtshan ma dang / lam thams cad dang / 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams dang / dge ba bcu la sogs pa'i las kyi lam dang / rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi dge ba dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa dang / mtshan ma dang / lam thams cad dang / 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams dang / dge ba bcu la sogs pa'i las kyi lam dang / rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa dang /
translated: the virtue of the Buddhas of the three times, generosity, etc., the sign, all paths, the realms of desire, etc., the paths of action such as the ten virtues, the stream-enterer, etc.,

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub la gnas pa rnams mi dmigs pa la dmigs pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub la gnas pa rnams mi dmigs pa la dmigs pa /
translated: and the abiders in the unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: theg pa gsum gyis gdul bar bya ba'i sems can la lam nye bar ston pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo byed pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis sems can thams cad kyi don du mi zad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyis gdul bar bya ba'i sems can la lam nye bar ston pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo byed pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis sems can thams cad kyi don du mi zad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: They are endowed with the causal essence of revealing the path to sentient beings who are to be trained by the three vehicles.🔽

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo ba rnam pa bcu gnyis byed do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo ba rnam pa bcu gnyis byed do //
translated: Those who have the nature of causes for teaching the path to sentient beings to be trained by the three vehicles, for the sake of all sentient beings, dedicate in twelve ways to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment in order to make them inexhaustible.

original: de ltar legs par bsngos pa'i dngos po mngon par spel bar bya ba yin pas gsum pa rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: de ltar legs par bsngos pa'i dngos po mngon par spel bar bya ba yin pas gsum pa rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa zhes bya ba /
translated: Thus, the thing that is well dedicated should be increased. The third mental contemplation is called rejoicing.

original: thabs dang mi dmigs pa dag gis //
analyzed: thabs dang mi dmigs pa dag gis //
translated: Through method and non-apprehension,

original: dge ba'i rtsa la yi rang ba //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa la yi rang ba //
translated: rejoicing in the roots of virtue,

original: rjes su yi rang yid byed pa //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang yid byed pa //
translated: the mental contemplation of rejoicing

original: bsgom pa yin par 'dir brjod do //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bsgom pa yin par 'dir brjod do // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: is said to be the meditation here.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i sems kyis kun rdzob tu thabs kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dmigs nas don dam par mi dmigs pa nyid kyis rjes su yi rang bar bya ba dag yin no //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i sems kyis kun rdzob tu thabs kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dmigs nas don dam par mi dmigs pa nyid kyis rjes su yi rang bar bya ba dag yin no //
translated: With a very joyful mind, one should rejoice in the roots of virtue by means of the conventional method and by means of the ultimate non-apprehension.

original: de la bsdus pa'i don ni mos pa yid la byed pas ni 'byung khungs dag nas gser @100a * //🔽gyi gar bu bzhin du bsod nams mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: de la bsdus pa'i don ni mos pa yid la byed pas ni 'byung khungs dag nas gser @100a * // gyi gar bu bzhin du bsod nams mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: The condensed meaning of this is as follows: By the attention of faith, one accumulates merit like gold from its ore.

original: bsngo ba yid la byed pas ni de gser mgar gyis rgyan bzhin du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag tu byed do //
analyzed: bsngo ba yid la byed pas ni de gser mgar gyis rgyan bzhin du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag tu byed do //
translated: By the attention of dedication, one makes that merit into a limb of perfect enlightenment, like a goldsmith making ornaments.

original: rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pas ni rang dang gzhan gyi bsod nams byas pa mnyam pa nyid 'thob po zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pas ni rang dang gzhan gyi bsod nams byas pa mnyam pa nyid 'thob po zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: By the attention of rejoicing, one obtains the equality of one's own and others' merits.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'og tu zag pa med pa'i bsgom pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'og tu zag pa med pa'i bsgom pa'i lam ste /
translated: After the contaminated, the uncontaminated path of meditation is explained.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: And that is twofold.

original: de'i phyir dang po mngon par sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsgom pa'i lam /
analyzed: de'i phyir dang po mngon par sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsgom pa'i lam /
translated: Therefore, first, the path of meditation that has the characteristic of initial achievement

original: de yi ngo bo nyid mchog nyid //
analyzed: de yi ngo bo nyid mchog nyid //
translated: is the supreme nature of that.

original: kun la mngon par 'du mi byed //
analyzed: kun la mngon par 'du mi byed //
translated: It is the non-performance of all.

original: chos rnams dmigs su med par ni //
analyzed: chos rnams dmigs su med par ni //
translated: The non-apprehension of phenomena

original: gtod par byed pa don chen nyid //
analyzed: gtod par byed pa don chen nyid //
translated: is the great purpose.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus did he speak.

original: gzugs la sogs pa phyin ci ma log par mthong ba ni ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa phyin ci ma log par mthong ba ni ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The non-erroneous seeing of form, etc. is the nature.

original: gzhan gyis sangs rgyas nyid mi 'thob pa ni mchog nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyis sangs rgyas nyid mi 'thob pa ni mchog nyid do //
translated: The non-attainment of Buddhahood by others is the supremacy.

original: chos thams cad kyi khyad par skye ba med par rtogs par sbyor ba ni kun la mngon par 'du mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi khyad par skye ba med par rtogs par sbyor ba ni kun la mngon par 'du mi byed pa'o //
translated: The application to the realization of the non-production of the distinction of all things is the non-performance of all.

original: de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i lam gyi chos rnams mi dmigs pa nyid du rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud la skyed pa ni gtod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i lam gyi chos rnams mi dmigs pa nyid du rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud la skyed pa ni gtod par byed pa'o //
translated: The generation in the stream of the yogi of the non-apprehension of the dharmas of the path endowed with such a nature, etc. is the introduction.

original: don chen po sangs rgyas nyid du byed pa'i phyir don chen po nyid do //
analyzed: don chen po sangs rgyas nyid du byed pa'i phyir don chen po nyid do //
translated: The great meaning is the great meaning because it causes Buddhahood.

original: de'i 'og tu gang zhig yongs su bzung ba dang bor bas 'thob par 'gyur ba 'di'i skye ba dang mi skye ba'i rgyu gang zhig yin snyam pa'i the tshom bsal ba'i sgo nas gnyis pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gang zhig yongs su bzung ba dang bor bas 'thob par 'gyur ba 'di'i skye ba dang mi skye ba'i rgyu gang zhig yin snyam pa'i the tshom bsal ba'i sgo nas gnyis pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: After that, in order to remove the doubt of what is the cause of the attainment of this by the acceptance or rejection of something, the second verse is stated, which has the characteristic of great purity.

original: sangs rgyas bsten dang sbyin sogs dang // thabs la mkhas pa gang yin pa //🔽'di la mos pa'i rgyu dag yin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bsten dang sbyin sogs dang // thabs la mkhas pa gang yin pa // 'di la mos pa'i rgyu dag yin //
translated: serving the buddhas, generosity, and so on, and skill in means.

original: chos kyis phongs pa'i rgyu dag ni //
analyzed: chos kyis phongs pa'i rgyu dag ni //
translated: The causes of the loss of the Dharma are:🔽being overcome by the thickets of Mara, not aspiring to the profound Dharma,

original: bdud kyi thibs kyis non pa dang // zab mo'i chos la ma mos dang // phung po la sogs mngon zhen dang // sdig pa'i grogs pos yongs zin pa'o //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bdud kyi thibs kyis non pa dang // zab mo'i chos la ma mos dang // phung po la sogs mngon zhen dang // sdig pa'i grogs pos yongs zin pa'o // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: over-concern with the aggregates and so on, and being possessed by evil companions.

original: sangs rgyas mnyes par byed pa dang ; sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs par byed pa dang / zhi gnas la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i rgyu dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mnyes par byed pa dang ; sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs par byed pa dang / zhi gnas la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i rgyu dag yin no //
translated: The causes of faith are: serving the buddhas, completing the perfections such as generosity, and skill in means, which is skill in meditative development.

original: bdud kyis gnod pa byas pa dang / chos zab mo la ma mos pa dang / dngos por 'dzin pa dang / mi dge ba'i grogs po dang 'grogs @100b pa zhes bya ba ni mi skye ba'i rgyu dag yin no //
analyzed: bdud kyis gnod pa byas pa dang / chos zab mo la ma mos pa dang / dngos por 'dzin pa dang / mi dge ba'i grogs po dang 'grogs @100b pa zhes bya ba ni mi skye ba'i rgyu dag yin no //
translated: The causes of the loss of the Dharma are: being harmed by Mara, not aspiring to the profound Dharma, grasping at substantiality and associating with evil companions.

original: de ltar 'thob pa dang mi 'thob pa'i rgyu dag bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'thob pa dang mi 'thob pa'i rgyu dag bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the causes of acquisition and non-acquisition, he now explains the causes of the loss of the Dharma.

original: skabs su bab pa'i rnam par dag pa spyir /
analyzed: skabs su bab pa'i rnam par dag pa spyir /
translated: In general, the purity that is relevant here is as follows.

original: 'bras bu dag pa gzugs la sogs //
analyzed: 'bras bu dag pa gzugs la sogs //
translated: The purity of the result is that of form and so forth.

original: dag pa nyid de gang gi phyir //
analyzed: dag pa nyid de gang gi phyir //
translated: That is purity because

original: de gnyis tha dad ma yin zhing //🔽bcad du med pas dag par brjod //
analyzed: de gnyis tha dad ma yin zhing // bcad du med pas dag par brjod //
translated: those two are not different

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: and cannot be divided.

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag gi dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu gang yin pa de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyis rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de nyid /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag gi dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu gang yin pa de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyis rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de nyid /
translated: The purity of the result of the spiritual practitioner of an ārya being is the purity that is the freedom from all that is adverse to it.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: That is the purity of form and so forth.

original: 'bras bu dang gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la bdag tu mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa dang bral bas rab tu phye ba nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la bdag tu mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa dang bral bas rab tu phye ba nyid kyis /
translated: The purity of the result and the purity of form and so forth are distinguished by the freedom from the clinging to form and so forth as being the self and so on.

original: gang gi phyir de dag gi rnam par dag pa tha mi dad cing bcad du med pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag gi rnam par dag pa tha mi dad cing bcad du med pa nyid de /
translated: Because their purity is not different and cannot be divided.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir de ltar rnam par dag par brjod do //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir de ltar rnam par dag par brjod do //
translated: Because the general and specific characteristics are not different, therefore it is said to be thus pure.

original: rnam par dag pa spyir brjod nas da ni khyad par du /🔽nyon mongs shes bya lam gsum gyi //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa spyir brjod nas da ni khyad par du / nyon mongs shes bya lam gsum gyi //
translated: Having generally described purity, now in particular,🔽it is the purity of the disciples, rhinoceroses, and heirs of the Victor,

original: nyams phyir slob ma bse ru dang // rgyal sras rnams kyi dag pa ste //
analyzed: nyams phyir slob ma bse ru dang // rgyal sras rnams kyi dag pa ste //
translated: due to the elimination of the three: afflictions, objects of knowledge, and paths.

original: sangs rgyas rnam kun shin du ba //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnam kun shin du ba // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The purity of the buddhas is in all aspects.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang // de dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs gcig po gzung ba'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa dang theg pa gsum gyi lam gyi sgrib pa gsum spangs pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dag pa yin no
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang // de dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs gcig po gzung ba'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa dang theg pa gsum gyi lam gyi sgrib pa gsum spangs pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dag pa yin no
translated: It is the purity of the disciples, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas, respectively, due to the elimination of the three: afflictions such as attachment, the single aspect of the obscurations of objects of knowledge, the conception of apprehended objects, and the obscurations of the paths of the three vehicles.

original: // nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings las byung ba nyid ni bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: // nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings las byung ba nyid ni bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yin par 'dod do //
translated: The ultimate, unsurpassed Buddhahood is held to arise from the extremely pure dharmadhatu, because of the complete abandonment of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, together with their latent potentialities.

original: lam shes pa nyid kyi skabs su rnam par dag pa smos pa'i zhar la sangs rgyas dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: lam shes pa nyid kyi skabs su rnam par dag pa smos pa'i zhar la sangs rgyas dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa go rims bzhin du /
translated: In the context of the knowledge of the path, the purity of the Buddha, the Sravakas, etc. is explained in order, as extremely pure and otherwise, respectively, as a supplement to the mention of purity.🔽How is that?

original: shin tu ba dang cig shos su bshad pa de ji lta bu yin zhe na /🔽sa dgu la ni chen po yi //
analyzed: shin tu ba dang cig shos su bshad pa de ji lta bu yin zhe na / sa dgu la ni chen po yi //
translated: The path of the small of the small, etc.

original: chen po la sogs dri ma yi //🔽gnyen po chung ngu'i chung ngu la //
analyzed: chen po la sogs dri ma yi // gnyen po chung ngu'i chung ngu la //
translated: is the purity of the great of the great, etc.🔽defilements.🔽The path of the small of the small, etc.

original: sogs pa'i lam ni dag pa yin //
analyzed: sogs pa'i lam ni dag pa yin //
translated: is the purity of the great of the great, etc.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs @101a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs @101a * //
translated: defilements.

original: te ; 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag ste /
analyzed: te ; 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag ste /
translated: The nine levels are the desire realm, the concentrations, and the formless absorptions.

original: sa dgu la mi mthun pa'i phyogs chen po'i chen po la sogs pa rnam pa dgu'i gnyen po'i ngo bor go rims bzhin du lam chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa rnam pa dgu rnam pa thams cad dang / cig shos su rnam par dag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa shin tu ba dang cig shos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa dgu la mi mthun pa'i phyogs chen po'i chen po la sogs pa rnam pa dgu'i gnyen po'i ngo bor go rims bzhin du lam chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa rnam pa dgu rnam pa thams cad dang / cig shos su rnam par dag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa shin tu ba dang cig shos zhes bya'o //
translated: And the other is called “very pure” because it is the cause of complete purity.

original: ji ltar shin tu ba yin zhe na /🔽de la klan ka spangs pa yis //🔽lam ni 'jal dang gzhal bya dag / mnyam pa nyid kyis khams gsum gyi //
analyzed: ji ltar shin tu ba yin zhe na / de la klan ka spangs pa yis // lam ni 'jal dang gzhal bya dag / mnyam pa nyid kyis khams gsum gyi //
translated: How is it very pure?🔽The path is asserted as the antidote🔽of the three realms through equality

original: gnyen po nyid du 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: gnyen po nyid du 'dod pa yin //
translated: with the object of evaluation and the evaluator.🔽There, the antidote is the small of the small path, and so on, and the opposing factors are the great of the great, and so on.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The objection that this is illogical is refuted by the following.🔽The objection is that it is illogical to say that the antidote is the small of the small path, and so on, and that the opposing factors are the great of the great, and so on.

original: de la gnyen po ni chen po'i chen po la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs par rigs so zhes bya ba'i klan ka / gos la chags pa'i dri ma phra mo bsal ba la btso blag mkhan che thang du 'bad pa'i
analyzed: de la gnyen po ni chen po'i chen po la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs par rigs so zhes bya ba'i klan ka / gos la chags pa'i dri ma phra mo bsal ba la btso blag mkhan che thang du 'bad pa'i
translated: The analogy is that a laundryman makes a great effort to remove the subtle stains on cloth.

original: dpes spangs pa'i sgo nas bsgom pa'i lam shin tu ba ji skad du bstan pa de /
analyzed: dpes spangs pa'i sgo nas bsgom pa'i lam shin tu ba ji skad du bstan pa de /
translated: The path of cultivation that is extremely pure in terms of abandonment is taught by way of example.

original: khams gsum pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa dang shes bya dag mi dmigs pa nyid kyis mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de nyid mtha' dag gi gnyen po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa dang shes bya dag mi dmigs pa nyid kyis mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de nyid mtha' dag gi gnyen po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The equality of the consciousnesses and objects of knowledge that have the aspect of the three realms is itself the nature of the antidote to all of them.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rnam par dag pa shin tu ba yin par rnam par bzhag go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rnam par dag pa shin tu ba yin par rnam par bzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the purity of the buddhas is posited as extremely pure.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan ces bya ba las skabs gnyis pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan ces bya ba las skabs gnyis pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the second chapter of the Treatise on the Ornament of Clear Realization, the instruction on the perfection of wisdom.🔽The knowledge of all aspects🔽The knowledge of all aspects is taught in terms of the knowledge of the path, the knowledge of bases, and the knowledge of entities.🔽The knowledge of the path

original: // / gzhi thams cad yongs su shes pa med par lam legs par yongs su shes pa med pas thams cad shes pa nyid /
analyzed: // / gzhi thams cad yongs su shes pa med par lam legs par yongs su shes pa med pas thams cad shes pa nyid /
translated: The knowledge of the path is taught in terms of the path of accumulation, the path of preparation, the path of seeing, and the path of meditation.🔽The path of accumulation

original: tshu rol pha rol mtha' la min //
analyzed: tshu rol pha rol mtha' la min //
translated: The path of accumulation is taught in terms of the small, medium, and great.🔽The small path of accumulation🔽The small path of accumulation is taught in terms of the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: de dag bar na mi gnas pa //
analyzed: de dag bar na mi gnas pa //
translated: The medium path of accumulation

original: dus rnams mnyam pa nyid shes phyir //
analyzed: dus rnams mnyam pa nyid shes phyir //
translated: The medium path of accumulation is taught in terms of the four genuine abandonments.🔽The great path of accumulation🔽The great path of accumulation is taught in terms of the four legs of manifestation.🔽The path of preparation🔽The path of preparation is taught in terms of the five powers and the five forces.🔽The path of seeing🔽The path of seeing is taught in terms of the seven branches of enlightenment.🔽The path of meditation🔽The path of meditation is taught in terms of the eightfold noble path.🔽The knowledge of bases

original: shes rab pha rol phyin par 'dod //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin par 'dod //
translated: The knowledge of bases is taught in terms of the knowledge of the basis of the perfection of wisdom.🔽The knowledge of entities🔽The knowledge of entities is taught in terms of the knowledge of the basis of the perfection of concentration.🔽The knowledge of all aspects🔽The knowledge of all aspects is taught in terms of the knowledge of the basis of the perfection of perseverance.🔽The knowledge of the path🔽The knowledge of the path is taught in terms of the knowledge of the basis of the perfection of patience.🔽The knowledge of bases🔽The knowledge of bases is taught in terms of the knowledge of the basis of the perfection of morality.🔽The knowledge of entities🔽The knowledge of entities is taught in terms of the knowledge of the basis of the perfection of generosity.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is taught by the following verse.

original: dus gsum pa'i chos rnams skye ba med pa'i rnam pa mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pas /🔽sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la nye bar gyur par 'dod pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: dus gsum pa'i chos rnams skye ba med pa'i rnam pa mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pas / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la nye bar gyur par 'dod pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Since they realize the equality of the aspects of non-arising of phenomena of the three times,🔽the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattvas is held to be close to the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: shes rab kyis tshu rol gyi mtha' 'khor ba dang / snying rjes pha rol gyi mtha' mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyis tshu rol gyi mtha' 'khor ba dang / snying rjes pha rol gyi mtha' mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: This perfection of wisdom is not located in existence or peace, because through wisdom it does not abide in the near side, samsara, and through compassion it does not abide in the far side, nirvana.

original: @101b go rims bzhin du rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtshan nyid dang de dag gi bar na yang mi gnas pas srid pa dang zhi ba la mi gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: @101b go rims bzhin du rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtshan nyid dang de dag gi bar na yang mi gnas pas srid pa dang zhi ba la mi gnas pa yin no //
translated: It is not located in existence and peace, because it does not abide in the characteristics of eternalism and nihilism, respectively, and it does not abide in between them.

original: kun shes pa nyid kyi skabs las bzlog ste bstan pas /
analyzed: kun shes pa nyid kyi skabs las bzlog ste bstan pas /
translated: Since it is taught in the reverse order of the chapter on complete knowledge,

original: nyan thos la sogs pa la dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du shes pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa la dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du shes pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: the sravakas and so on do not have knowledge of the equality of the three times.

original: yang dag pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ring bar gyur pas rang gi rtogs pa tsam gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa snying brtse ba dang shes rab dang bral ba'i phyir dngos po dang / dngos po med par dmigs pa nyid kyis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ring bar gyur pas rang gi rtogs pa tsam gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa snying brtse ba dang shes rab dang bral ba'i phyir dngos po dang / dngos po med par dmigs pa nyid kyis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Since they are far from the perfection of authentic wisdom, they are to be understood as abiding in samsara and nirvana, respectively, due to the perfection of wisdom that is merely their own realization, due to the absence of both love and wisdom, and due to the observation of both entities and nonentities.🔽The Yukti$a$!ikii says:

original: lugs las / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang //
analyzed: lugs las / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang //
translated: You assert that whatever is dependently arisen

original: de nyid khyod ni stong par bzhed //
analyzed: de nyid khyod ni stong par bzhed //
translated: is emptiness.

original: ces 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ces 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du shes pa ni gzhi rtogs pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du shes pa ni gzhi rtogs pa kho na yin la /
translated: the knowledge of the equality of the three times is the realization of the basis.

original: de yang thams cad la yod pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: de yang thams cad la yod pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: And is that not present in everyone?

original: ji ltar na nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa la yang dag pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ring ba dang cig shos su 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa la yang dag pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ring ba dang cig shos su 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that the perfection of authentic wisdom is far away from sravakas and bodhisattvas, and so forth?

original: de ni mtshan mar dmigs sgo nas //
analyzed: de ni mtshan mar dmigs sgo nas //
translated: It is distant from them from the perspective of the observation of signs,

original: thabs ma yin pas ring ba ste //
analyzed: thabs ma yin pas ring ba ste //
translated: and from the perspective of the absence of skillful means.

original: de ni thabs la mkhas pa yis //🔽yang dag nye ba nyid du bshad //
analyzed: de ni thabs la mkhas pa yis // yang dag nye ba nyid du bshad //
translated: But through skillful means,

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is explained as being very close.

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i dngos po snang ba la de'i rang gi ngo bo mi shes pas dngos por mngon par zhen pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med par mi snang ba bzhin du /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i dngos po snang ba la de'i rang gi ngo bo mi shes pas dngos por mngon par zhen pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med par mi snang ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as a magician conjures up an object, and those who do not know its nature conceive of it as a real thing, and thus it does not appear to be devoid of intrinsic nature,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa thabs mkhas pa dang bral ba'i phyir dngos po mtshan ma dang ldan par rtogs pas nyan thos la sogs pa dngos po'i ngo bo mi shes pa rnams la mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes med de /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa thabs mkhas pa dang bral ba'i phyir dngos po mtshan ma dang ldan par rtogs pas nyan thos la sogs pa dngos po'i ngo bo mi shes pa rnams la mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes med de /
translated: in the same way, because they lack skillful means such as a spiritual teacher, śrāvakas and so on, who do not know the nature of things, conceive of things as having signs and thus do not perceive the gnosis of sameness.

original: de'i phyir de dag la rgyal ba'i yum ring bar gyur to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la rgyal ba'i yum ring bar gyur to //
translated: Therefore, for them, the mother of the victors is distant.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dus ring mo zhig nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen yang dag par mgu bar byas pa'i man ngag phyin ci ma log pa can bden pa gnyis la rten pa'i thos pa la sogs pa'i skye ba'i thabs la mkhas pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dus ring mo zhig nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen yang dag par mgu bar byas pa'i man ngag phyin ci ma log pa can bden pa gnyis la rten pa'i thos pa la sogs pa'i skye ba'i thabs la mkhas pas /
translated: Bodhisattvas, for a long time, have pleased the spiritual master, and they have unmistaken instructions, and they are skilled in the means of generating learning and so on that is based on the two realities.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /

analyzed: yang ji ltar chos rnams rang bzhin gyis zab pa yin zhe na /

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /

original: yang de ltar rtogs par dka' ba nyid ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang de ltar rtogs par dka' ba nyid ci yin zhe na /

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /

original: de ni rtogs par dka' ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni rtogs par dka' ba nyid yin no //

analyzed: de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs la sogs pa brjod nas mjug bsdu bar /

analyzed: de ltar kun shes nyid lugs la // mi mthun gnyen po'i phyogs dag gi //

analyzed: rnam par dbye ba ma lus pa //

analyzed: ji skad bshad pa 'dir shes bya //

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /

translated: As explained in the context of the knowledge of all things, one should understand the distinctions of the antidotes and their resistances in the cases of the disciples, the bodhisattvas, and so on, in the same order.

original: de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs la sogs pa brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs la sogs pa brjod nas /
translated: Having thus described the resistances and so on,

original: de dag rnam par bsgom pa'i sbyor ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag rnam par bsgom pa'i sbyor ba gang yin zhe na /

analyzed: sbyor ba / gzugs sogs de mi rtag sogs dang // de ma rdzogs dang rab rdzogs dang // de la chags pa med nyid la //
translated: and to their nonattachment.🔽Application is to the prohibition of indulgence,

analyzed: spyod pa bkag pa'i sbyor ba dang // mi 'gyur byed po med nyid dang // bya dka' rnam @103a * //
translated: to immutability, to the absence of an agent,🔽to the three kinds of difficulty in practice,

original: gsum sbyor ba dang // skal ba ji bzhin 'bras thob pas //
analyzed: gsum sbyor ba dang // skal ba ji bzhin 'bras thob pas //
translated: and to the attainment of the result in accordance with one’s fortune.

original: 'bras yod 'dod pa de dang ni //
analyzed: 'bras yod 'dod pa de dang ni //
translated: The existence of the result is asserted🔽in dependence on the other.

original: gzhan las rag las med gang dang // snang ba rnam bdun shes byed do //
analyzed: gzhan las rag las med gang dang // snang ba rnam bdun shes byed do //
translated: The seven kinds of appearance are to be understood.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus he spoke.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dang / de dag nyid kyi mi rtag pa dang / stong pa nyid la sogs pa dang / so sor ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa nyid dang / chags pa med pa dang / gzhan du mi 'gyur ba dang //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dang / de dag nyid kyi mi rtag pa dang / stong pa nyid la sogs pa dang / so sor ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa nyid dang / chags pa med pa dang / gzhan du mi 'gyur ba dang //
translated: All phenomena such as form and so on, their impermanence, emptiness and so forth, their individual incompleteness and completeness, their nonattachment, their immutability,🔽their lack of an agent, and their lack of a creator are respectively the difficult tasks of the three omnisciences, the object, the application, and the half-understanding.

original: byed pa po med pa nyid dang / go rims bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi ched du bya ba dang sbyor ba dang phyed pa rnams kyi bya dka' ba nyid dang / skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu 'thob pas mi stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: byed pa po med pa nyid dang / go rims bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi ched du bya ba dang sbyor ba dang phyed pa rnams kyi bya dka' ba nyid dang / skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu 'thob pas mi stong pa nyid dang /
translated: The non-emptiness of the result obtained according to one's fortune,

original: gzhan gyi rkyen gyis mi 'gro ba nyid dang / yongs su 'gyur ba dang / mnyam du tshogs pa dang / 'gal ba dang / rkyen dang / ma 'phos pa dang / rten med pa dang / byed pa po ma yin pa rnams su shes pa la snang ba bdun la sgrub pa'i yongs su shes pa bsal ba'i sgo nas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rkyen gyis mi 'gro ba nyid dang / yongs su 'gyur ba dang / mnyam du tshogs pa dang / 'gal ba dang / rkyen dang / ma 'phos pa dang / rten med pa dang / byed pa po ma yin pa rnams su shes pa la snang ba bdun la sgrub pa'i yongs su shes pa bsal ba'i sgo nas /
translated: The seven appearances are: not going by other conditions, complete transformation, gathering together, contradiction, conditions, not transferring, no support, and not being an agent.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi de dang de la sbyor ba rnam pa bcu rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas bstan pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi de dang de la sbyor ba rnam pa bcu rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas bstan pas /
translated: The ten kinds of application of the bodhisattvas to those are taught by way of the seven realizations, which are to be eliminated.

original: shugs kyis na nyan thos la sogs pa'i ji skad bshad pa las bzlog ste sbyor ba yin no //🔽mnyam pa nyid kyi sgo nas sbyor ba bsgom dgos pas /
analyzed: shugs kyis na nyan thos la sogs pa'i ji skad bshad pa las bzlog ste sbyor ba yin no // mnyam pa nyid kyi sgo nas sbyor ba bsgom dgos pas /
translated: By implication, the application of the śrāvakas and so on is the opposite of what has been explained.🔽Application should be cultivated by way of sameness.

original: sbyor ba'i 'og tu mnyam pa nyid //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i 'og tu mnyam pa nyid //
translated: After application, sameness.

original: gzugs la sogs la rlom med pa //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs la rlom med pa //
translated: Not conceiving of form and so on,

original: rnam bzhi de yi mnyam pa nyid //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam bzhi de yi mnyam pa nyid //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: the four kinds of sameness.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / sngon po la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dang / spros pa dang rtogs pa'i rlom pa rnams rnam pa thams cad du mi dmigs pa ni sbyor ba'i mnyam pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / sngon po la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dang / spros pa dang rtogs pa'i rlom pa rnams rnam pa thams cad du mi dmigs pa ni sbyor ba'i mnyam pa nyid yin no //
translated: The equality of application is the complete non-apprehension of attachment to form and so on, the signs of blue and so on, and the conceit of conceptual proliferation and conceptualization.🔽Having realized the equality of application, one must cultivate the path of seeing.

original: sbyor ba'i mnyam pa nyid so sor rtogs nas mthong ba'i lam bsgom dgos pas mthong ba'i lam /🔽sdug bsngal la sogs bden pa la //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i mnyam pa nyid so sor rtogs nas mthong ba'i lam bsgom dgos pas mthong ba'i lam / sdug bsngal la sogs bden pa la //
translated: The path of seeing🔽is the nature of the instants of the knowledge and subsequent knowledge

original: chos shes rjes su shes pa dang // bzod shes skad cig bdag nyid 'di //🔽kun shes tshul la mthong ba'i lam //
analyzed: chos shes rjes su shes pa dang // bzod shes skad cig bdag nyid 'di // kun shes tshul la mthong ba'i lam //
translated: of the truths of suffering and so on, the acceptance and knowledge of phenomena.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is the path of seeing in the context of the knowledge of all things.

original: bden pa so so la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / chos shes pa dang rjes @103b su shes pa'i bzod pa dang rjes su shes pa ste /
analyzed: bden pa so so la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / chos shes pa dang rjes @103b su shes pa'i bzod pa dang rjes su shes pa ste /
translated: In each truth there is the acceptance of the knowledge of phenomena, the knowledge of phenomena, the acceptance of the subsequent knowledge, and the subsequent knowledge.

original: de ltar skad cig ma bcu drug gi bdag nyid ni /
analyzed: de ltar skad cig ma bcu drug gi bdag nyid ni /
translated: Thus, the nature of sixteen instants

original: thams cad shes pa nyid kyi skabs su mthong ba'i lam yin no //
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid kyi skabs su mthong ba'i lam yin no //
translated: is the path of seeing in the context of the knowledge of all things.

original: bden pa'i rnam pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: bden pa'i rnam pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are the aspects of the truth of cessation?

original: gzugs rtag ma yin mi rtag min //
analyzed: gzugs rtag ma yin mi rtag min //
translated: Form is neither permanent nor impermanent,🔽Beyond extremes, pure,🔽unborn, unceasing, and so forth,🔽like space, free from attachment,🔽liberated from grasping,

original: mtha' las 'das dang rnam dag dang ; / ma skyes ma 'gags la sogs dang // mkha' 'dra chags pa spangs pa dang // yongs su 'dzin las grol ba dang // ngo bo nyid kyis brjod med dang // gang phyir 'di don brjod pa yis //
