translated: inexpressible by nature,🔽and not to be given to others through verbal expression.

original: gzhan la sbyin du med pa dang // dmigs pa med par byed pa dang // shin tu rnam dag nad mi 'byung //🔽ngan song chad dang 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: gzhan la sbyin du med pa dang // dmigs pa med par byed pa dang // shin tu rnam dag nad mi 'byung // ngan song chad dang 'bras bu ni //
translated: It is not an object, it is the state of non-arising,🔽and it is the state of complete purification.

original: mngon du bya la mi rtog nyid //
analyzed: mngon du bya la mi rtog nyid //
translated: It is non-conceptuality regarding the severance of lower realms and the actualization of results.🔽It is the non-arising of consciousness🔽in relation to characteristics,🔽unconnectedness,

original: mtshan ma dag dang ma 'brel dang // dngos dang ming dang gnyis po la //🔽shes pa skye ba med pa ni //
analyzed: mtshan ma dag dang ma 'brel dang // dngos dang ming dang gnyis po la // shes pa skye ba med pa ni //
translated: entities, names, and both.

original: kun shes nyid kyi skad cig ma //
analyzed: kun shes nyid kyi skad cig ma //
translated: It is the moment of complete understanding.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid dang bral bas na rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang sdug bsngal ba ma yin pa dang bral ba nyid kyis rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' dang bral ba dang stong pa dang mi stong pa dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid dang bral bas na rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang sdug bsngal ba ma yin pa dang bral ba nyid kyis rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' dang bral ba dang stong pa dang mi stong pa dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: Because they are free from the extremes of eternalism and nihilism, they are pure.

original: bdag dang bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa dang / rnam par byang ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa dang / rnam par byang ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Because they are the essence of self and nonself, they are unborn, unceasing, uncontaminated, and unpurified.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa dag yin no //
translated: These are the aspects of the truth of suffering.

original: rgyu dang rgyu ma yin pa gsog nyid kyi phyir nam mkha' dang 'dra ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / kun 'byung ba med pa dang / mi ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu dang rgyu ma yin pa gsog nyid kyi phyir nam mkha' dang 'dra ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / kun 'byung ba med pa dang / mi ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are like space, they are free from cause and noncause, origin and no origin, and possession and nonpossession.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rab tu mi skye ba dang ma 'brel bas yongs su 'dzin pa las grol ba dang rkyen dang rkyen ma yin pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rab tu mi skye ba dang ma 'brel bas yongs su 'dzin pa las grol ba dang rkyen dang rkyen ma yin pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir /
translated: It is the abandonment of all afflictions and secondary afflictions, and it is free from grasping due to being unconnected with the arising or non-arising of things, and it is free from conditions and non-conditions.

original: rang gi ngo bos brjod du med pa zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos brjod du med pa zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is inexpressible by nature. This is the truth of the origin.

original: gang gi phyir 'gog pa dang / 'gog pa med pa dang ma 'brel pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gog pa dang / 'gog pa med pa dang ma 'brel pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because it is unconnected with cessation and non-cessation,

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i don tshig tu brjod @104a * //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i don tshig tu brjod @104a * //
translated: the meaning of the truth of cessation cannot be expressed in words.

original: pas rgyud gzhan la sbyin du med pa dang / zhi ba dang ma zhi ba med pas dmigs pa med par phyed pa dang / gya nom pa dang / gya nom pa ma yin pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pas rgyud gzhan la sbyin du med pa dang / zhi ba dang ma zhi ba med pas dmigs pa med par phyed pa dang / gya nom pa dang / gya nom pa ma yin pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: It cannot be given to another mindstream, and it is free from reference points because it is free from peace and non-peace, and it is free from the sublime and the non-sublime.

original: mtha' gnyis las 'das shing rnam par dag pa dang / nges par 'byung ba dang nges par 'byung ba med pa yang med pa'i phyir nad thams cad mi skye ba zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa yin no //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis las 'das shing rnam par dag pa dang / nges par 'byung ba dang nges par 'byung ba med pa yang med pa'i phyir nad thams cad mi skye ba zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa yin no //
translated: The non-arising of all diseases is the truth of cessation, because it transcends the two extremes and is pure, and because there is neither definite emergence nor no definite emergence.

original: lam dang lam ma yin pa dang bral ba'i phyir ngan song chad pa dang / rigs pa dang rigs pa ma yin pa dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i don gyi thabs la rnam par mi rtog pa nyid dang / sgrub pa dang sgrub pa ma yin pa las rnam par grol ba nyid kyis chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma dag dang ma 'brel pa dang /
analyzed: lam dang lam ma yin pa dang bral ba'i phyir ngan song chad pa dang / rigs pa dang rigs pa ma yin pa dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i don gyi thabs la rnam par mi rtog pa nyid dang / sgrub pa dang sgrub pa ma yin pa las rnam par grol ba nyid kyis chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma dag dang ma 'brel pa dang /
translated: The path is the truth of the path, because it is free from being a path and not being a path, because it is non-conceptual with regard to the means of realizing the result, being free from what is reasonable and unreasonable, and because it is free from the signs of all phenomena by being free from accomplishment and non-accomplishment.

original: nges par 'byin pa dang nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa med pa nyid kyis brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid shes bya dang sgra gnyis la shes pa skye ba med pa zhes bya ba ni lam gyi bden pa yin te
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa dang nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa med pa nyid kyis brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid shes bya dang sgra gnyis la shes pa skye ba med pa zhes bya ba ni lam gyi bden pa yin te
translated: The truth of the path is the non-arising of cognition of the two, the object of cognition and sound, due to the non-existence of the nature characterized by the expressed and expresser, by the non-existence of definite emergence and non-definite emergence.

original: / de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi kun shes pa nyid kyi skad cig ma de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthong ba'i lam yin no //
analyzed: / de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi kun shes pa nyid kyi skad cig ma de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthong ba'i lam yin no //
translated: Those moments of the very cognition of all things with such aspects are the path of seeing of the bodhisattvas.

original: nyan thos rnams kyis de las bzlog pa mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag tu bsgom par bya ba ni kun shes pa nyid la mthong ba'i lam yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyis de las bzlog pa mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag tu bsgom par bya ba ni kun shes pa nyid la mthong ba'i lam yin no //
translated: The sravakas cultivate the aspects of impermanence and so on in the reverse order, and the cognition of all things is the path of seeing.

original: nyan thos kyi lam ni byang chub sems dpas yongs su shes par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam ni byang chub sems dpas yongs su shes par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: The sravaka path is to be fully understood by the bodhisattva,

original: mngon du bya ba ni ma yin pas bsgom pa'i lam ni ma bstan to //
analyzed: mngon du bya ba ni ma yin pas bsgom pa'i lam ni ma bstan to //
translated: but it is not to be manifested, and so the path of meditation is not taught.

original: de ltar rgyas par bstan nas don mtha' dag sdud par byed pa nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum mjug bsdu bar /
analyzed: de ltar rgyas par bstan nas don mtha' dag sdud par byed pa nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum mjug bsdu bar /
translated: Having thus taught extensively, in order to summarize all the topics and to conclude the three exalted knowers,🔽he declares,

original: de ltar 'di dang yang 'di dang // yang 'di yin te rnam gsum po //
analyzed: de ltar 'di dang yang 'di dang // yang 'di yin te rnam gsum po //
translated: Thus this, and also this, and also this,

original: 'di ni gnas skabs gsum po dag / rdzogs par yongs su bstan pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni gnas skabs gsum po dag / rdzogs par yongs su bstan pa yin // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: These three are taught in their entirety in three chapters.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i tshul du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'di dang / lam shes pa nyid 'di dang / thams cad shes pa nyid 'di ste /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i tshul du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'di dang / lam shes pa nyid 'di dang / thams cad shes pa nyid 'di ste /
translated: In the manner just explained, this exalted-knower-of-all-aspects, this exalted-knower-of-all-paths, and this exalted-knower-of-all-aspects,

original: de ltar le'u gsum gyi rnam pa gsum po yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar le'u gsum gyi rnam pa gsum po yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: These three aspects in three chapters are made complete.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan @104b bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan @104b bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan zhes bya ba las /
translated: In the treatise of instructions on the perfection of wisdom called Ornament for the Clear Realizations,

original: skabs gsum pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: skabs gsum pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: this was the commentary on the third chapter.

original: // / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum yongs su shes pa ni /
analyzed: // / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum yongs su shes pa ni /
translated: The three exalted-knowers

original: dbang du bya ba'i phyir yang rnam pa thams cad dang lam dang gzhi shes pa bsdu ba'i sgo nas /
analyzed: dbang du bya ba'i phyir yang rnam pa thams cad dang lam dang gzhi shes pa bsdu ba'i sgo nas /
translated: In order to master them, they cultivate the three aspects of omniscience,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum sgom par byed pas /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum sgom par byed pas /
translated: through the process of subsuming the aspects, paths, and bases of knowledge.

original: rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa /
analyzed: rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa /
translated: They fully and completely realize all aspects.

original: gzhi shes pa yi bye brag rnams //
analyzed: gzhi shes pa yi bye brag rnams //
translated: The different aspects of the knowledge of the bases

original: rnam pa zhes bya mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: rnam pa zhes bya mtshan nyid de //
translated: are defined as the aspects.

original: kun mkhyen nyid ni rnam gsum phyir //
analyzed: kun mkhyen nyid ni rnam gsum phyir //
translated: Since there are three types of omniscience,

original: de ni rnam pa gsum du 'dod //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gsum du 'dod //
translated: they are considered to be three.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.

original: rtag pa la sogs par 'dzin pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po'i chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid mi rtag pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i ye shes kyi bye brag rnams rnam pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ni mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs par 'dzin pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po'i chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid mi rtag pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i ye shes kyi bye brag rnams rnam pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ni mtshan nyid de /
translated: The different aspects of the wisdom that focuses on the nature of impermanence and so on, which is the antidote to the discordant class of grasping at permanence and so on, are defined as the aspects.

original: de dag kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi bye brag gis rnam pa gsum kho nar bzhed do //
analyzed: de dag kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi bye brag gis rnam pa gsum kho nar bzhed do //
translated: Since there are three types of omniscience, they are considered to be only three.

original: rnam pa rnams spyir bstan nas /
analyzed: rnam pa rnams spyir bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the aspects in general,

original: da ni khyad par du /
analyzed: da ni khyad par du /
translated: now, in particular,

original: med pa'i rnam pa nas bzung ste //
analyzed: med pa'i rnam pa nas bzung ste //
translated: From the aspects of nonexistence up to

original: mi g-yo ba yi rnam pa'i bar //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba yi rnam pa'i bar //
translated: the aspects of non-disturbance.🔽In each truth there are four,

original: bden pa so so la bzhi dang // lam la de ni bco lngar bshad //
analyzed: bden pa so so la bzhi dang // lam la de ni bco lngar bshad //
translated: and in the path there are fifteen.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.

original: de la thams cad shes pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /🔽med pa dang / mi skye ba dang / dben pa dang / mi brdzi ba dang / gnas med pa dang / nam mkha' dang / brjod du med pa dang / ming med pa dang 'gro ba med pa dang mi 'phrogs pa dang mi zad pa dang skye ba med pa'i rnam pa ste bcu gnyis ni go rims bzhin du sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa gsum gyi /
analyzed: de la thams cad shes pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas / med pa dang / mi skye ba dang / dben pa dang / mi brdzi ba dang / gnas med pa dang / nam mkha' dang / brjod du med pa dang / ming med pa dang 'gro ba med pa dang mi 'phrogs pa dang mi zad pa dang skye ba med pa'i rnam pa ste bcu gnyis ni go rims bzhin du sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa gsum gyi /
translated: In this regard, from the perspective of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dag yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dag yin no //
translated: the twelve aspects of nonexistence, non-arising, isolation, non-subjugation, non-abiding, space, inexpressibility, namelessness, non-going, non-seizure, non-exhaustion, and non-arising are, respectively, the characteristics of impermanence, etc. of the three truths of suffering, etc.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po nyid du zag pa med pa'i lam gcig dang / thams cad shes pa nyid kyis rang sangs rgyas rnams kyang bsdus pas de'i phyir de dag gi shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po nyid du bsgom pa'i lam zag pa dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po nyid du zag pa med pa'i lam gcig dang / thams cad shes pa nyid kyis rang sangs rgyas rnams kyang bsdus pas de'i phyir de dag gi shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po nyid du bsgom pa'i lam zag pa dang bcas pa dang /
translated: The path of cultivation is threefold:🔽the path of cultivation with-outflows, which is the antidote to the afflictive obstructions, and the path of cultivation with-outflows, which is the antidote to the obstructions to omniscience.🔽The path of cultivation with-outflows is the antidote to the afflictive obstructions alone, because it is the uncontaminated path that is the antidote to the afflictive obstructions.

original: zag pa med pa gnyis yin pas lam rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: zag pa med pa gnyis yin pas lam rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The path of cultivation with-outflows and without-outflows is the antidote to the obstructions to omniscience alone, because it is the antidote to the obstructions to omniscience that subsumes the pratyekabuddhas by means of the knowledge of all things.

original: de la dang po la byed pa po med pa dang / shes pa po med pa dang / 'pho ba med pa dang / 'dul ba med pa'i @105a * //🔽rnam pa ste /
analyzed: de la dang po la byed pa po med pa dang / shes pa po med pa dang / 'pho ba med pa dang / 'dul ba med pa'i @105a * // rnam pa ste /
translated: The first has the aspects of no-doer, no-knower, no-transmigration, and no-tamed.

original: bzhi ni go rims bzhin du lam la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dag yin no //
analyzed: bzhi ni go rims bzhin du lam la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dag yin no //
translated: These four are, respectively, the characteristics of the path and so forth.

original: gnyis pa la rmi lam dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma'i rnam pa ste lnga ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa la rmi lam dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma'i rnam pa ste lnga ni /
translated: The second has the five aspects of dream, echo, mirage, illusion, and optical illusion.

original: go rims bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid spyir shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa dag yin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid spyir shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa dag yin no //
translated: They are, respectively, the antidotes to the obscurations to omniscience in general, which have the characteristics of being essenceless, unarisen, unceased, primordially peaceful, and naturally passed beyond sorrow.

original: gsum pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / gos pa med pa dang / spros pa med pa dang / rlom pa med pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / gos pa med pa dang / spros pa med pa dang / rlom pa med pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The third group of six are the aspects of non-affliction, non-purification, non-attachment, non-elaboration, non-conceit, and non-wavering.

original: drug ni go rims bzhin du shes bya'i sgrib pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i spros pa dang / rang gi rtogs pa dang / yongs su nyams par rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi so sor nges pa'i gnyen por gyur pa dag yin no //
analyzed: drug ni go rims bzhin du shes bya'i sgrib pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i spros pa dang / rang gi rtogs pa dang / yongs su nyams par rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi so sor nges pa'i gnyen por gyur pa dag yin no //
translated: These six are, respectively, the specific antidotes to the conceptualizations of affliction, purification, the habitual tendencies of affliction, the elaborations of form and so forth, one’s own realization, and complete degeneration.

original: de ltar na lam gyi bden pa la rnam pa bco lnga ste /
analyzed: de ltar na lam gyi bden pa la rnam pa bco lnga ste /
translated: Thus, the truth of the path has fifteen aspects.

original: spyir na thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun yin no //
analyzed: spyir na thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun yin no //
translated: In general, there are twenty-seven aspects of the knowledge of all things.

original: de'i 'og tu lam shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu lam shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa /
translated: Next, the aspects of the knowledge of the path are:🔽Cause, path, suffering, and cessation,

original: rgyu dang lam dang sdug bsngal dang // 'gog pa la ni go rims bzhin //
analyzed: rgyu dang lam dang sdug bsngal dang // 'gog pa la ni go rims bzhin //
translated: in order,🔽are proclaimed to be eight,

original: de dag brgyad dang bdun dang ni //
analyzed: de dag brgyad dang bdun dang ni //
translated: seven,

original: lnga dang bcu drug ces bsgrags so //
analyzed: lnga dang bcu drug ces bsgrags so //
translated: five, and sixteen.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang cig shos kyi phyogs la brten nas /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang cig shos kyi phyogs la brten nas /
translated: Based on the side of affliction and the side of purification,

original: kun 'byung ba dang ; lam gyi bden pa dag ni rgyu yin la /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang ; lam gyi bden pa dag ni rgyu yin la /
translated: the truths of origination and path are the cause,🔽and the truths of suffering and cessation are the result.

original: sdug bsngal dang 'gog pa'i bden pa dag ni 'bras bu yin par don gyi sgo nas bstan te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang 'gog pa'i bden pa dag ni 'bras bu yin par don gyi sgo nas bstan te /
translated: This is taught in terms of the meaning,

original: kun 'byung ba dang / lam dang / sdug bsngal dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa la grangs bzhin du rnam pa brgyad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / lam dang / sdug bsngal dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa la grangs bzhin du rnam pa brgyad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: and one should understand that the truths of origination, path, suffering, and cessation have eight aspects, etc., in order.

original: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / mi gnas pa dang / zhi ba dang / 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / sems can med pa'i rnam pa dag ni go rims bzhin du rgyu gang @105b yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / mi gnas pa dang / zhi ba dang / 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / sems can med pa'i rnam pa dag ni go rims bzhin du rgyu gang @105b yin pa ste /
translated: The aspects of freedom from attachment, nonabiding, peace, absence of attachment, absence of aversion, absence of delusion, absence of affliction and absence of sentient beings are the causes of the aspects of impermanence and so on, respectively.🔽

original: 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags dang / dga' ba dang / kun 'byung ba gang yin pa ste /🔽'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / rab tu skye ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags dang / dga' ba dang / kun 'byung ba gang yin pa ste / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / rab tu skye ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: The aspects of freedom from attachment, non-abiding, pacification, absence of attachment, absence of aversion, absence of delusion, absence of affliction, and absence of sentient beings are, respectively, the causes of desire, attachment, joy, and origination.

original: kun du rtog pa dang / rkyen gang yin pa ste sems can du mngon par zhen pa /
analyzed: kun du rtog pa dang / rkyen gang yin pa ste sems can du mngon par zhen pa /
translated: The causes of attachment, aversion, delusion, and complete arising are the conceptualizations and conditions that are fixated on sentient beings.

original: de rnams kyi gnyen por gyur pa gsum dang / gsum dang / gcig dang gcig ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi gnyen por gyur pa gsum dang / gsum dang / gcig dang gcig ste /
translated: The antidotes to those are three, three, one, and one, respectively.

original: de ltar na rgyu'i bden pa'i rnam pa brgyad yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu'i bden pa'i rnam pa brgyad yin no //
translated: Thus, there are eight aspects of the truth of the cause.

original: tshad med pa dang / mtha' gnyis dang ma 'brel ba dang / tha mi dad pa dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / chags pa med pa'i rnam pa dag ni /
analyzed: tshad med pa dang / mtha' gnyis dang ma 'brel ba dang / tha mi dad pa dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / chags pa med pa'i rnam pa dag ni /
translated: The aspects of the immeasurables, non-connection with the two extremes, non-differentiation, non-grasping at the best, non-conceptuality, inapprehensibility, and non-attachment are,

original: go rims bzhin du sems can thams cad la go skabs 'byed pa'i lam dang / ji ltar sems can thams cad la go skabs 'byed pa dang / rigs pa gang yin pa dang / ji ltar rigs pa yin pa dang / sgrub pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du sems can thams cad la go skabs 'byed pa'i lam dang / ji ltar sems can thams cad la go skabs 'byed pa dang / rigs pa gang yin pa dang / ji ltar rigs pa yin pa dang / sgrub pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: respectively, the path that opens up opportunities for all sentient beings, how it opens up opportunities for all sentient beings, what is reasonable, how it is reasonable, what is the practice,

original: ji ltar sgrub pa yin pa dang / nges par 'byin pa gang yin pa de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid /
analyzed: ji ltar sgrub pa yin pa dang / nges par 'byin pa gang yin pa de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid /
translated: how it is the practice, and what is the definite emergence.

original: gnyis dang gnyis dang / gnyis dang gcig ste /
analyzed: gnyis dang gnyis dang / gnyis dang gcig ste /
translated: These are, respectively, two, two, two, and one.

original: de ltar na lam gyi bden pa'i rnam pa bdun yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na lam gyi bden pa'i rnam pa bdun yin no //
translated: Thus, there are seven aspects of the truth of the path.

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa dang / lnga pa mtshan nyid med pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid rnams te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa dang / lnga pa mtshan nyid med pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid rnams te /
translated: The aspects of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness, and the fifth, the nature of the aspect of signlessness.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa lnga yin no //🔽'gog pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid ni nang dang phyi dang gnyis ka'i dngos po rnams dgag pas /
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa lnga yin no // 'gog pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid ni nang dang phyi dang gnyis ka'i dngos po rnams dgag pas /
translated: Thus there are five aspects of the truth of suffering.🔽The nature of the aspect of cessation is threefold: the emptiness of internal things, the emptiness of external things, and the emptiness of both internal and external things, because of the cessation of internal things, external things, and both internal and external things.

original: nang dang phyi dang gnyis ka stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa ste gsum dang / zhi ba'i rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid btags pa'i bdag stong pa dang / snod kyi 'jig rten dang / don dam pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang /
analyzed: nang dang phyi dang gnyis ka stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa ste gsum dang / zhi ba'i rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid btags pa'i bdag stong pa dang / snod kyi 'jig rten dang / don dam pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang /
translated: The nature of the aspect of peace is the emptiness of the self that is imputed, the emptiness of the world that is the container, the emptiness of the ultimate, the emptiness of the conditioned, the emptiness of the unconditioned,🔽and the emptiness of the beginningless and endless cycle of existence, because of the cessation of the attachment to the self that is imputed, the world that is the container, the ultimate, the conditioned, the unconditioned,

original: rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' dang / 'khor ba thog ma dang tha ma med pa dang / rtogs pa'i chos dor ba med pa la mngon par zhen pa dgag pas /
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' dang / 'khor ba thog ma dang tha ma med pa dang / rtogs pa'i chos dor ba med pa la mngon par zhen pa dgag pas /
translated: the extreme of eternalism, the extreme of nihilism, the beginning and end of the cycle of existence, and the Dharma of realization that is not to be discarded.

original: stong pa dang / chen po dang / don dam pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / mtha' las 'das pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa ste brgyad dang /
analyzed: stong pa dang / chen po dang / don dam pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / mtha' las 'das pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa ste brgyad dang /
translated: are the aspects of the emptiness of nature, the emptiness of the conditioned, the emptiness of the unconditioned, the emptiness of the infinite, the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, and the emptiness of the unrejectable.

original: gya nom pa'i @106a * //
analyzed: gya nom pa'i @106a * //
translated: The other aspects of the sublime🔽are the aspects of the emptiness of the conditioned, the emptiness of the unconditioned, the emptiness of the infinite, the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, and the emptiness of the unrejectable.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis kun brtags pa'i byed pa po dgag pas /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis kun brtags pa'i byed pa po dgag pas /
translated: The other aspects of the sublime🔽are the aspects of the emptiness of the conditioned, the emptiness of the unconditioned, the emptiness of the infinite, the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, and the emptiness of the unrejectable.🔽The other aspects of the sublime

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa yul du 'khrul pa'i bdag nyid brtags pa dang / mtshan nyid dang / dus su 'khrul pa rnams dgag pas /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa yul du 'khrul pa'i bdag nyid brtags pa dang / mtshan nyid dang / dus su 'khrul pa rnams dgag pas /
translated: are the aspects of the emptiness of the conditioned, the emptiness of the unconditioned, the emptiness of the infinite, the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, and the emptiness of the unrejectable.🔽The other aspects of the sublime🔽are the aspects of the emptiness of the conditioned, the emptiness of the unconditioned, the emptiness of the infinite, the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, and the emptiness of the unrejectable.🔽The other aspects of the sublime

original: chos thams cad dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa ste gsum dang nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa kho na ngo bo nyid dgag pas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa gcig ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa ste gsum dang nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa kho na ngo bo nyid dgag pas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa gcig ste /
translated: are the aspects of the emptiness of the conditioned, the emptiness of the unconditioned, the emptiness of the infinite, the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, and the emptiness of the unrejectable.

original: de ltar na 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa ni bcu drug yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa ni bcu drug yin la /
translated: Thus there are sixteen aspects of the truth of cessation.

original: spyir na lam shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug yin no //
analyzed: spyir na lam shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug yin no //
translated: In general, there are thirty six aspects of the knowledge of the path.

original: de'i 'og tu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa /
translated: After that, there are the aspects of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: dran pa nyer gzhag nas bzung ste //
analyzed: dran pa nyer gzhag nas bzung ste //
translated: From the foundations of mindfulness

original: sangs rgyas rnam pa'i mthar thug rnams //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnam pa'i mthar thug rnams //
translated: up to the Buddha natures,

original: lam gyi bden pa'i rjes mthun par //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa'i rjes mthun par //
translated: in accordance with the truth of the path,

original: kun mkhyen gsum du phye bas na //
analyzed: kun mkhyen gsum du phye bas na //
translated: they are divided into three omnisciences.🔽Thus, for the disciples, the bodhisattvas,

original: slob ma byang chub sems dpa' dang // sangs rgyas rnams la rim bzhin de //🔽sum cu bdun dang sum cu bzhi //
analyzed: slob ma byang chub sems dpa' dang // sangs rgyas rnams la rim bzhin de // sum cu bdun dang sum cu bzhi //
translated: and the buddhas, respectively,🔽they are asserted to be thirty seven,🔽thirty four,

original: sum cu rtsa dgu dag tu bzhed //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa dgu dag tu bzhed //
translated: and thirty nine.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas bzung ste /
translated: From the foundations of mindfulness

original: sangs rgyas kyi rnam pa'i mthar thug pa rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyis bsdus pa'i lam yin pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rnam pa'i mthar thug pa rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyis bsdus pa'i lam yin pa'i sgo nas /
translated: up to the Buddha natures, in accordance with the path that is included in the three omnisciences,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir /
translated: because omniscience includes all noble beings.

original: grangs bzhin du nyan thos rnams la rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sum cu rtsa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas rnams la sum cu rtsa dgur bzhed do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: grangs bzhin du nyan thos rnams la rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sum cu rtsa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas rnams la sum cu rtsa dgur bzhed do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, it is said that there are thirty seven aspects for sravakas, thirty four for bodhisattvas and thirty nine for buddhas, respectively.

original: de la thams cad shes pa nyid la dang por dngos po la yongs su rtog pa'i lam la /
analyzed: de la thams cad shes pa nyid la dang por dngos po la yongs su rtog pa'i lam la /
translated: In this regard, the path of thorough examination of things is the first of the four knowledges.

original: bden pa bzhi la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to engage the four truths,🔽there are four aspects of the foundations of mindfulness: mindfulness of the body, feelings, mind and phenomena, which are thoroughly examined by their general and specific characteristics.

original: lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su brtags pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i rnam pa bzhi'o de'i 'og tu zhugs pa la brtson 'grus 'byung bas rtsol ba las byung ba'i lam la mi dge ba dang dge ba skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag go
analyzed: lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su brtags pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i rnam pa bzhi'o de'i 'og tu zhugs pa la brtson 'grus 'byung bas rtsol ba las byung ba'i lam la mi dge ba dang dge ba skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag go
translated: The path of striving is the path of preparation. Since effort arises in one who has entered the path, there are four aspects of right efforts: the nonvirtue and virtue that have arisen and the nonvirtue and virtue that have not arisen.

original: rims bzhin du yang dag par spong ba dang mi bskyed pa @106b dang ; spel ba dang / bskyed pa'i rgyu'i brtson 'grus yang dag par spong ba'i rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: rims bzhin du yang dag par spong ba dang mi bskyed pa @106b dang ; spel ba dang / bskyed pa'i rgyu'i brtson 'grus yang dag par spong ba'i rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four right efforts are the causes of the non-arising of evil and unwholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen, the cause of the abandonment of evil and unwholesome dharmas that have already arisen, the cause of the arising of wholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen, and the cause of the increase and growth of wholesome dharmas that have already arisen.

original: brtson 'grus dang ldan pa ni sems las su rung ba nyid du byed pas /🔽ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong ba'i lam la /
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang ldan pa ni sems las su rung ba nyid du byed pas / ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong ba'i lam la /
translated: The four bases of supernatural powers are the path of the purification of the mind, because one who is energetic makes the mind workable.

original: 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: They are the four bases of supernatural powers that are endowed with the formative influence of the abandonment of the meditative concentration of will, vigour, mind and investigation.

original: sems yongs su sbyang ba byas pa la dro ba dang rtse mo'i sbyor ba 'byung bas mngon par rtogs par sbyor ba'i lam la dro ba dang rtse mo'i ngo bo nyid /
analyzed: sems yongs su sbyang ba byas pa la dro ba dang rtse mo'i sbyor ba 'byung bas mngon par rtogs par sbyor ba'i lam la dro ba dang rtse mo'i ngo bo nyid /
translated: The five faculties are the path of application to realization, because the applications of heat and the summits arise in one whose mind has been purified.

original: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'i rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'i rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: They are the five faculties of faith, vigour, mindfulness, meditative concentration and wisdom.

original: dro ba la sogs pa thob pa la bzod pa dang chos kyi mchog 'byung bas mngon par rtogs pa dang 'brel pa'i lam la bzod pa dang chos mchog gi ngo bo nyid /
analyzed: dro ba la sogs pa thob pa la bzod pa dang chos kyi mchog 'byung bas mngon par rtogs pa dang 'brel pa'i lam la bzod pa dang chos mchog gi ngo bo nyid /
translated: The path connected with realization is the nature of acceptance and the supreme mundane state, since the attainment of heat and so on arises.

original: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang ; shes rab kyi stobs kyi rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang ; shes rab kyi stobs kyi rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: It has five aspects: faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration and wisdom.

original: dro ba la sogs pa bzhi rtogs pa la bden pa mthong ba'i lam 'byung bas /
analyzed: dro ba la sogs pa bzhi rtogs pa la bden pa mthong ba'i lam 'byung bas /
translated: The path of seeing arises in the realization of the four such as heat and so on.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i lam la dran pa dang / chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang ; ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi rnam pa bdun no //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i lam la dran pa dang / chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang ; ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi rnam pa bdun no //
translated: The path of realization has seven aspects: mindfulness, full discernment of phenomena, effort, delight, pliancy, concentration and equanimity.

original: bden pa mthong ba yongs su shes pa la bsgom pa'i lam 'byung bas /
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba yongs su shes pa la bsgom pa'i lam 'byung bas /
translated: The path of meditation arises in the complete knowledge of seeing the four truths.

original: rnam par dag par nges par 'byin pa'i lam la yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / rtog pa dang / ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dang / rtsol ba dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kyi rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: rnam par dag par nges par 'byin pa'i lam la yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / rtog pa dang / ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dang / rtsol ba dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kyi rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: The path that definitely leads to purification has eight aspects: right view, right thought, right speech, right activity, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration, which are the eight aspects of the noble eightfold path.

original: de ltar na slob ma rnams la kun shes pa nyid kyi lam gyi rten can gyi rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na slob ma rnams la kun shes pa nyid kyi lam gyi rten can gyi rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun yin no //
translated: Thus, for disciples, the path of thorough understanding has thirty-seven aspects.

original: lam shes pa nyid la gnyen po'i lam //🔽lta bas byas pa'i gnyen po dang // de'i rgyu mtshan gyi rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po dang / khams gsum pa la smon pa'i gnyen po zhes bya ba de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid la go rims bzhin du stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rnam par thar pa'i @107a * //
analyzed: lam shes pa nyid la gnyen po'i lam // lta bas byas pa'i gnyen po dang // de'i rgyu mtshan gyi rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po dang / khams gsum pa la smon pa'i gnyen po zhes bya ba de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid la go rims bzhin du stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rnam par thar pa'i @107a * //
translated: The path of knowledge of the path is the path of antidotes.

original: sgo dang po'o //
analyzed: sgo dang po'o //
translated: The antidote to the view, the antidote to the conception of its signs, and the antidote to the aspiration for the three realms. The first door of liberation has the nature of the aspects of emptiness and selflessness, respectively.

original: 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is the nature of the aspects of the truths of cessation and path.

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid ni gsum pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid ni gsum pa ste /
translated: The third is the nature of the aspects of the truths of impermanence, suffering, and origin.

original: de ltar na rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Thus there are three aspects of the three gates of liberation.

original: sprul pa'i lam la /
analyzed: sprul pa'i lam la /
translated: On the path of emanation,

original: gzugs kyi 'du shes rnam par ma bshig pa dang rnam par bshig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'du shes rnam par ma bshig pa dang rnam par bshig pa'i phyir /
translated: because of not destroying and destroying the ideation of form,

original: go rims bzhin du nang gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta'o zhes bya ba sprul pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por rnam par thar pa 'di gnyis dang / gzugs sdug pa dang mi sdug pa sprul pa la go rims bzhin du dga' ba dang mi dga' ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa de dag gi gnyen por sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas rdzogs par byas te /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du nang gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta'o zhes bya ba sprul pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por rnam par thar pa 'di gnyis dang / gzugs sdug pa dang mi sdug pa sprul pa la go rims bzhin du dga' ba dang mi dga' ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa de dag gi gnyen por sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas rdzogs par byas te /
translated: One dwells having manifested and completed the liberation door of pleasantness with the body.

original: gnas so zhes bya ba rnam par thar pa gcig ste de ltar na rnam par thar pa'i sgo rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: gnas so zhes bya ba rnam par thar pa gcig ste de ltar na rnam par thar pa'i sgo rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Thus, there are three types of liberation doors.

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i lam la thar pa dang mthun par gnas pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin la gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam pa bzhi dang zhi bar gnas pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin la 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i rnam pa
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i lam la thar pa dang mthun par gnas pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin la gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam pa bzhi dang zhi bar gnas pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin la 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i rnam pa
translated: The path of abiding happily in this life has the nature of the path that is conducive to liberation and has four aspects: the formless meditative attainments and the aspect of the meditative attainment of the cessation of discriminations and feelings.

original: gcig ste de ltar na rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: gcig ste de ltar na rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: Thus, there are five aspects.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam la bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med pa dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag ste dgu'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam la bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med pa dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag ste dgu'o //
translated: The supramundane path has nine: the four meditative stabilizations, the four formless meditative attainments, and the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: spong ba'i lam la bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rnam pa bden pa bzhis bsdus pa nyon mongs pa dang mi ldan pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi'o //
analyzed: spong ba'i lam la bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rnam pa bden pa bzhis bsdus pa nyon mongs pa dang mi ldan pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi'o //
translated: The path of elimination has four aspects: the nature of the path without impediment that is included in the four truths and is characterized by being free from afflictions.

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyi lam la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyi lam la /
translated: The path of buddhahood

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: has ten aspects: the perfections of generosity and so forth.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams la lam shes pa nyid kyi lam gyi rten can gyi rnam pa sum cu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams la lam shes pa nyid kyi lam gyi rten can gyi rnam pa sum cu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattvas have thirty-four aspects of the path of the knowledge of paths.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni shin tu phul du byung ba'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa'i lam gcig pu kho na yin te /🔽de la ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa dang / mos pa sna tshogs dang / 'jig rten @107b gyi khams du ma dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam dang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni shin tu phul du byung ba'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa'i lam gcig pu kho na yin te / de la ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa dang / mos pa sna tshogs dang / 'jig rten @107b gyi khams du ma dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam dang /
translated: The aspects of the knowledge of all aspects are the one path that is not shared with the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas because they are the most sublime.🔽They are the ten powers: the power of knowledge of what is and is not possible, the power of knowledge of karma, the power of knowledge of various higher interests, the power of knowledge of various dhātus, the power of knowledge of superior and inferior faculties, the power of knowledge of the path going everywhere,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyi rnam pa bcu dang ; nga ni sangs rgyas so zhes bdag nyid zhal gyis 'ches pa dang /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyi rnam pa bcu dang ; nga ni sangs rgyas so zhes bdag nyid zhal gyis 'ches pa dang /
translated: the power of knowledge of recollection of past lives, the power of knowledge of death and rebirth, and the power of knowledge of the exhaustion of contaminants.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa bar chad byed pa nyid du brjod pa dang / thams cad shes pa nyid la sogs pa'i lam nges par 'byung ba nyid du rab tu bstan pa dang / bdag nyid kyi zag pa zad pa nyid du zhal gyis bzhes pa la rgol ba po med pas mi 'jigs pa'i rnam pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa bar chad byed pa nyid du brjod pa dang / thams cad shes pa nyid la sogs pa'i lam nges par 'byung ba nyid du rab tu bstan pa dang / bdag nyid kyi zag pa zad pa nyid du zhal gyis bzhes pa la rgol ba po med pas mi 'jigs pa'i rnam pa bzhi dang /
translated: The four fearlessnesses are: fearlessness in proclaiming oneself to be the supreme teacher of the three worlds, fearlessness in proclaiming the abandonment of all defilements, fearlessness in proclaiming the elimination of all obstacles such as attachment and fearlessness in proclaiming the path of omniscience and so on to be the definite deliverance from samsara.

original: rnam grangs dang / chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / yul gyi skad dang / chos rab tu dbye ba'i yul la go rims bzhin du chos dang / don dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa rnam pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: rnam grangs dang / chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / yul gyi skad dang / chos rab tu dbye ba'i yul la go rims bzhin du chos dang / don dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa rnam pa bzhi dang /
translated: The four kinds of correct understanding are: correct understanding of the Dharma, meaning, etymological interpretation and confidence, in that order, with regard to the categories of Dharma, the meaning, the language and the classification of the Dharma.

original: 'khrul pa dang / ca co dang / dran pa nyams pa dang / thugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / tha dad pa nyid kyi 'du shes dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga' ba'i rnam pa drug dang / 'dun pa dang /
analyzed: 'khrul pa dang / ca co dang / dran pa nyams pa dang / thugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / tha dad pa nyid kyi 'du shes dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga' ba'i rnam pa drug dang / 'dun pa dang /
translated: The six aspects are: the absence of error, the absence of babbling, the absence of a lapse of memory, the absence of a mind that is not in equipoise, the absence of a different kind of perception and the absence of a non analytical equanimity.

original: brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba las nyams pa mi mnga' ba'i rnam pa drug dang / sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi phrin las rnams ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i rnam pa gsum dang /🔽'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang ; da ltar byung ba la /
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba las nyams pa mi mnga' ba'i rnam pa drug dang / sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi phrin las rnams ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i rnam pa gsum dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang ; da ltar byung ba la /
translated: The six aspects of being free from decline in terms of the six transcendent perfections generosity, discipline, patience, diligence, concentration and wisdom and in terms of liberation and the three aspects of enlightened activity of body, speech and mind being preceded by and following after gnosis.

original: ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes kyi rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes kyi rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The three aspects of gnosis being unattached and unobstructed with regard to the past, the future and the present.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi rnam pa dag dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bshad pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / chos thams cad la mnga' sgyur pa'i rang 'byung dang ; rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sangs rgyas nyid kyi rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi rnam pa dag dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bshad pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / chos thams cad la mnga' sgyur pa'i rang 'byung dang ; rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sangs rgyas nyid kyi rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Thus, the eighteen aspects of the attributes exclusive to a buddha, the three aspects of the suchness taught by all the buddhas, the self arisen state of mastery over all phenomena and the aspect of buddhahood, which is complete and perfect enlightenment in all its aspects.

original: de ltar na sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam gyi rten can gyi rnam pa ni sum cu rtsa dgu'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam gyi rten can gyi rnam pa ni sum cu rtsa dgu'o //
translated: Thus, the aspects of the path of the knowledge of all aspects of the Buddhas are thirty-nine.

original: de la thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni nyan @108a * //🔽thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i bye brag gis /
analyzed: de la thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni nyan @108a * // thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i bye brag gis /
translated: The aspects of the knowledge of all things are the sixteen aspects of the four noble truths, such as impermanence, etc.

original: go rims bzhin du zag pa med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dag kyang yin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du zag pa med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dag kyang yin no //

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam gyi rnam pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag chags dang bcas te rnam pa thams cad du spangs pas chos thams cad la mnga' sgyur ba'i phyir zag pa

translated: The aspects of the path of the knowledge of all aspects are uncontaminated because the perfect Buddha has abandoned all the afflictions and the cognitive obscurations together with their traces and thus has mastery over all things.

translated: The five kinds of application are as follows: not to dwell on form and so forth, not to apply oneself to them, to realize that form and so forth are profound, difficult to fathom and immeasurable by their very nature of suchness.

original: gting dpag dka' ba dang / tshad med pa zhes bya ba de ltar rtogs pa rnams kyi grangs bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa la mi gnas pa dang / mi sbyor ba dang / zab pa dang / gting dpag dka' ba dang / tshad med pa'i sbyor ba ste lnga dang /

translated: These five kinds of application are in accordance with the number of realizations that is, not to dwell on form and so forth, not to apply oneself to them, to realize that they are profound, difficult to fathom and immeasurable.

translated: The five kinds of application in the perfection of wisdom are to be without fear, to take it up correctly, to abandon the factors that hinder it, to constantly meditate on the Dharma and to be the support for the new undefiled Dharma.

original: grangs bzhin du sangs rgyas rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pa dang / dgongs pa dang ye shes kyis gzigs pa dang / nye bar gyur pa dang / phan yon chen po dang / bya ba byed pa dang / gnyen po'i chos yongs su rdzogs pa dang /

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi gtam brjod pa dang / grogs mdzad pa dang / dga' ba rgya chen po skyed pa dang / de'i dam bcas pa'i tshig la rjes su yi rang ba dang / chos zab mo mngon par 'dod pa dang /

original: sems can gyi don byed pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa tshang bar rnyed pa zhes bya ba de dag phyin ci ma log pa'i sbyor ba la mngon par dga' ba @109b la 'byung zhing 'thob pas yon tan bcu bzhi yin no //

translated: giving and being miserly, being generous and not accepting, understanding through brief indication and understanding through elaboration, understanding the Dharma of the sutras and so on and not understanding it, possessing and not possessing the six perfections.

original: mngon par mi shes pa nyid dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bcu tshan gsum pa'o //

analyzed: de kho na bzhin du thabs dang thabs ma yin pa la mkhas pa dang / gzungs thob pa dang ma thob pa dag dang / yi gir 'dri 'dod pa dang yi ger 'dri mi 'dod pa dag dang / 'dod pa'i 'dun pa dang bral ba dang ma bral ba nyid ces bya ba bzhi dang /
translated: Similarly, there are four: skill in means and lack of skill in means, obtaining and not obtaining retention, wishing and not wishing to write in letters, being and not being free from desire.

original: ngan song gi 'gro ba la phyir phyogs pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba la yid bde ba ste gnyis dang / 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po dag snga ma dang phyi ma gang yang rung ba 'brel pas grangs bzhin du gcig pu dang /

original: 'khor la mngon par dga' ba nyid dang / go skabs mi 'byed pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel par 'dod pa nyid dang / zang zing cung zad tsam 'dod pa nyid dang / de sbyin par mi 'dod pa nyid dang / srog gi bar chad du 'gyur ba dang mi 'gyur ba'i phyogs su 'gro ba zhes bya ba bzhi ste /

translated: Four are delighting in the retinue, not giving an opportunity, desiring to be related, desiring a little material gain, not desiring to give it and going to the side of either an obstacle to life or not.

original: bcu tshan bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bcu tshan bzhi pa'o //

translated: Likewise, there are three: going to a place where there is famine, not going, and going to a place disturbed by thieves and so on.

original: yul ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par dga' ba bskyed pa zhes bya ba gzhan gsum ste /
analyzed: yul ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par dga' ba bskyed pa zhes bya ba gzhan gsum ste /
translated: There are three others: seeing a house and being unhappy, being separated by Mara, and generating joy in an object that is not as it is.

original: de ltar na skyon bzhi bcu rtsa drug yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na skyon bzhi bcu rtsa drug yin no //

translated: These sixteen aspects of knowledge, which are the aspects of the suchness of unmoving and so on, and the suchness of the tathāgatas’ realization of that suchness, which is taught and designated to others,🔽are all indicated by the proper application of the knowledge of all aspects.
