analyzed: no // sbyin pa la sogs pa'i khyad par rtogs pas ser sna dang 'chal ba'i tshul khrims la sogs pa la sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba'i gnas pa so sor bkag pa dang / chos thams cad rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi ngo bo nyid yin pas rtogs pa'i chos rdul tsam yang mi dmigs pa dang /
translated: The second is the state of abiding in the nonapprehension of even a particle of Dharma through the realization that all phenomena are the nature of the three doors of perfect liberation.🔽The third is the state of abiding in the ascertainment of the three natures of omniscience through the attainment of full conviction.

original: mngon par yid ches pa thob pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi rang gis gsum la ji lta ba bzhin du nges pa nyid kyis gnas pa dang / gcig tu gzhol ba nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos kyi don du srog gtong ba zhes bya ba bzhi ni lam gyi rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon par yid ches pa thob pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi rang gis gsum la ji lta ba bzhin du nges pa nyid kyis gnas pa dang / gcig tu gzhol ba nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos kyi don du srog gtong ba zhes bya ba bzhi ni lam gyi rnam pa yin te /
translated: The fourth is the state of giving up one's life for the sake of the Dharma, such as omniscience and so on, through single pointed devotion.

original: de ltar na bzod pa dang shes pa'i skad cig ma rnam pa bcu drug gis bsdus pa 'di rnams yang dag par thob pa na /
analyzed: de ltar na bzod pa dang shes pa'i skad cig ma rnam pa bcu drug gis bsdus pa 'di rnams yang dag par thob pa na /
translated: Thus, when one obtains these sixteen aspects of patience and knowledge, one obtains the result of the path.

original: dag pa 'jig rten pa gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par ma zhen pa'i rnam pa can rjes kyi sems kyis bsdus pas rang dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes bzlog pa la sogs pa bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dag pa 'jig rten pa gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par ma zhen pa'i rnam pa can rjes kyi sems kyis bsdus pas rang dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes bzlog pa la sogs pa bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Pure mundane wisdom subsumed by subsequent states has the aspect of nonapprehending the subject and object and it generates the result compatible with itself, such as the reversal of the conception of form and so on.🔽

original: byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid dag yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid dag yin no //
translated: The pure mundane gnosis that is included in the subsequent stage of meditative equipoise is characterized by the aspect of nonapprehending the subject and object and it is the cause of the bodhisattva on the path of seeing generating the result that is compatible with it, the reversal of the conception of form and so on.🔽It is the sign of irreversibility.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi tha snyad ni sems can gdul ba'i dgos pa'i dbang ma gtogs par thams cad du rtogs pa dang mthun pa kho na yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir nye bar btags nas bshad de /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi tha snyad ni sems can gdul ba'i dgos pa'i dbang ma gtogs par thams cad du rtogs pa dang mthun pa kho na yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir nye bar btags nas bshad de /
translated: In order to understand that the conventions of yogis are in accordance with their realization in all respects except when it is necessary to tame sentient beings, they are explained as if they were designations.

original: de lta ma yin na rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud la so so rang gis rig pa'i skad cig ma rnams ji ltar gzhan yid ches @117a * //🔽par byed pa'i mtshan nyid dag yin /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud la so so rang gis rig pa'i skad cig ma rnams ji ltar gzhan yid ches @117a * //🔽par byed pa'i mtshan nyid dag yin /
translated: If that were not so, how could the moments of individual self cognizant yogis be characterized as something that inspires confidence in others?

original: de'i 'og tu bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa las /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa las /
translated: After that, it is the definition of irreversibility because one abides on the path of meditation.

original: lugs las khyad par ma bzung bar khyad par can gyi blo mi skye'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir re zhig bsgom pa'i lam gyi khyad par /
analyzed: lugs las khyad par ma bzung bar khyad par can gyi blo mi skye'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir re zhig bsgom pa'i lam gyi khyad par /
translated: But if one does not apprehend the difference from the system, the mind does not generate the special qualities.

original: bsgom pa'i lam ni zab pa ste //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni zab pa ste //
translated: The path of meditation is profound.

original: zab mo stong pa nyid la sogs //
analyzed: zab mo stong pa nyid la sogs //
translated: Profound emptiness and so on

original: zab pa de ni sgro 'dogs dang // skur pa'i mtha' las grol ba nyid //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /🔽stong pa nyid la sogs pa la yang gzugs med la /
analyzed: zab pa de ni sgro 'dogs dang // skur pa'i mtha' las grol ba nyid // ces bya ba gsungs te / stong pa nyid la sogs pa la yang gzugs med la /
translated: is free from the extremes of superimposition and denial.🔽Emptiness and so on do not exist in form.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa gzugs las gzhan pa yang ma yin pas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa gzugs las gzhan pa yang ma yin pas /
translated: Nor is emptiness and so on other than form.

original: go rims bzhin du stong pa nyid la sogs pa la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa'i mtha' las grol pa nyid gang yin pa de ni zab mo ste /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du stong pa nyid la sogs pa la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa'i mtha' las grol pa nyid gang yin pa de ni zab mo ste /
translated: Thus, in order, profound emptiness and so on is free from the extremes of superimposition and denial.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa yin la /
translated: That is profound emptiness and so on.

original: zab mo nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam zab pa yin no //
analyzed: zab mo nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam zab pa yin no //
translated: Because it possesses profundity, the path of meditation is profound.

original: de ltar khyad par bstan nas khyad par gyi gzhi /🔽nges 'byed yan lag dang mthong ba'i //
analyzed: de ltar khyad par bstan nas khyad par gyi gzhi / nges 'byed yan lag dang mthong ba'i //
translated: Having thus taught the distinctions, the basis of those distinctions is stated:🔽The branches of definite discernment,

original: lam dang bsgom pa'i lam nyid la //
analyzed: lam dang bsgom pa'i lam nyid la //
translated: the path of seeing, and the path of meditation🔽are the path of meditation that repeatedly

original: yang dang yang du sems pa dang // 'jal dang nges rtog bsgom pa'i lam //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab dag gam /🔽ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor ba dang dngos dang rjes las byung ba'i shes rab kyis /
analyzed: yang dang yang du sems pa dang // 'jal dang nges rtog bsgom pa'i lam // zhes bya ba gsungs te / thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab dag gam / ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor ba dang dngos dang rjes las byung ba'i shes rab kyis /
translated: reflects, evaluates, and ascertains.

original: go rims bzhin du nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la sogs pa gsum la nges par mthong ba'i don yang dang yang du sems pa dang / 'jal ba dang nges par rtog pa dag ni bsgom pa'i lam rgyun chags pa yin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la sogs pa gsum la nges par mthong ba'i don yang dang yang du sems pa dang / 'jal ba dang nges par rtog pa dag ni bsgom pa'i lam rgyun chags pa yin no //
translated: The path of meditation is the path of meditation that repeatedly reflects cinta, evaluates toya, and ascertains nirūpaṇa on the three topics such as the branches of definite discernment and so on, through the wisdoms arisen from hearing, contemplation and meditation, or through the wisdoms arisen from the preparation, actual basis and conclusion of concentration.

original: de rnam pa du zhig ce na /
analyzed: de rnam pa du zhig ce na /
translated: How many types of path of meditation are there?

original: de ni rgyun chags yin pa'i phyir //🔽chung dang 'bring dang chen po rnams //
analyzed: de ni rgyun chags yin pa'i phyir // chung dang 'bring dang chen po rnams //
translated: It is the uninterrupted path🔽of small, medium and great

original: chung ngu'i chung sogs dbye ba yis //
analyzed: chung ngu'i chung sogs dbye ba yis //
translated: and the small of the small and so on.

original: rnam pas rnam pa dgur bzhed do //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam pas rnam pa dgur bzhed do // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: They assert that aspects are ninefold.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa ni rnam par rtog pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /🔽mun pa shin tu chen po ni snang ba chung dus sel la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa ni rnam par rtog pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir / mun pa shin tu chen po ni snang ba chung dus sel la /
translated: This is stated because it is said that afflictions of bodhisattvas are conceptions.🔽The example of a great darkness is dispelled by a small light,

original: chung ngu ni chen pos sel to zhes bya ba'i dpes rnam par rtog pa chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu rnams re re zhing /🔽chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'i bye brag gis tha dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chung ngu ni chen pos sel to zhes bya ba'i dpes rnam par rtog pa chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu rnams re re zhing / chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'i bye brag gis tha dad pa'i phyir /
translated: while a small darkness is dispelled by a great light.🔽Thus, great, medium, and small conceptions are each divided into great, medium, and small,🔽because their antidotes are small, medium, and great, and each of those is divided into small, medium, and great.

original: @117b de dag gi gnyen po chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po rnams kyang re re zhing chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i bye brag gis tha dad pa'i phyir de ltar na don dam par stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa'i sgo nas rnam par
analyzed: @117b de dag gi gnyen po chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po rnams kyang re re zhing chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i bye brag gis tha dad pa'i phyir de ltar na don dam par stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa'i sgo nas rnam par
translated: Thus, in terms of the aspect of the nature of emptiness, which is ultimate,

original: rtog pa'i gnyen po'i dbye ba las grangs bzhin du /
analyzed: rtog pa'i gnyen po'i dbye ba las grangs bzhin du /
translated: the divisions of the antidotes to conceptions are, respectively,

original: 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pas dgu dag tu rnam pa dgu rgyun chags su 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pas dgu dag tu rnam pa dgu rgyun chags su 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the nine aspects of the desire realm and so on arise in a continuous series,

original: bsgom pa'i lam yin no //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam yin no //
translated: it is the path of meditation.

original: rgyal ba'i yum de dang de las rnam pa re re'i dbang du mdzad de /🔽bsod nams grangs med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / tshad med pa skye bar gsungs pa'i phyir bye brag rnam pa mang ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i yum de dang de las rnam pa re re'i dbang du mdzad de / bsod nams grangs med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / tshad med pa skye bar gsungs pa'i phyir bye brag rnam pa mang ba ma yin nam /
translated: In this and that Mother of Conquerors,🔽the sutras state that immeasurable, incalculable, and limitless merit arises.

original: ji ltar rnam pa dgu zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa dgu zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Since there are many different types of merit, how can it be said that there are nine aspects?

original: grangs med la sogs bstan pa rnams //
analyzed: grangs med la sogs bstan pa rnams //
translated: The teachings on the incalculable and so forth

original: dam pa'i don du bzod ma yin //🔽kun rdzob tu ni thugs brtse ba'i //
analyzed: dam pa'i don du bzod ma yin // kun rdzob tu ni thugs brtse ba'i //
translated: are not in terms of the ultimate.🔽The Sage accepts them

original: rgyu mthun de dag thub pa bzhed //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyu mthun de dag thub pa bzhed // ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: in terms of the relative, as the cause of compassion.

original: grangs med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / tshad med pa bstan pa tshig tu brjod pa'i ngo bo rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: grangs med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / tshad med pa bstan pa tshig tu brjod pa'i ngo bo rnams kyis ni /
translated: The teachings on the incalculable, the immeasurable, and the limitless, which are expressed in words,🔽are not in terms of the ultimate.

original: don dam par na bsgom pa'i lam ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can don gcig tu rab tu sbyar ba la ldog pa la ltos nas nye bar bskyed pa'i tha dad pa nyid kyi ngo bor dbye bar bya ba bzod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par na bsgom pa'i lam ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can don gcig tu rab tu sbyar ba la ldog pa la ltos nas nye bar bskyed pa'i tha dad pa nyid kyi ngo bor dbye bar bya ba bzod pa ma yin no //
translated: In the ultimate sense, the path of cultivation, which has the characteristics as explained, is not to be differentiated in terms of the nature of the separate categories of the production of the reversal of the object of meditation.

original: kun rdzob tu ni bshad pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid ji skad bshad cing bstan pa de dag byis pa'i skye bo rnams la 'bras bu chen po skye ba rab tu ston pa nyid kyis dmigs pa med pa'i thugs rje chen po'i rang bzhin gyi chos kyi dbyings
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni bshad pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid ji skad bshad cing bstan pa de dag byis pa'i skye bo rnams la 'bras bu chen po skye ba rab tu ston pa nyid kyis dmigs pa med pa'i thugs rje chen po'i rang bzhin gyi chos kyi dbyings
translated: In the conventional sense, the nature of the Dharma as explained and taught is the cause of the Dharma-dhātu, which is the nature of great compassion that is devoid of objective referents, because it is the cause of the great result that is produced in the childish beings.

original: kyi rgyu mthun par gyur pa yin par de bzhin gshegs pa bzhed pas mang po nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyi rgyu mthun par gyur pa yin par de bzhin gshegs pa bzhed pas mang po nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the Tathāgata accepts this, it does not follow that there is multiplicity.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis goms pa phul du byung ba byar med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis goms pa phul du byung ba byar med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn’t it the case that the perfection of the cultivation of the characteristics of emptiness is not to be done?

original: de'i phyir cung zad kyang mi byed pa kho na'o snyam pa'i skye bo blo dman pa'i ngor dogs pa bsu bar /
analyzed: de'i phyir cung zad kyang mi byed pa kho na'o snyam pa'i skye bo blo dman pa'i ngor dogs pa bsu bar /
translated: To forestall the doubts of those of inferior intellect, he says:

original: dngos po brjod du med pa la //
analyzed: dngos po brjod du med pa la //
translated: In the inexpressible entity

original: nyams pa dang ni 'phel mi rung //
analyzed: nyams pa dang ni 'phel mi rung //
translated: there is no decrease or increase.

original: bsgom zhes bya ba'i lam gyis ni //
analyzed: bsgom zhes bya ba'i lam gyis ni //
translated: By the path called “cultivation”

original: ci zhig nyams shing ci zhig 'thob //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ci zhig nyams shing ci zhig 'thob // ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: what is decreased and what is obtained?

original: chos nyid kyi rang gi ngo bor 'dod pa'i lam gyi dngos po /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rang gi ngo bor 'dod pa'i lam gyi dngos po /
translated: The entity of the path, which is asserted to be the reality of the nature of things,

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis yang dag par na de nyid dang / gzhan nyid dang gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma @118a * //🔽yin pa nyid du brjod du med pa la sgom pa phul du phyin par byar med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis yang dag par na de nyid dang / gzhan nyid dang gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma @118a * // yin pa nyid du brjod du med pa la sgom pa phul du phyin par byar med pa'i phyir /
translated: is itself inexpressible as either the same or different, both or neither, due to its unreality.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po dag go rims bzhin du 'bral ba dang skye bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po dag go rims bzhin du 'bral ba dang skye bar mi rung ngo //
translated: Since there is no perfection of cultivation, it is not tenable that there is a decrease of adverse factors and an increase of antidotes in order.

original: de bas na sgom pa zhes bya ba'i lam gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi ngo bo ni ci zhig por rnam par byang ba ni ci zhig 'thob ste /
analyzed: de bas na sgom pa zhes bya ba'i lam gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi ngo bo ni ci zhig por rnam par byang ba ni ci zhig 'thob ste /
translated: Therefore, what is the nature of the path called meditation that is to be purified, and what is the nature of the object to be attained?

original: cung zad kyang mi byed pa nyid pas nye bar dgod par mi bya ba kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: cung zad kyang mi byed pa nyid pas nye bar dgod par mi bya ba kho na'o zhe na /
translated: Since it does not do anything at all, it should not be posited.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: 'di ltar byang chub ji ltar de bzhin du //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub ji ltar de bzhin du //
translated: Because it is like enlightenment.

original: 'di ni 'dod pa'i don sgrub byed //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa'i don sgrub byed //
translated: It is the means of accomplishing the desired aim.

original: byang chub de bzhin nyid mtshan nyid //🔽de yang de yi mtshan nyid bzhed //
analyzed: byang chub de bzhin nyid mtshan nyid // de yang de yi mtshan nyid bzhed //
translated: Enlightenment is characterized by suchness.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: And that is also asserted to be its characteristic.🔽As suchness, enlightenment is not to be distinguished.

original: ji ltar khyad par du byar med pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi byang chub spros pa med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid chos kyi sku la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi sangs rgyas kyi bdag po tsam gyis /
analyzed: ji ltar khyad par du byar med pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi byang chub spros pa med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid chos kyi sku la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi sangs rgyas kyi bdag po tsam gyis /
translated: The nature of the Buddha is the Dharma Body, which is the nature of the non-conceptual intuition.

original: gdul bya'i skye bo rnams kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi rjes su mthun par don khyad par can snang ba'i sems bskyed pa'i sgo nas mngon par 'dod pa'i don byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gdul bya'i skye bo rnams kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi rjes su mthun par don khyad par can snang ba'i sems bskyed pa'i sgo nas mngon par 'dod pa'i don byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the moon, in accordance with the merit and wisdom of the beings to be trained, generates the mind of enlightenment, which is the appearance of a special meaning, and thereby performs the function of the desired aim,

original: bsgoms pas glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba'i sgo nas mngon sum du byas pa'i lam de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'di yang kun rdzob tu mngon par 'dod pa'i don gyi bya ba byed do //
analyzed: bsgoms pas glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba'i sgo nas mngon sum du byas pa'i lam de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'di yang kun rdzob tu mngon par 'dod pa'i don gyi bya ba byed do //
translated: in the same way, this path of reality, which is the direct realization of the reality of the mind through meditation, free from the temporary defilements, performs the function of the desired aim conventionally.

original: don dam par ni nyams pa dang 'phel ba dgag pa'i tshul du bzhed pas de'i tshe sbyor ba med pa nyid sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: don dam par ni nyams pa dang 'phel ba dgag pa'i tshul du bzhed pas de'i tshe sbyor ba med pa nyid sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: But ultimately, it is accepted in the manner of the negation of decrease and increase. Therefore, at that time, since the absence of application is itself application, there is no fault.

original: de lta yin na yang kun rdzob tu yang don byed par mi rung ngo snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu bar /🔽sems ni snga mas byang chub par //
analyzed: de lta yin na yang kun rdzob tu yang don byed par mi rung ngo snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu bar / sems ni snga mas byang chub par //
translated: Even though that is so, one might still doubt that it is not suitable to perform a function conventionally.🔽The former mind does not purify the latter,

original: rigs min phyi mas kyang ma yin //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rigs min phyi mas kyang ma yin //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: nor does the latter purify the former.

original: snga phyir gyur pa'i sems re re la sangs rgyas kyi byang chub sgrub par byed pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i don mtha' dag mi snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: snga phyir gyur pa'i sems re re la sangs rgyas kyi byang chub sgrub par byed pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i don mtha' dag mi snang ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the meaning of all the aspects of omniscience and so on that establish the enlightenment of a buddha do not appear in each individual mind that arises sequentially.

original: re res byang chub par ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: re res byang chub par ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical that each mind establishes enlightenment.

original: 'dod pa'i don sgrub par byed pa snang ba'i sems gcig car byung ba mang po nyid kyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don sgrub par byed pa snang ba'i sems gcig car byung ba mang po nyid kyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not the case that many minds that arise simultaneously and appear to accomplish the desired purpose.

original: sems can rnams ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyud re re ba'o zhes 'byung bas mi srid pa'i phyir ro //🔽bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi byang chub sgrub par byed pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa sangs @118b rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rang gi ngo bo rim gyis 'byung ba sems byung ba snga phyir
analyzed: sems can rnams ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyud re re ba'o zhes 'byung bas mi srid pa'i phyir ro // bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi byang chub sgrub par byed pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa sangs @118b rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rang gi ngo bo rim gyis 'byung ba sems byung ba snga phyir
translated: Because it is impossible, since it is said that sentient beings have individual mindstreams.🔽It is also not the case that many minds that arise sequentially and establish the enlightenment of a buddha, the unshared qualities of a buddha from the foundations of mindfulness up to the eighteen arise in sequence.

original: gyur pa mang po nyid kyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gyur pa mang po nyid kyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: Because it is impossible that the essence of the realization of the unshared qualities of a buddha arises in sequence.

original: de byung ma thag tu rjes su 'gro ba med pa nyid du 'jig pas na phan tshun 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de byung ma thag tu rjes su 'gro ba med pa nyid du 'jig pas na phan tshun 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it ceases immediately upon arising without any subsequent continuation, they are not mutually related.

original: de bas na ji ltar don khyad par can snang ba'i sems bskyed pa'i sgo nas don byed ce na /
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar don khyad par can snang ba'i sems bskyed pa'i sgo nas don byed ce na /
translated: Therefore, how can it be that the mind that appears as a specific object performs a function?

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin pas /
translated: Since that is not real,

original: mar me'i dpe yi tshul gyis ni //🔽zab mo'i chos nyid rnam pa brgyad //
analyzed: mar me'i dpe yi tshul gyis ni // zab mo'i chos nyid rnam pa brgyad //
translated: the example of a lamp

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: demonstrates the eight aspects of profound dharmatā.

original: ji ltar me lce dang snying po phrad pa'i skad cig ma dang po la /
analyzed: ji ltar me lce dang snying po phrad pa'i skad cig ma dang po la /
translated: The first moment of the contact of a flame and its wick

original: rang gi rgyus phan tshun gyi sgo nas dus mnyam du phrad pa bskyed pas khyad par can du ma byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi rgyus phan tshun gyi sgo nas dus mnyam du phrad pa bskyed pas khyad par can du ma byas pa'i phyir /
translated: is not differentiated by its cause, since it is generated simultaneously through mutual contact.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa med par rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid sreg par byed pa dang / bsreg par bya ba med la /
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa med par rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid sreg par byed pa dang / bsreg par bya ba med la /
translated: Therefore, without a second moment, the characteristics of cause and effect, such as burning and being burned, do not exist.

original: de bzhin du me lce dang snying po khyad par can skye ba skad cig ma gnyis pa la yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du me lce dang snying po khyad par can skye ba skad cig ma gnyis pa la yang /
translated: Likewise, the second moment of the flame and its wick, which are differentiated,

original: rtag tu yod pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur bas skad cig ma dang po med par /
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur bas skad cig ma dang po med par /
translated: Because it would follow that it would always exist and so on, the first moment does not exist.

original: kun rdzob tu yang 'byung ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang 'byung ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it does not arise even conventionally,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid sreg par byed pa dang / bsreg par bya ba med do //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid sreg par byed pa dang / bsreg par bya ba med do //
translated: the characteristics of cause and effect do not exist.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir gang gi tshe rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam gyi bdag nyid kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyis ma brtags gcig pur nyams dga' ba nyid du rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa'i stobs kyis gnyis ka phrad pa'i
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir gang gi tshe rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam gyi bdag nyid kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyis ma brtags gcig pur nyams dga' ba nyid du rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa'i stobs kyis gnyis ka phrad pa'i
translated: Because that is so, when the mere conditionality of the nature of dependent arising is not examined, it is delightful that by the power of the connection between cause and effect, both the first moment and the second moment and so on exist.

original: khyad pa can gyi skad cig dang po la ltos nas /
analyzed: khyad pa can gyi skad cig dang po la ltos nas /
translated: The first moment is distinguished by contact with the second moment and so on.

original: des byas pa mthu phul du phyin pa dang ldan pa'i khyad par can skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa yod na /
analyzed: des byas pa mthu phul du phyin pa dang ldan pa'i khyad par can skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa yod na /
translated: The second moment and so on are distinguished by being produced by the first moment and possessing the highest degree of power.

original: de'i tshe rgyu med par zhig kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag go rims bzhin du dus mnyam du skye ba dang 'jig par dmigs pas /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyu med par zhig kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag go rims bzhin du dus mnyam du skye ba dang 'jig par dmigs pas /
translated: At that time, although the fuel is not existent without a cause, since it is observed that the cause and effect arise and cease simultaneously, in that order,

original: sreg par byed pa dang bsreg par bya ba yod do //
analyzed: sreg par byed pa dang bsreg par bya ba yod do //
translated: the fuel and the fire exist.

original: de bas na skad cig ma dang pos kyang skad cig ma gnyis pa lam ltos par snying po ma bsregs la skad cig ma gnyis pas kyang me lce'i skad cig ma dang po la ma ltos par snying po ma bsregs pa zhes bya ba mar me'i dpe'i tshul
analyzed: de bas na skad cig ma dang pos kyang skad cig ma gnyis pa lam ltos par snying po ma bsregs la skad cig ma gnyis pas kyang me lce'i skad cig ma dang po la ma ltos par snying po ma bsregs pa zhes bya ba mar me'i dpe'i tshul
translated: Therefore, the first moment of the flame does not burn the second moment of the fuel without depending on the second moment of the flame, and the second moment of the flame does not burn the first moment of the fuel without depending on the first moment of the flame.🔽The mode of the example of the flame is🔽as follows.

original: skad cig ma snga phyir gyur pa gnyis yul gcig la nye bar sbyor ba shes par byed pa lhur len pas /
analyzed: skad cig ma snga phyir gyur pa gnyis yul gcig la nye bar sbyor ba shes par byed pa lhur len pas /
translated: Since it is understood that two moments, one earlier and one later, are applied to one object,

original: skad cig ma snga ma bzhin @119a * //🔽du byang chub sgrub par byed pa dngos po tshad yod pa zhig snang ba'i rnam par shes pa snga ma la brten nas /
analyzed: skad cig ma snga ma bzhin @119a * //🔽du byang chub sgrub par byed pa dngos po tshad yod pa zhig snang ba'i rnam par shes pa snga ma la brten nas /
translated: the earlier moment of the flame🔽burns the later moment of the fuel.🔽The earlier moment of the flame is the cause of the later moment of the flame.

original: de la snang ba'i don gyis dben pa lhag par khyad par du 'phags pa'i don snang ba'i rnam par shes pa phyi ma skye bas byang chub 'thob par rigs so //
analyzed: de la snang ba'i don gyis dben pa lhag par khyad par du 'phags pa'i don snang ba'i rnam par shes pa phyi ma skye bas byang chub 'thob par rigs so //
translated: Since the latter consciousness, which is the object of appearance that is isolated from the object of appearance of the former, arises as the object of superior distinction, it is reasonable to attain enlightenment.

original: ji skad smos pa'i dpe kho nas zab mo'i chos nyid rnam pa brgyad kyang khong du chud par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: ji skad smos pa'i dpe kho nas zab mo'i chos nyid rnam pa brgyad kyang khong du chud par bya ba yin pas /
translated: Since the eight aspects of the profound nature are also to be understood by means of the examples that have been mentioned,

original: bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to describe the characteristics of the bodhisattvas who are irreversible and who abide on the path of cultivation,

original: zab mo rnam pa brgyad yul gang la yin zhe na /
analyzed: zab mo rnam pa brgyad yul gang la yin zhe na /
translated: it is asked, “What is the profound object of the eight aspects?”🔽The profound is with respect to arising and cessation,🔽suchness, the knowable,🔽knowledge, conduct, nonduality,

original: skye ba dang ni 'gag pa dang // de bzhin nyid dang shes bya dang // shes dang spyod dang gnyis med dang // thabs mkhas pa la zab pa nyid //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: skye ba dang ni 'gag pa dang // de bzhin nyid dang shes bya dang // shes dang spyod dang gnyis med dang // thabs mkhas pa la zab pa nyid //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: and skill in means.

original: skad cig snga ma dang phyi ma dag gis kyang ma yin ngo bo nyid med pas kyang ma yin la sgom pas rtogs par bya ba'i don khyad par du 'phags pa bskyed do zhes bya ba rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / dngos po thams cad byung ba nyid nas rang bzhin gyis ngo bo nyid med la kun rdzob tu yang 'gag go zhes bya ba 'gag pa dang /
analyzed: skad cig snga ma dang phyi ma dag gis kyang ma yin ngo bo nyid med pas kyang ma yin la sgom pas rtogs par bya ba'i don khyad par du 'phags pa bskyed do zhes bya ba rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / dngos po thams cad byung ba nyid nas rang bzhin gyis ngo bo nyid med la kun rdzob tu yang 'gag go zhes bya ba 'gag pa dang /
translated: It is not by the former and later moments, nor by that which is essenceless, but it is generated by meditation, which is the object of realization.🔽It is dependent origination, and all things, from the time of their origin, are naturally essenceless, and they cease even conventionally.

original: gnas skabs thams cad du de bzhin nyid goms kyang de mngon du mi byed ces bya ba de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi chos thams cad la sbyin pa la sogs pa rnam pa du ma rjes su sgrub pa zhes bya ba shes bya dang /
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad du de bzhin nyid goms kyang de mngon du mi byed ces bya ba de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi chos thams cad la sbyin pa la sogs pa rnam pa du ma rjes su sgrub pa zhes bya ba shes bya dang /
translated: It is cessation, and although one cultivates suchness in all situations, one does not actualize it. It is suchness, and one accomplishes the many aspects of generosity and so on with respect to all phenomena, which have the nature of suchness. It is the object of knowledge.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis mthong ba med pa nyid mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba shes pa dang / chos nyid kyis thams cad la spyod pa med pa nyid spyod pa'o zhes bya ba spyod pa dang gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid du thams cad sgrub po zhes bya ba gnyis su med pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis mthong ba med pa nyid mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba shes pa dang / chos nyid kyis thams cad la spyod pa med pa nyid spyod pa'o zhes bya ba spyod pa dang gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid du thams cad sgrub po zhes bya ba gnyis su med pa dang /
translated: The essence of suchness is seeing what is not seen, the knowledge that it is seeing, the conduct that is not conduct toward anything, the conduct that is the knowledge that it is conduct, and the nonduality that is the accomplishment of everything as the essence of nonduality.

original: tshogs thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa la de'i 'bras bu sangs rgyas nyid mi thob zhes bya ba thabs la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: tshogs thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa la de'i 'bras bu sangs rgyas nyid mi thob zhes bya ba thabs la mkhas pa ste /
translated: The essence of suchness is the knowledge that nonseeing is seeing, the practice is the nonpractice of all things by way of their reality, the nonduality is the accomplishment of all things in the nature of nonduality, and the skill in means is the nonattainment of buddhahood, the result of the perfection of all accumulations.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam par thar pa thob pa'i sgo nas phan tshun 'gal ba'i don sgrub pas zab pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam par thar pa thob pa'i sgo nas phan tshun 'gal ba'i don sgrub pas zab pa nyid yin no //
translated: These five are profound because they accomplish mutually contradictory goals by means of attaining the inconceivable liberation.

original: slob pa phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs mtshan nyid dang bcas pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: slob pa phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs mtshan nyid dang bcas pa bshad zin to //
translated: The accumulations of the learner and nonlearner with their characteristics have been explained.

original: slob pa'i tshogs kyi chos thob pa sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas /
analyzed: slob pa'i tshogs kyi chos thob pa sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas /
translated: The learner who has attained the qualities of the accumulations strives to attain buddhahood.

original: sangs rgyas nyid 'thob pa'i rgyu @119b mtshan 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid 'thob pa'i rgyu @119b mtshan 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid /
translated: The reason for attaining buddhahood is the equality of samsara and nirvana.

original: chos rnams rmi lam 'dra ba'i phyir //
analyzed: chos rnams rmi lam 'dra ba'i phyir //
translated: Since phenomena are like dreams,

original: srid dang zhi bar mi rtog pa //🔽las med la sogs klan ka yi //🔽lan ni ji skad bshad par zad //
analyzed: srid dang zhi bar mi rtog pa // las med la sogs klan ka yi // lan ni ji skad bshad par zad //
translated: samsara and nirvana are not imagined.🔽The response to the objection

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: that there is no karma and so on has already been explained.

original: 'khor ba dang rnam par byang ba mi mthun pa dang gnyen po rnams snang brnyan tsam gyi ngo bos rmi lam dang 'dra ba nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la tha dad pa nyid du rnam par mi rtog pas na
analyzed: 'khor ba dang rnam par byang ba mi mthun pa dang gnyen po rnams snang brnyan tsam gyi ngo bos rmi lam dang 'dra ba nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la tha dad pa nyid du rnam par mi rtog pas na
translated: This is saying that since samsara and the antidotes to purification are understood to be like a dream, merely the nature of an appearance, samsara and nirvana are not imagined to be different.

original: mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, they are equal.

original: rmi lam dang 'dra ba nyid yin na mi dge ba bcu dang sbyin pa la sogs pa med pas /
analyzed: rmi lam dang 'dra ba nyid yin na mi dge ba bcu dang sbyin pa la sogs pa med pas /
translated: If they are like a dream, the ten nonvirtues and generosity and so on do not exist.

original: gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs na yang gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes bya ba'i klan ka rnams kyi lan ni /
analyzed: gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs na yang gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes bya ba'i klan ka rnams kyi lan ni /
translated: the Commentary states:

original: ji ltar phyi rol gyi don du smra ba'i lugs la skad cig ma nyid kyis rgyu med par 'jig pa yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol gyi don du smra ba'i lugs la skad cig ma nyid kyis rgyu med par 'jig pa yin la /
translated: In the system of those who assert external objects, things are momentary and disintegrate without any cause.

original: grub pa'i mtha' las kyang /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' las kyang /
translated: And in the philosophical tenet systems, it is said:

original: 'jig rten sna tshogs las las skyes //🔽zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten sna tshogs las las skyes // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: The various worlds arise from karma.

original: don dam par sus kyang su yang bsad pa med /
analyzed: don dam par sus kyang su yang bsad pa med /
translated: Thus, ultimately, no one is killed by anyone,

original: ma bsad pa yang ma yin /🔽sus kyang su'i nor blangs pa yang med /
analyzed: ma bsad pa yang ma yin / sus kyang su'i nor blangs pa yang med /
translated: nor is anyone not killed.🔽No one takes the wealth of anyone,

original: ma blangs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: ma blangs pa yang ma yin /
translated: nor does anyone not take the wealth of anyone.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i phyogs la rgyun 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i dngos po bskyed pa la gsod pa la sogs par rtog pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i phyogs la rgyun 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i dngos po bskyed pa la gsod pa la sogs par rtog pa'i sgo nas /
translated: And so on. In this way, the Commentary explains how the arising of things that are incompatible with the continuum, such as killing, is conceived to be killing and so on.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa la mi dge ba la sogs pa dang 'dra bar srog gcod pa la sogs pa rnam par 'jog pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa la mi dge ba la sogs pa dang 'dra bar srog gcod pa la sogs pa rnam par 'jog pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as nonvirtue and so on are posited in those who possess improper mental activity and so on,

original: dngos po rmi lam dang 'dra yang phyin ci log gi 'ching ba mtha' dag ma nyams pa rnams la de dang mthun pa'i don gyi dngos po la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lan de dang de phyogs gzhan nas gsungs so
analyzed: dngos po rmi lam dang 'dra yang phyin ci log gi 'ching ba mtha' dag ma nyams pa rnams la de dang mthun pa'i don gyi dngos po la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lan de dang de phyogs gzhan nas gsungs so
translated: so too, even though things are like dreams, for those who have not destroyed all the bonds of error, the response is given in other treatises, such as, “They are attached to things that accord with that and so on.”

original: zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: This is how you should understand it.🔽Moreover, the example is not established, because it is said,

original: gzhan yang / rmi lam sems ni gnyid kyis nyams //🔽des na 'bras bu 'dra ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan yang / rmi lam sems ni gnyid kyis nyams // des na 'bras bu 'dra ma yin //
translated: The mind in a dream is impaired by sleep,

original: zhes bya bas dpe ma grub po /
analyzed: zhes bya bas dpe ma grub po /
translated: therefore it is not similar to the result.

original: de bzhin du rmi lam na yang dge ba dang mi dge ba spyad pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du rmi lam na yang dge ba dang mi dge ba spyad pa ni /
translated: Likewise, in a dream, one engages in virtue and nonvirtue,

original: sad pa'i gnas skabs na kye ma byas so legs par byas so zhes rjes su yid rang na /
analyzed: sad pa'i gnas skabs na kye ma byas so legs par byas so zhes rjes su yid rang na /
translated: and when one awakens, one thinks, “Oh, I did this, I did that well.”

original: rjes kyi gnas skabs kyi @120a * //
analyzed: rjes kyi gnas skabs kyi @120a * //
translated: The subsequent state

original: sems kyis mngon par zhen pa'i gsos kyis yongs su gsos te /
analyzed: sems kyis mngon par zhen pa'i gsos kyis yongs su gsos te /
translated: is nourished by the nourishment of the mind’s manifest clinging.

original: de'i phyir yang dpe ma grub pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa ni mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dpe ma grub pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa ni mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since the example is not established, saṃsāra and nirvāṇa are sameness.

original: gnyis ka mnyam pa nyid du rnam par bsgom pa ni rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du sangs rgyas su 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gnyis ka mnyam pa nyid du rnam par bsgom pa ni rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du sangs rgyas su 'gyur bas /
translated: Since the meditation on the sameness of the two purifies one’s buddhafield,

original: de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa /🔽sems can 'jig rten de bzhin du //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa / sems can 'jig rten de bzhin du //

original: de la dag par bsgrub pa yis //
analyzed: de la dag par bsgrub pa yis //

original: sangs rgyas zhing ni dag pa nyid //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhing ni dag pa nyid //
translated: the buddhafield is purified.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam pa gnyis la go rims bzhin du bkres pa dang skom pa dang / rdo ba dang tsher ma la sogs pa nyid kyis ma dag pa gang yin pa de'i gnyen por lha'i nye bar spyad pa dang / gser gyi sa phyogs la sogs pa dag pa bskyed pa'i sgo nas rnam par dag pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam pa gnyis la go rims bzhin du bkres pa dang skom pa dang / rdo ba dang tsher ma la sogs pa nyid kyis ma dag pa gang yin pa de'i gnyen por lha'i nye bar spyad pa dang / gser gyi sa phyogs la sogs pa dag pa bskyed pa'i sgo nas rnam par dag pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The Buddha-field is twofold: the field of the Buddha's own realm, and the field of sentient beings. The first is impure, being defiled by hunger, thirst, stones, thorns, etc. Its antidote is the purity of the Buddha-field, which is produced by the divine enjoyments and the golden ground, etc.

original: rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa bsgrubs pa ni thabs mkhas pas skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bya dgos pas thabs la mkhas pa /

translated: The establishment of one's own Buddha-field is the skill in means, because one must perform the deeds of a Buddha according to the fortune of the sentient beings.

original: yul dang sbyor ba can 'di ni //

original: thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa bcu //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa bcu //
translated: There are ten kinds of skill in means.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said:

original: bar chad kyi chos las yang dag par rgal bas lha la sogs pa'i bdud las 'das pa dang / chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid rnam par bsgoms pas mi gnas par gnas pa dang / smon lam grub pas gzhan gyi don sngon gyi shugs kyis 'phags pa byed pa dang /
analyzed: bar chad kyi chos las yang dag par rgal bas lha la sogs pa'i bdud las 'das pa dang / chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid rnam par bsgoms pas mi gnas par gnas pa dang / smon lam grub pas gzhan gyi don sngon gyi shugs kyis 'phags pa byed pa dang /
translated: Since it is completely beyond the phenomena of obstacles, it is beyond the demons of gods and so forth. Since it is meditation on the sameness of all phenomena, it abides without abiding. Since it accomplishes prayers, it performs the benefit of others through the force of previous aspirations.

original: dka' ba spyod pa thams cad shin tu goms pa nyid kyis thun mong ma yin pa dang / chos dkar po rnam par dag pas chos thams cad la 'dzin pa med pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid kyis mi dmigs pa dang /

translated: Since it is completely familiar with all difficult activities, it is uncommon. Since it is pure of virtuous phenomena, it is without grasping to any phenomena. Since it is the door of liberation of emptiness, it is nonapprehending.

translated: The sign of non-regression is the non-regression due to the absence of signs by the signless gate of liberation, the absence of wishes by the wishless gate of liberation, and the expression of the Dharma of non-regression by the questions put forward.🔽The immeasurables are the knowledge of all objects.🔽The application to the knowledge of the right time and the wrong time for the realization of the ten kinds of objects of the perfection of wisdom is the skill in means.🔽This concludes the chapter on the perfection of wisdom, the sixth chapter of the treatise called “Ornament of Clear Realization: A Commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom.”🔽🔽

translated: are asserted to be of twelve types.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.

original: shin tu goms pa'i phyir rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na yang chos thams cad rmi lam dang 'dra ba la sogs par lta ba dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa la dga' ba'i sems mi bskyed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa mthong ba dang /
analyzed: shin tu goms pa'i phyir rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na yang chos thams cad rmi lam dang 'dra ba la sogs par lta ba dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa la dga' ba'i sems mi bskyed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa mthong ba dang /
translated: Because of being very familiar, even in the state of dreams, one sees all phenomena as being like a dream and so forth, one does not generate a mind that delights in the levels of śrāvakas and so on, one sees the tathāgatas and so forth, and one sees the maṇḍala of the deities of the victors.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa dmigs pa dang / chos ston pa'i sems skye ba dang / dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sems can mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du ngan song spong ba rjes su dran pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa dmigs pa dang / chos ston pa'i sems skye ba dang / dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sems can mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du ngan song spong ba rjes su dran pa dang /
translated: It is to remember the Buddha’s miraculous manifestations, the arising of the mind that teaches the Dharma, and the vision of beings in the hells and so forth, and to remember the abandonment of the lower realms in one’s own buddha realm.

original: grong khyer la sogs pa tshig pa rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i bden pa'i byin gyis brlabs grub pa dang / gnod sbyin la sogs pa mi ma yin pa med par byed pa'i bden pa'i tshig grub pa dang / rang nyid mngon par shes pas pha rol gnon pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa dang /
analyzed: grong khyer la sogs pa tshig pa rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i bden pa'i byin gyis brlabs grub pa dang / gnod sbyin la sogs pa mi ma yin pa med par byed pa'i bden pa'i tshig grub pa dang / rang nyid mngon par shes pas pha rol gnon pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa dang /
translated: It is to accomplish the blessing of truth that pacifies the burning of cities and so forth, to accomplish the words of truth that remove yakṣas and other non-human beings, and to rely on spiritual friends who are superior through one’s own supernormal knowledge.

original: rnam pa thams cad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa dang / chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la nye bar gyur pa zhes bya ba rnam pa bcu gnyis ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa thob pa'i gnas @121a * //

translated: The twelve aspects of the peak are: the attainment of the peak, the peak, the peak of the great, the peak of the supreme, the peak of the unsurpassed, the peak of the unequalled, the peak of the matchless, the peak of the incomparable, the peak of the inconceivable, the peak of the inexpressible, the peak of the uncontaminated, and the peak of the unattached.

original: skabs kyi khyad par gyi rtags yin no //
analyzed: skabs kyi khyad par gyi rtags yin no //
translated: These are the special signs of the stage of attaining the realization of the peak.

original: de ltar rtags kyis mtshon pa'i rnam par 'phel ba rnam pa du zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: de ltar rtags kyis mtshon pa'i rnam par 'phel ba rnam pa du zhig yod ce na /

original: rnam par 'phel ba /
analyzed: rnam par 'phel ba /
translated: The increase🔽is illustrated by many examples,

analyzed: 'dzam bu gling gi skye bo snyed //
translated: such as the beings of Jambudvīpa

analyzed: sangs rgyas mchod pa'i dge la sogs // rnam mang du ni dper mdzad nas //
translated: and the virtue of offering to the buddhas.

original: rnam 'phel bcu drug bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rnam 'phel bcu drug bdag nyid do //
translated: There are sixteen types of increase.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling la sogs pa stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can snyed kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa bas lhag pa dang / khyad par du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid la byed pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa dang /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling la sogs pa stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can snyed kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa bas lhag pa dang / khyad par du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid la byed pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa dang /
translated: It is superior to the attainment of the acceptance that phenomena are unborn and to keeping in mind the perfection of wisdom.🔽It is superior to the attainment of the formless absorptions and the ten virtues and so forth.🔽It is superior to the approach of all the gods.

original: byang chub par bya ba dang byang chub par byed pa'i chos rnams mi dmigs pa dang / dge ba bcu la sogs pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa las khyad par du 'phags pa dang / lha'i ris thams cad nye bar 'ong ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub par bya ba dang byang chub par byed pa'i chos rnams mi dmigs pa dang / dge ba bcu la sogs pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa las khyad par du 'phags pa dang / lha'i ris thams cad nye bar 'ong ba dang /
translated: It is superior to the subjugation of all demons.🔽It is superior to remaining the same for beings as the teacher is.🔽These are the eight types of merit.

original: bdud thams cad zil gyis gnon pa dang / ston pa dang 'dra bar skye bo la mtshungs par gnas pa zhes bya ba bsod nams rnam pa brgyad dang / yang rnam pa thams cad du thabs la mkhas pas bslab pa yongs su dag pa dang /
analyzed: bdud thams cad zil gyis gnon pa dang / ston pa dang 'dra bar skye bo la mtshungs par gnas pa zhes bya ba bsod nams rnam pa brgyad dang / yang rnam pa thams cad du thabs la mkhas pas bslab pa yongs su dag pa dang /
translated: It is superior to the completely pure training in all aspects through skill in means.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rigs can du 'gyur ba dang / 'bras bu sangs rgyas nyid 'thob pa'i rgyu mtshan dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sems mi skye ba dang / gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan par rtogs pa'i sems rab tu mi skye ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rigs can du 'gyur ba dang / 'bras bu sangs rgyas nyid 'thob pa'i rgyu mtshan dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sems mi skye ba dang / gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan par rtogs pa'i sems rab tu mi skye ba dang /
translated: the reason for becoming a buddha, the reason for attaining the result of buddhahood itself, the reason for not generating the mind that is the antithesis of the perfections, the reason for not generating the mind that conceives of possessing form and so on,🔽the reason for knowing the inclusion of all the perfections, the reason for attaining all that is excellent, and the reason for approaching complete buddhahood.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa kun bsdus pa shes pa dang ; phun sum tshogs pa thams cad 'thob pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la nye bar gyur pa zhes bya ba bsod nams gzhan rnam pa brgyad dang / me tog la sogs pas sangs rgyas mchod pa'i dge ba la sogs pa rnam pa mang po dper mdzad nas gong nas gong du khyad par du 'phags pa nyid kyis gnas skabs bcu drug gi ngo bo nyid ni rnam par 'phel ba yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa kun bsdus pa shes pa dang ; phun sum tshogs pa thams cad 'thob pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la nye bar gyur pa zhes bya ba bsod nams gzhan rnam pa brgyad dang / me tog la sogs pas sangs rgyas mchod pa'i dge ba la sogs pa rnam pa mang po dper mdzad nas gong nas gong du khyad par du 'phags pa nyid kyis gnas skabs bcu drug gi ngo bo nyid ni rnam par 'phel ba yin no //
translated: Having exemplified the many types of virtue such as the virtue of offering flowers to the Buddha and so on, the increase of virtue is the essence of the sixteen stages, which are progressively superior.

original: de ltar rnam par 'phel bas rnam par spel ba'i rang dbang du gyur pa mthar phyin pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ni nges par brtan pa yin pas nges par brtan pa //🔽kun mkhyen nyid @121b gsum chos rnams kyi //

translated: Thus, the characteristics of the culmination of mastery over the increase of the perfection of generosity and so on are definitely stable.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa bla med pa //🔽sems can don yongs mi gtong ba //🔽brtan pa zhes ni mngon par brjod //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa bla med pa // sems can don yongs mi gtong ba // brtan pa zhes ni mngon par brjod //
translated: The complete, unsurpassable🔽knowledge of all things🔽is called the stability

translated: The characteristic of concentration is the complete stability of mind, through the many merits that are superior to and beyond those examples.

original: rtags la sogs pa de dag ni go rims bzhin du dro ba la sogs pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi'i ngo bo yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: rtags la sogs pa de dag ni go rims bzhin du dro ba la sogs pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi'i ngo bo yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that those signs and so on are, respectively, the nature of the four aspects of the factor conducive to penetrative insight such as heat.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i 'og tu mthong ba'i lam yin te /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i 'og tu mthong ba'i lam yin te /
translated: The path of seeing is subsequent to the factor conducive to penetrative insight.

original: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyen po dang bcas pa rnam pa bzhi yod pas re zhig mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzung bar rnam par rtog pa gnyis po //
analyzed: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyen po dang bcas pa rnam pa bzhi yod pas re zhig mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzung bar rnam par rtog pa gnyis po //
translated: Since there are four aspects of the adverse factors and their antidotes, first, the two conceptions of apprehended objects are as follows.

original: 'jug pa dang ni ldog pa la //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ni ldog pa la //
translated: With respect to engagement and disengagement,

original: gzung ba'i rnam rtog so sor te //🔽dgu yi bdag nyid ji bzhin yul //🔽min pa'i bdag nyid dag shes bya //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam rtog so sor te // dgu yi bdag nyid ji bzhin yul // min pa'i bdag nyid dag shes bya //
translated: there are two conceptions of apprehended objects.🔽The object is known to have the nature of the nine,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽'jug pa dang ldog pa mi dmigs pa dang / @122a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te / 'jug pa dang ldog pa mi dmigs pa dang / @122a * //
translated: but not to have the nature of the object.

original: dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid dag la go rims bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos len pa dang 'dor ba'i sgo nas gzung ba'o zhes bzung bar rnam par rtog pa nyon mongs pa dang 'dra ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa
analyzed: dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid dag la go rims bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos len pa dang 'dor ba'i sgo nas gzung ba'o zhes bzung bar rnam par rtog pa nyon mongs pa dang 'dra ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa
translated: With respect to the non-observation of engagement and disengagement and the nature of observation, the bodhisattvas and śrāvakas, etc., respectively take up and reject phenomena. Thus, the conceptions of apprehended objects are like the afflictions. They are adverse factors.

original: yul gyi dbye bas so sor rnam pa dgu yod pa ni dngos po dang ma 'brel bar 'jug pa nyid kyis phyin ci lag tu snang ba'i phyir yul ji lta ba bzhi ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo dag tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yul gyi dbye bas so sor rnam pa dgu yod pa ni dngos po dang ma 'brel bar 'jug pa nyid kyis phyin ci lag tu snang ba'i phyir yul ji lta ba bzhi ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo dag tu shes par bya'o //
translated: The nine types of each are distinguished by their objects, because they are known to have natures that do not correspond to their objects, since they appear as erroneous due to engaging without connection to the object.

original: de ltar gzung bar rnam par rtog pa'i phyogs gnyis bstan nas 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa gnyis po /
analyzed: de ltar gzung bar rnam par rtog pa'i phyogs gnyis bstan nas 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa gnyis po /
translated: Having thus taught the two aspects of the conception of the apprehended, the two conceptions of the apprehender are taught:🔽The conception of the apprehender is twofold:

original: so so'i skye bo 'phags dbye bas //🔽sems can rdzas dang btags yod par //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo 'phags dbye bas // sems can rdzas dang btags yod par //
translated: The conception of the apprehender of ordinary beings and āryas,

original: rnam rtog 'dzin pa dag tu 'dod //
analyzed: rnam rtog 'dzin pa dag tu 'dod //
translated: Which is asserted to be the conception of sentient beings as substantially real or imputedly real.

original: de dag so sor dgu bdag nyid //
analyzed: de dag so sor dgu bdag nyid //
translated: Each of those has nine types.

original: gal te gzung don de bzhin me //
analyzed: gal te gzung don de bzhin me //
translated: If the apprehended object does not exist in that way,

original: de dag gang gi 'dzin par 'dod //
analyzed: de dag gang gi 'dzin par 'dod //
translated: What is it that is conceived to be the apprehender?

original: de ltar de dag 'dzin pa yi //
analyzed: de ltar de dag 'dzin pa yi //
translated: Thus, the conception of the apprehender

original: ngo bos stong pa'i mtshan nyid do //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ngo bos stong pa'i mtshan nyid do //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Is characterized by emptiness of essence.

original: so so'i skye bo dang 'phags pa'i gang zag dag gi go rims bzhin du skyes bu rdzas dang gtags par yod pa'i rten can gyi 'dzin pa dag yod pas 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa gags byed pa yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur ba yul
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang 'phags pa'i gang zag dag gi go rims bzhin du skyes bu rdzas dang gtags par yod pa'i rten can gyi 'dzin pa dag yod pas 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa gags byed pa yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur ba yul
translated: Because the conceptions of the apprehender exist in the order of ordinary beings and noble beings, respectively, they are discordant factors that obstruct the conception of the apprehender.

original: gyi dbye bas so sor rnam pa dgu yod pa ni //
analyzed: gyi dbye bas so sor rnam pa dgu yod pa ni //
translated: The divisions of objects are ninefold.

original: gang gi tshe de dag gi yul gyi dngos por gyur pa gzung ba'i don dag de bzhin du gzung ba'i ngo bor yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba de'i tshe gang gi yang 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de dag gi yul gyi dngos por gyur pa gzung ba'i don dag de bzhin du gzung ba'i ngo bor yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba de'i tshe gang gi yang 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: When the objects that are the things that are their objects, the apprehended objects, do not exist in the way they are apprehended, at that time they are not the apprehender of anything.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni 'dzin pa'i ngo bos dben pa'i ngo bo yin pas phyin ci log tu snang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni 'dzin pa'i ngo bos dben pa'i ngo bo yin pas phyin ci log tu snang ba'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, because they are devoid of the nature of the apprehender, they appear in a distorted way.

original: yul ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo dag tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yul ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo dag tu shes par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as having a nature that is not like their object.

original: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po 'jug pa'i rten can ji ltar rnam pa dgu yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po 'jug pa'i rten can ji ltar rnam pa dgu yin zhe na /
translated: How is the first conception of the apprehended, which is the basis of engagement, ninefold?

original: ngo bo nyid dang rigs dang ni //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang rigs dang ni //
translated: Nature, lineage,🔽Correct achievement of the path,🔽nonerroneous object of knowledge,🔽antidote to the opposing side,🔽realization by oneself,

original: lam ni yang dag 'grub pa dang / shes pa'i dmigs pa ma 'khrul dang / mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po dang // rang gis rtogs dang byed pa dang / de yi las bya'i 'bras bu la /
analyzed: lam ni yang dag 'grub pa dang / shes pa'i dmigs pa ma 'khrul dang / mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po dang // rang gis rtogs dang byed pa dang / de yi las bya'i 'bras bu la /
translated: action, and result of the object to be acted upon

original: 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi rten can gyi //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi rten can gyi //
translated: are the basis of the side of engagement.

original: rnam rtog de ni rnam dgur 'dod //
analyzed: rnam rtog de ni rnam dgur 'dod //
translated: That conception is asserted to be ninefold.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.🔽The nature of not realizing the unobservable through the unobservable,🔽the correct achievement of the path of seeing and so on through engaging the immutable and so on,

original: dben pas dben pa ma rtogs pa'i @122b ngo bo nyid dang / sa mi g-yo ba la sogs pa la 'jug pas sangs rgyas kyi rigs su nges pa dag sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pas mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam yang dag par 'grub pa dang /
analyzed: dben pas dben pa ma rtogs pa'i @122b ngo bo nyid dang / sa mi g-yo ba la sogs pa la 'jug pas sangs rgyas kyi rigs su nges pa dag sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pas mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam yang dag par 'grub pa dang /
translated: the realization of the illusionlike through ascertaining the lineage of the Buddha,

original: snang brnyan tsam du zad pas shes pa'i dmigs pa ma 'khrul ba dang / yon tan dang skyon mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba'i blang bar bya ba dang / dor bar bya ba nyid kyis gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang dri ma thams cad du dang bral ba nyid kyis rang gis rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: snang brnyan tsam du zad pas shes pa'i dmigs pa ma 'khrul ba dang / yon tan dang skyon mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba'i blang bar bya ba dang / dor bar bya ba nyid kyis gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang dri ma thams cad du dang bral ba nyid kyis rang gis rtogs pa dang /
translated: It is an object of knowledge that is not mistaken, since it is merely an appearance. It is to be realized by oneself, since it is free from all stains, such as antidotes and discordant classes, by virtue of being that which is to be adopted and that which is to be rejected, having seen its good qualities and faults.🔽It is to be taken up, since it is the cause of the result, which is to establish all beings in nirvana by the power of correct skillful means.🔽It is to be taken up, since it is faultless, being the result that establishes all beings in nirvana by the power of correct skillful means.

original: dman zhing kya nom pa ma yin pa nyid kyis nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa thag sring bar byed pa dang / bsam pa ji lta ba dang mthun par sprul pas sems can gyi don gyi las dang / yang dag pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis skye bo thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa la dgod par bya ba'i 'bras bu la skyon med pa nyid kyis gzung bar bya ba nyid du 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po
analyzed: dman zhing kya nom pa ma yin pa nyid kyis nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa thag sring bar byed pa dang / bsam pa ji lta ba dang mthun par sprul pas sems can gyi don gyi las dang / yang dag pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis skye bo thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa la dgod par bya ba'i 'bras bu la skyon med pa nyid kyis gzung bar bya ba nyid du 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po
translated: This is the first conception of apprehending.

original: 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi rten can rnam pa dgu po mthong ba'i lam gyi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs kyis spangs bar bya bar bzhed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi rten can rnam pa dgu po mthong ba'i lam gyi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs kyis spangs bar bya bar bzhed pa yin no //
translated: The nine aspects that are the basis of the side of engagement are asserted to be objects of abandonment by the state of preparation of the path of seeing.

original: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa ldog pa'i rten can ji ltar rnam pa dgu yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa ldog pa'i rten can ji ltar rnam pa dgu yin zhe na /
translated: How are the nine aspects of the basis of the reversal of the second conception of apprehended objects?

original: srid dang zhi bar ltung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: srid dang zhi bar ltung ba'i phyir //
translated: Because of falling into existence and peace,

original: rtogs pa dman pa nyid dang ni //
analyzed: rtogs pa dman pa nyid dang ni //

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa mtshan dang / gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba dang // ched du bya ba log pa dang // nyi tshe ba dang sna tshogs nyid //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa mtshan dang / gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba dang // ched du bya ba log pa dang // nyi tshe ba dang sna tshogs nyid //
translated: limited scope, and variety,🔽delusion regarding the basis and the nest,

original: gnas dang 'ug la rmongs pa dang // rjes la 'gro zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: gnas dang 'ug la rmongs pa dang // rjes la 'gro zhes bya ba la //
translated: and following after,

original: rnam rtog dgu yi bdag nyid 'di //
analyzed: rnam rtog dgu yi bdag nyid 'di //
translated: this is said to be the ninefold conception.

original: ldog pa'i phyogs kyi rten can te //🔽nyan thos la sogs yid las 'byung //
analyzed: ldog pa'i phyogs kyi rten can te // nyan thos la sogs yid las 'byung //
translated: The basis of the side of reversal

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: arises from the minds of śrāvakas and so on.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gang yang rung ba zhig tu ltung ba nyid kyis rtogs pa dman pa nyid dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen thabs la mkhas pa dang bral ba nyid kyis yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa mtha' dag gi gnyen po ma yin pa nyid kyis sgrub pa'i lam ma tshang ba dang /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i gdams ngag la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis gzhan @123a * //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gang yang rung ba zhig tu ltung ba nyid kyis rtogs pa dman pa nyid dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen thabs la mkhas pa dang bral ba nyid kyis yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa mtha' dag gi gnyen po ma yin pa nyid kyis sgrub pa'i lam ma tshang ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i gdams ngag la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis gzhan @123a * //
translated: It is inferior realization because it falls into either samsara or nirvana, it is not fully embraced because it lacks the skillful means of a spiritual master, it is an incomplete path because it is not the antidote for all the obscurations to omniscience,🔽it is a mistaken purpose because it does not engage in the great mind of supremacy over all sentient beings and so on, which is dependent on the instructions of the tathagatas and so on,

original: gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba nyid dang sems can thams cad kyi mchog nyid kyi sems chen po nyid la sogs pa la mi 'jug pa nyid kyis ched du bya ba log pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po nyid kyis nyi tshe ba'i lam gyi byed pa dang /
analyzed: gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba nyid dang sems can thams cad kyi mchog nyid kyi sems chen po nyid la sogs pa la mi 'jug pa nyid kyis ched du bya ba log pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po nyid kyis nyi tshe ba'i lam gyi byed pa dang /
translated: it is a limited path because it is the antidote for the afflictive obscurations,

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis 'bras bu dang po la sogs pa rtogs pa tha dad pa nyid dang / ma rig pa'i bag la nyal ba thams cad ma spangs pa nyid kyis gnas pa dang 'gro ba mi shes pa dang / theg pa chen po thams cad sdud par byed pa nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mya ngan las 'das pa thams cad kyi mjug tu 'gro ba la nyes pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid du ldog par bya'o
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis 'bras bu dang po la sogs pa rtogs pa tha dad pa nyid dang / ma rig pa'i bag la nyal ba thams cad ma spangs pa nyid kyis gnas pa dang 'gro ba mi shes pa dang / theg pa chen po thams cad sdud par byed pa nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mya ngan las 'das pa thams cad kyi mjug tu 'gro ba la nyes pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid du ldog par bya'o
translated: Since it has a focal object, it is the opposite of the realization of the first result and so on. Since it does not abandon all latent states of ignorance, it is the opposite of the knowledge of abiding and going. Since it does not subsume all of the Great Vehicle, it is the opposite of the knowledge of all aspects. Since it is associated with faults, it is the opposite of nirvana.

original: zhes gzung bar rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa ldog pa'i phyogs kyi rten can nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rgyud la blang bar bya ba nyid du 'byung ba rnam pa dgu po byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthong ba'i lam gyi sems dang //
analyzed: zhes gzung bar rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa ldog pa'i phyogs kyi rten can nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rgyud la blang bar bya ba nyid du 'byung ba rnam pa dgu po byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthong ba'i lam gyi sems dang //
translated: Thus, the nine aspects that occur in the mindstreams of sravakas and pratyekabuddhas, which are the opposite of the two conceptions of apprehending, are the opposite of the bodhisattvas path of seeing.

original: sems las byung ba 'jug pa'i gnas skabs kyis spangs bar bya bar bzhed pa yin no //
analyzed: sems las byung ba 'jug pa'i gnas skabs kyis spangs bar bya bar bzhed pa yin no //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas maintain that the object of abandonment is determined by the stage of the mental factor.

original: so so skye bo'i 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po skyes su rdzas su yod pa'i rtan can ji ltar rnam pa dgu yin zhe na /
analyzed: so so skye bo'i 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po skyes su rdzas su yod pa'i rtan can ji ltar rnam pa dgu yin zhe na /
translated: What are the nine aspects of the first conception of grasping that arises in ordinary beings, which has as its basis something that exists substantially?🔽Grasping, discarding, mental activity,

original: 'dzin pa dang ni 'dor ba dang / yid la byed dang khams rnams ni //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang ni 'dor ba dang / yid la byed dang khams rnams ni //
translated: the three elements,🔽connection,🔽abiding, manifest clinging,🔽the imputation of the entity of phenomena,🔽attachment, the antidote,

original: gsum po dag dang nyer 'brel dang // gnas dang mngon par zhen pa dang / chos kyi dngos po btags pa dang / chags pa dang ni gnyen po dang // ji ltar 'dod bzhin 'gro nyams la //
analyzed: gsum po dag dang nyer 'brel dang // gnas dang mngon par zhen pa dang / chos kyi dngos po btags pa dang / chags pa dang ni gnyen po dang // ji ltar 'dod bzhin 'gro nyams la //
translated: and the impairment of going as one wishes

original: 'dzin pa dang por shes par bya //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang por shes par bya //
translated: are to be understood as the first grasping.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is stated.

original: kun rdzob tu sgyu ma bzhin du 'dzin pa dang gtong ba dang / yang dag pa nyid du yid la mi byed par yid la byed pa dang // chos nyid kyi khams gsum car dang nye bar 'brel pa dang / stong pa nyid du mi gnas pas gnas pa dang /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu sgyu ma bzhin du 'dzin pa dang gtong ba dang / yang dag pa nyid du yid la mi byed par yid la byed pa dang // chos nyid kyi khams gsum car dang nye bar 'brel pa dang / stong pa nyid du mi gnas pas gnas pa dang /
translated: The skill in means of taking up and rejecting in the non-abiding is the taking up and rejecting of the non-abiding by not abiding in emptiness.🔽The skill in means of taking up and rejecting in the non-apprehension is the taking up and rejecting of the non-apprehension by not apprehending things.🔽The skill in means of taking up and rejecting in the non-differentiation is the taking up and rejecting of the non-differentiation by not differentiating things.🔽The skill in means of taking up and rejecting in the non-fixation is the taking up and rejecting of the non-fixation by not being fixed on things.🔽The skill in means of taking up and rejecting in the non-attachment is the taking up and rejecting of the non-attachment by not being attached to things.

original: dngos po la mngon par ma zhen pas thams cad la mngon par zhen pa dang / rdzas su yod pa med pas chos thams cad btags pa dang // de kho na nyid shes pa'i ma chags pas mngon par ma zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba'i chags @123b pa dang /🔽mnyam pa nyid sgom pa'i gnyen po nyid kyis gnyen po dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par ma shes pa nyid kyis //
analyzed: dngos po la mngon par ma zhen pas thams cad la mngon par zhen pa dang / rdzas su yod pa med pas chos thams cad btags pa dang // de kho na nyid shes pa'i ma chags pas mngon par ma zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba'i chags @123b pa dang /🔽mnyam pa nyid sgom pa'i gnyen po nyid kyis gnyen po dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par ma shes pa nyid kyis //
translated: The skill in means of taking up and rejecting in the non-apprehension of things is the taking up and rejecting of the non-apprehension of things by not apprehending things.🔽The skill in means of taking up and rejecting in the non-

analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'gro ba thogs pa la don dam pa'i dngos por mngon par zhen pas 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa dang po rnam pa dgu mthong pa'i lam gyi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs kyis spangs bar bya bar bzhed pa yin no //
translated: The first nine aspects of the conception of the apprehender are asserted to be objects of abandonment by the path of seeing, in the context of the stage of preparation.
