analyzed: 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa skyes bu btags par yod pa'i rten can ji ltar rnam pa dgu yin zhe na /
translated: What are the nine aspects of the second conception of the apprehender, which has as its basis the imputed existence of a person?🔽Not going as one wishes,🔽determining the path to be not the path,🔽birth with cessation,🔽with and without transference of the basis,🔽the destruction of abodes and lineages,

original: ched bzhin nges par mi 'byung ba dang // lam la lam min nges 'dzin dang // 'gag dang bcas pa'i skye ba dang / dngo spo ldan dang mi ldan dang / gnas dang rigs ni 'jig pa dang / don du gnyer dang rgyu med dang //🔽phyir rgol ba ni dmigs pa la //
analyzed: ched bzhin nges par mi 'byung ba dang // lam la lam min nges 'dzin dang // 'gag dang bcas pa'i skye ba dang / dngo spo ldan dang mi ldan dang / gnas dang rigs ni 'jig pa dang / don du gnyer dang rgyu med dang // phyir rgol ba ni dmigs pa la //
translated: purposelessness, causelessness,🔽and the observation of an opponent

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog gzhan yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog gzhan yin no //
translated: are the other conceptions of the apprehender.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The text says:

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i nges par 'byung ba nyid kyis ched du bya ba ji lta ba bzhin du nges par mi 'byung ba dang // rang gi mngon par 'dod pa'i lam med pas lam gzhan la lam ma yin par nges par 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i nges par 'byung ba nyid kyis ched du bya ba ji lta ba bzhin du nges par mi 'byung ba dang // rang gi mngon par 'dod pa'i lam med pas lam gzhan la lam ma yin par nges par 'dzin pa dang /
translated: Since it does not definitely emerge just as the purpose of the vehicle of the śrāvakas, and so on, and since one's own path is not desired, one apprehends another path as not being the path.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu kun rdzob kyi ngo bos skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / bar chad med pa dang cig shos su snang ba nyid kyis dngos po mtha' dag ldan pa dang mi ldan pa dang / nam mkha' la gnas pa'i bya dang dra ba nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu kun rdzob kyi ngo bos skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / bar chad med pa dang cig shos su snang ba nyid kyis dngos po mtha' dag ldan pa dang mi ldan pa dang / nam mkha' la gnas pa'i bya dang dra ba nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa la gnas pa dang /
translated: Since there is arising, ceasing, uninterruptedness, and the appearance of the opposite by the essence of the relative cause and result, all things are endowed and not endowed, and since the bird and the net exist in space, they exist in form, and so on.

original: byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs 'jig pa dang / de bzhin nyid las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos med pas 'dod pa med pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa la brten nas rgyu med pa dang ser sna shin tu goms par byas pa'i chos nyid kyis bdud la sogs pa phyir rgol ba'i dngos po dmigs pa la btags pa'i dngos por mngon par zhen pa nyid kyis 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs 'jig pa dang / de bzhin nyid las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos med pas 'dod pa med pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa la brten nas rgyu med pa dang ser sna shin tu goms par byas pa'i chos nyid kyis bdud la sogs pa phyir rgol ba'i dngos po dmigs pa la btags pa'i dngos por mngon par zhen pa nyid kyis 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa
translated: the absence of cause in dependence on ultimate truth and the absence of attachment to things imputed to the objects of demons and so on that are to be refuted by the reality of complete familiarity with miserliness.

original: gnyis pa rnam pa dgu mthong ba'i lam gyi sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa'i gnas skabs kyis spangs bar bya bar bzhed pa yin no //🔽de ltar na bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dgus rnam pa bzhi nyid las so sor mthong ba'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs @124a * //
analyzed: gnyis pa rnam pa dgu mthong ba'i lam gyi sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa'i gnas skabs kyis spangs bar bya bar bzhed pa yin no // de ltar na bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dgus rnam pa bzhi nyid las so sor mthong ba'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs @124a * //
translated: The second is asserted to be the object of abandonment by the nine aspects of the path of seeing that engage the mind and mental factors.

original: rnam pa dgu yin la /
analyzed: rnam pa dgu yin la /
translated: Thus, nine verses in the middle explain that the path of seeing has nine aspects that are discordant with the four characteristics.

original: de dag spang ba nyid du gnyen po rnam pa bzhi yang de bzhin du dbye bas tha dad do zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag spang ba nyid du gnyen po rnam pa bzhi yang de bzhin du dbye bas tha dad do zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the four kinds of antidotes are differentiated in the same way as the things to be relinquished.

original: de ltar mthong ba'i lam la mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyen po dang bcas pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba'i lam la mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyen po dang bcas pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the path of seeing together with its counteragents that are adverse to it,

original: byang chub chen po 'grub par byed pa'i mthong ba'i lam rgyu gang dang bcas par bzhed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa //
analyzed: byang chub chen po 'grub par byed pa'i mthong ba'i lam rgyu gang dang bcas par bzhed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa //
translated: the following verse is stated to show the cause that is the basis of the path of seeing that brings about the accomplishment of great enlightenment.

original: byang chub la gzhan ston pa dang / de yi rgyu ni yongs gtong dang // de thob par chad med pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: byang chub la gzhan ston pa dang / de yi rgyu ni yongs gtong dang // de thob par chad med pa'i rgyu //
translated: The cause of enlightenment is the teaching of others, the complete relinquishment of its cause, and the cause of the attainment of that without impediment.

original: bsod nams sa mang po'i mtshan nyid do //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te ;
analyzed: bsod nams sa mang po'i mtshan nyid do // zhes bya ba gsungs te ;
translated: The characteristic of the ground of the many merits.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi byang chub la gzhan dag mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa ston pas rab tu 'god pa ni gzig yin no //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi byang chub la gzhan dag mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa ston pas rab tu 'god pa ni gzig yin no //
translated: The cause of enlightenment is the teaching of others, the teaching of others on the path of seeing, etc., with the enlightenment that has the characteristics that will be explained.🔽The complete relinquishment of its cause is the relinquishment of the obscurations of affliction and the knowable that are adverse to enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi rgyu mtshan kho nar de dag la yang dag pa'i tshig dang don la sogs pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par so sor gtong ba ni gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi rgyu mtshan kho nar de dag la yang dag pa'i tshig dang don la sogs pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par so sor gtong ba ni gnyis pa yin no //
translated: The second is the correct bestowal of the perfection of wisdom on them by way of the correct words and meanings, etc., for the sole reason of enlightenment.

original: byang chub thob par byed pa'i bar chad med pa'i rgyu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang gis sgom pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams ches mang ba'i mtshan nyid ni gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub thob par byed pa'i bar chad med pa'i rgyu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang gis sgom pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams ches mang ba'i mtshan nyid ni gsum pa yin no //
translated: The third is the characteristic of the great merit of the perfection of wisdom, which is the cause of the attainment of enlightenment, by one's own cultivation, etc.

original: gang gi don du mthong ba'i lam rgyu de lta bu dang bcas par bzhed pa'i byang chub chen po de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi don du mthong ba'i lam rgyu de lta bu dang bcas par bzhed pa'i byang chub chen po de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that great enlightenment for the sake of which the path of seeing is accepted as having such a cause?

original: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa sbyang chub chen po //
analyzed: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa sbyang chub chen po //
translated: An intermediate verse on great enlightenment:

original: dri ma zad dang mi skye ba'i //
analyzed: dri ma zad dang mi skye ba'i //
translated: The knowledge of the extinction of defilements and of their non-arising

original: ye shes byang chub ces brjod de //🔽zad med skye med phyir de dag / go rims bzhin du shes par bya //
analyzed: ye shes byang chub ces brjod de // zad med skye med phyir de dag / go rims bzhin du shes par bya //
translated: Is called enlightenment.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: They should be understood in order as the extinction of the defilements and the non-arising of the defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i dri ma skyes pa dang ma skyes pa nyid du brtags pa rnams ni //🔽chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs par //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i dri ma skyes pa dang ma skyes pa nyid du brtags pa rnams ni // chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs par //
translated: The defilements of moral defilement and the knowable, whether they have arisen or not, are investigated.🔽Apart from the dharmadhatu

original: 'di ltar chos yod ma yin te //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos yod ma yin te //
translated: there is no such thing as a dharma.

original: zhes 'byung bas //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid rnams nam mkha' bzhin du 'gag pa dang skye ba med pa'i phyir ram //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid rnams nam mkha' bzhin du 'gag pa dang skye ba med pa'i phyir ram //
translated: The dharmadhatu is like space, because it is neither stopped nor produced.

original: gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid dang rgyud dang 'bras bu'i mtshan ma la sogs pas 'thad pa'i dngos po med pas nam mkha'i padma bzhin du 'gag pa dang skye ba med pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du dri ma rnams zad pa dang mi skye ba'i shes pa
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid dang rgyud dang 'bras bu'i mtshan ma la sogs pas 'thad pa'i dngos po med pas nam mkha'i padma bzhin du 'gag pa dang skye ba med pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du dri ma rnams zad pa dang mi skye ba'i shes pa
translated: Or else, because it is not tenable that it has the nature of being one or different, or the characteristics of a continuum or result, etc., like a sky-lotus, it is neither stopped nor produced.

original: chos thams cad phyin ci ma @124b log par rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid chos kyi sku la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi bdag nyid ni byang chub chen po yin par brjod do //
analyzed: chos thams cad phyin ci ma @124b log par rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid chos kyi sku la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi bdag nyid ni byang chub chen po yin par brjod do //
translated: The nature of the dharmakaya, etc., which is the realization of all dharmas without error, is described as the great enlightenment.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is so,

original: gang dag dngos po 'jig pa'i bsam pas zad pa la zad do snyam pa'i shes pa dang / dngos po mi skye ba'i bsam pas mi skye ba la mi skye'o snyam pa'i shes pa ni zad pa dang mi skye ba'i shes pa yin par brjod cing //
analyzed: gang dag dngos po 'jig pa'i bsam pas zad pa la zad do snyam pa'i shes pa dang / dngos po mi skye ba'i bsam pas mi skye ba la mi skye'o snyam pa'i shes pa ni zad pa dang mi skye ba'i shes pa yin par brjod cing //
translated: those who think that the knowledge that thinks “it is exhausted” in the exhaustion of things, and the knowledge that thinks “it is not produced” in the non-production of things, is the knowledge of exhaustion and non-production,🔽and who say that enlightenment is called “exhaustion and non-production,” for them, because there is no exhaustion and no non-production, that knowledge is not suitable.

original: byang chub kyang zad pa dang mi skye ba zhes pa yin par brjod pa de dag la zad pa dang mi skye ba med pa kho nas shes pa de rung ba ma yin no zhes bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: byang chub kyang zad pa dang mi skye ba zhes pa yin par brjod pa de dag la zad pa dang mi skye ba med pa kho nas shes pa de rung ba ma yin no zhes bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pas gsungs pa /
translated: In an intermediate verse, he says:

original: 'gog pa med pa'i rang bzhin la //
analyzed: 'gog pa med pa'i rang bzhin la //
translated: In the nature of non-cessation,

original: mthong zhes bya ba'i lam gyis ni //
analyzed: mthong zhes bya ba'i lam gyis ni //
translated: by the path called “seeing,”

original: rnam par rtog rigs ci zhig zad //
analyzed: rnam par rtog rigs ci zhig zad //
translated: what kind of conceptualization is exhausted?

original: skye med rnam pa zhi zhig 'thob //🔽ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: skye med rnam pa zhi zhig 'thob //🔽ces bya ba yin te /
translated: What kind of non-production is obtained?

original: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag go rims bzhin du zad pa dang skye ba'i gegs byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gog pa dang bral ba don dam par de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo'i rang bzhin yin na dngos po la log par mngon par zhen pa khyed kyis
analyzed: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag go rims bzhin du zad pa dang skye ba'i gegs byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gog pa dang bral ba don dam par de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo'i rang bzhin yin na dngos po la log par mngon par zhen pa khyed kyis
translated: and that which has arisen and that which has not arisen, respectively, are the cessation that is the obstruction to the arising of that which has not arisen and the obstruction to the exhaustion of that which has arisen.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi stobs kyis rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo skyes pa ni ci zhing zad //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi stobs kyis rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo skyes pa ni ci zhing zad //
translated: If they are essentially the nature of ultimate reality, suchness, then what is the essence of the path of seeing that is generated by the power of the path of seeing that causes the exhaustion of that which has arisen and the nonarising of that which has not arisen?

original: mi skye ba'i chos can ma skyes pa ni ci zhig skyes te /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos can ma skyes pa ni ci zhig skyes te /
translated: What is the essence of the nonarising of that which has not arisen?🔽Since there is not the slightest thing, therefore you should accept only our system.

original: cung zad kyang med pa kho na yin pas de'i phyir kho bo cag gi gzhung lugs kho na khams blangs bar bya'o snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: cung zad kyang med pa kho na yin pas de'i phyir kho bo cag gi gzhung lugs kho na khams blangs bar bya'o snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: This is what he thinks.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If that were not so,

original: chos yang dag par yod par khas len na bcom ldan 'das kyis nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa ngo mtshar che ba'i gnas yin no zhes par skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pas gsungs pa //
analyzed: chos yang dag par yod par khas len na bcom ldan 'das kyis nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa ngo mtshar che ba'i gnas yin no zhes par skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pas gsungs pa //
translated: The verse of this section says:

original: gzhan gyi chos rnams kyang yod la //🔽shes bya ba la yang ston pa yi //
analyzed: gzhan gyi chos rnams kyang yod la // shes bya ba la yang ston pa yi //
translated: Other phenomena also exist,🔽and the Teacher has eliminated

original: sgrib pa cad par brjod pa gang //
analyzed: sgrib pa cad par brjod pa gang //
translated: all obstructions to omniscience.

original: de la kho bos mtshar du brtsis //🔽zhes bya ba yin te ;
analyzed: de la kho bos mtshar du brtsis // zhes bya ba yin te ;
translated: I consider that amazing.

original: de la skye ba dang 'jig pas stong pa'i phyir bdag med do snyam su bsgoms pas bdag tu mngon par zhen pa yongs su bor nas des dben pa'i phung po la sogs pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can la yang dag🔽par dmigs te /
analyzed: de la skye ba dang 'jig pas stong pa'i phyir bdag med do snyam su bsgoms pas bdag tu mngon par zhen pa yongs su bor nas des dben pa'i phung po la sogs pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can la yang dag par dmigs te /
translated: There, one meditates on the thought that there is no self because of being empty of arising and disintegration. Having abandoned the manifest clinging to a self, one correctly observes the aggregates and so forth, which are empty of that self, and which are dependently arisen, having the attributes of arising and disintegration.

original: sngon po dang de'i blo @125a * //
analyzed: sngon po dang de'i blo @125a * //
translated: One correctly observes blue and the consciousness of blue.

original: dag lhag cig dmigs pa nges pa'i phyir 'di ni sems tsam kho na yin gyi //🔽phyi rol gyi don ni med do zhes bya ba yid la byed cing 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can gyi sems la mngon par zhen pa yongs su ma bor bas phyi rol gyi don du mngon par zhen pa spangs te /
analyzed: dag lhag cig dmigs pa nges pa'i phyir 'di ni sems tsam kho na yin gyi // phyi rol gyi don ni med do zhes bya ba yid la byed cing 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can gyi sems la mngon par zhen pa yongs su ma bor bas phyi rol gyi don du mngon par zhen pa spangs te /
translated: Because the object of observation is ascertained as being just mind only, one should think, “This is mind only.🔽There are no external objects.”🔽By not relinquishing the conception that apprehends the aspect of the mind, one abandons the conception of external objects.

original: gzung ba med na 'dzin pa med do snyam du nges par sems pas 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'i tshan nyid rnam par rig pa tsam de yang bsal te /
analyzed: gzung ba med na 'dzin pa med do snyam du nges par sems pas 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'i tshan nyid rnam par rig pa tsam de yang bsal te /
translated: Thinking, “If there is no object, there is no subject,” one eliminates the aspect of the subject, the mere consciousness.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes 'ba' zhig 'di yang dag par yod pa'i ngo bo yin no snyam du nges par byas nas //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes 'ba' zhig 'di yang dag par yod pa'i ngo bo yin no snyam du nges par byas nas //
translated: One should ascertain that this nondual consciousness is the entity that exists.

original: de yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir sgyu ma bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: de yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir sgyu ma bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
translated: Because it is dependently arisen, it is like an illusion and lacks entityness.

original: yang dag par na gcig tu dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs par brtag pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba yin no snyam du bsgoms pas bsgom pa'i stobs grub pa na kha cig ma nor bu dang dngul la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du 'khrul ba'i
analyzed: yang dag par na gcig tu dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs par brtag pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba yin no snyam du bsgoms pas bsgom pa'i stobs grub pa na kha cig ma nor bu dang dngul la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du 'khrul ba'i
translated: When the power of meditation is achieved by meditating in this way, thinking that in reality it is free from the nature of being imagined as a thing, non-thing, and so on, some, like the consciousness of a flawless gem, silver, and so on, abandon all signs of error.

original: mtshan ma mtha' dag spangs pa sgyu ma lta bu'i bdag nyid du snang ba'i blo rnam par mi rtog pa so so rang gis rig par bya ba ci zhig ltar yang dag par skyes na /
analyzed: mtshan ma mtha' dag spangs pa sgyu ma lta bu'i bdag nyid du snang ba'i blo rnam par mi rtog pa so so rang gis rig par bya ba ci zhig ltar yang dag par skyes na /
translated: The non-conceptual mind, which is the illusion-like nature that appears, is somehow perfectly generated as the object of individual self-awareness.

original: rnal 'byor pas shes bya'i sgrib pa yang dag par spong ngo //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas shes bya'i sgrib pa yang dag par spong ngo //
translated: The yogi perfectly abandons the obscurations to omniscience.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it were not so,

original: dus thams cad du nam mkha' rdzas med pa tsam gyi ngo bo 'dzin pa bzhin du bskyed du med pa dang spang du med pa'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i phyir skad cig ma'i chos shes pa tsam gyi ngo bo dang / shes bya'i mtshan nyid rnams gal te don dam par yod pa nyid du gyur na de'i tshe gnyen po bsgoms pas nam mkha' bzhin du de dag la cung zad kyang mi byed do //
analyzed: dus thams cad du nam mkha' rdzas med pa tsam gyi ngo bo 'dzin pa bzhin du bskyed du med pa dang spang du med pa'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i phyir skad cig ma'i chos shes pa tsam gyi ngo bo dang / shes bya'i mtshan nyid rnams gal te don dam par yod pa nyid du gyur na de'i tshe gnyen po bsgoms pas nam mkha' bzhin du de dag la cung zad kyang mi byed do //
translated: If the characteristics of the object of knowledge existed ultimately, then, just like space, they would not be affected in the least by the cultivation of the antidote.

original: de'i phyir gzhan dag gis dngos por mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ci log mi ldog pas bcom ldan 'das kyis shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa gang yin pa dang / chos rnams kyang yod par khas len pa gang yin pa de ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i don khas len pas kho bos ngo mthar du brtsis so zhes byas ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan dag gis dngos por mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ci log mi ldog pas bcom ldan 'das kyis shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa gang yin pa dang / chos rnams kyang yod par khas len pa gang yin pa de ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i don khas len pas kho bos ngo mthar du brtsis so zhes byas ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, since others cannot eliminate error because they cling to things, the fact that the Bhagavat has completely eliminated the obscurations to omniscience and still accepts the existence of phenomena is a matter of great wonder, for it is the acceptance of mutually exclusive objects.

original: de ltar yod pa'i phyogs bsal nas ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyogs brtan por mdzad pas thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis 'di kho na khas blangs bar bya'o zhes bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pas @125b gnas pa'i phyogs //🔽'di la bsal bya ci yang med //
analyzed: de ltar yod pa'i phyogs bsal nas ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyogs brtan por mdzad pas thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis 'di kho na khas blangs bar bya'o zhes bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pas @125b gnas pa'i phyogs // 'di la bsal bya ci yang med //
translated: This is the chapter’s summary verse.🔽There is nothing to be removed from this,

original: bzhag par bya ba cung zad med //
analyzed: bzhag par bya ba cung zad med //
translated: And not the slightest thing to be added.

original: yang dag nyid la yang dag lta /
analyzed: yang dag nyid la yang dag lta /
translated: The real is to be seen as real;

original: yang dag mthong nas rnam par grol //
analyzed: yang dag mthong nas rnam par grol //
translated: When it is seen as real, one is liberated.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what he says.

original: gang gi phyir dngos por mngon par zhen pa las grol bar mi 'thad pa de'i phyir chos gang la yang skur ba 'debs pa dang / sgro 'dogs pa'i ngo bos bsal ba dang bzhag pa ma byas par gzugs la sogs pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba kun rdzob tu yang dag par yod pa'i ngo bo 'di nyid la rang bzhin med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos por mngon par zhen pa las grol bar mi 'thad pa de'i phyir chos gang la yang skur ba 'debs pa dang / sgro 'dogs pa'i ngo bos bsal ba dang bzhag pa ma byas par gzugs la sogs pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba kun rdzob tu yang dag par yod pa'i ngo bo 'di nyid la rang bzhin med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor brtag par bya ste /
translated: Since it is not tenable that one be liberated from the manifest clinging to things, one should not remove or add anything to any phenomenon by way of deprecation or fabrication. One should analyze the nature of form and so on, which is dependently arisen and is real even conventionally, as being essenceless and so on.

original: de ltar na sgyu ma'i glang pos sgyu ma'i glang po gzhan zhig pham par byas pa bzhin du phyin ci log ldog pas de kho na nyid mthong na rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na sgyu ma'i glang pos sgyu ma'i glang po gzhan zhig pham par byas pa bzhin du phyin ci log ldog pas de kho na nyid mthong na rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, just as an illusory elephant defeats another illusory elephant, when one sees reality by reversing error, one will be liberated.

original: de ltar zhal la 'ongs pa brjod nas rnal ma mthong ba'i lam nyid //
analyzed: de ltar zhal la 'ongs pa brjod nas rnal ma mthong ba'i lam nyid //
translated: Having thus described the approach, the path of seeing itself is described.

original: sbyin pa la sogs re rer ni //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs re rer ni //
translated: Each of generosity and so on

original: de dag phan tshun bsdus pa gang //
analyzed: de dag phan tshun bsdus pa gang //
translated: is included in each other

original: skad cig gcig pa'i bzod pa yis //
analyzed: skad cig gcig pa'i bzod pa yis //
translated: and is included in the single moment of acceptance

original: bsdus pa de 'dir mthong ba'i lam //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag so sor sbyin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo re rer snga ma bzhin du phan tshun bsdus pa gang yin pa skad cig ma gcig sdug bsngal la chos shes pa bzod pas bsdus pa 'khor gsum
analyzed: bsdus pa de 'dir mthong ba'i lam // zhes bya ba gsungs te / sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag so sor sbyin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo re rer snga ma bzhin du phan tshun bsdus pa gang yin pa skad cig ma gcig sdug bsngal la chos shes pa bzod pas bsdus pa 'khor gsum
translated: that is included in the path of seeing.🔽Each of the six perfections such as generosity is included in each other, as before, in the essence of generosity and so on.

original: rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba rnams pa sum cu rtsa drug can skyes pa gang yin pa de ni //
analyzed: rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba rnams pa sum cu rtsa drug can skyes pa gang yin pa de ni //
translated: That which is included in the single moment of acceptance of the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering, which is distinguished by the purity of the three spheres,🔽which has thirty six aspects, is the path of seeing.

original: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'i 'drir mthong ba'i lam yin no //
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'i 'drir mthong ba'i lam yin no //
translated: The clear realization of the peak is the path of seeing.

original: de skyes pa na 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi dbye bas rnam par rtog pa bzhi po so sor rnam pa dgu nyid kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa brgya rtsa brgyad spangs pas //
analyzed: de skyes pa na 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi dbye bas rnam par rtog pa bzhi po so sor rnam pa dgu nyid kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa brgya rtsa brgyad spangs pas //
translated: When that is generated, by the division of the desire, form, and formless realms, the four conceptions are each of nine types, and the conceptions of apprehendeds and apprehenders are abandoned in a hundred and eight.

original: de dag gis bsdus pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed par byed pa'i bag chags kyi nyon mongs pa brgya rtsa brgyad spangs pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyis 'thob bo //
analyzed: de dag gis bsdus pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed par byed pa'i bag chags kyi nyon mongs pa brgya rtsa brgyad spangs pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyis 'thob bo //
translated: By the reality of dependent arising, the afflictions of the latent predispositions that generate the conceptions included in those are abandoned in a hundred and eight.

original: de la dbang du bya ba'i phyir de nyid yang dang yang du sgom par byed do zhes bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pas gsungs pa //🔽de nas seng ge rnam bsgyings pa'i //
analyzed: de la dbang du bya ba'i phyir de nyid yang dang yang du sgom par byed do zhes bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pas gsungs pa // de nas seng ge rnam bsgyings pa'i //
translated: In order to master that, one meditates again and again on just that. An intermediate verse is stated:🔽Then, having entered into the meditative stabilization

original: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms zhugs nas //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms zhugs nas //
translated: of the lion’s play,

original: rten cing 'brel 'byung lugs @126a * //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel 'byung lugs @126a * //
translated: one should contemplate the reality of dependent arising.

original: mthun dang // lugs mi mthun la rtog par byed //🔽ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: mthun dang // lugs mi mthun la rtog par byed // ces bya ba yin te /
translated: He contemplates the forward and reverse processes.

original: mthong ba'i lam 'thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa de nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin seng ga rnam par bskyings  pa la snyoms par zhugs nas /🔽dus phyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam 'thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa de nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin seng ga rnam par bskyings  pa la snyoms par zhugs nas / dus phyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams so //
translated: The yogi who has attained the path of seeing, because he is free from the fears of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, enters into the samadhi of the lion's play.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa lugs dang mthun pa dang / skye ba 'gags pas rga shi 'gag go zhes bya ba la sogs pa lugs dang mi mthun par yang dag par rtog go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa lugs dang mthun pa dang / skye ba 'gags pas rga shi 'gag go zhes bya ba la sogs pa lugs dang mi mthun par yang dag par rtog go //
translated: Later he contemplates the forward process of dependent origination, from the condition of ignorance, the compositional processes, and so on, and the reverse process, from the cessation of birth, the cessation of aging and death, and so on.

original: de ltar mthong pa'i lam brjod nas mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba la sogs pa ni rten grub pa sngon du 'gro ba yin na go sla bas rten bsgom pa'i lam /
analyzed: de ltar mthong pa'i lam brjod nas mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba la sogs pa ni rten grub pa sngon du 'gro ba yin na go sla bas rten bsgom pa'i lam /
translated: Having described the path of seeing, the abandonment of the opposing factors and so on are easy to understand if one has already established the basis, so the basis is the path of meditation.

original: 'gog dang bcas pa'i snyoms 'jug dgur //
analyzed: 'gog dang bcas pa'i snyoms 'jug dgur //
translated: The path of meditation is the repeated cultivation of the path of seeing.

original: rnam pa gnyis su song 'ongs nas //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su song 'ongs nas //
translated: Having gone and come in two ways,

original: 'dod par gtogs pa'i rnam par shes //🔽mnyam bzhag min pa'i mtshams bzung ste //
analyzed: 'dod par gtogs pa'i rnam par shes // mnyam bzhag min pa'i mtshams bzung ste //
translated: the consciousness belonging to the desire realm🔽is seized by the boundary of non-equipoise.

original: thod rgal du ni snyoms 'jug pa //
analyzed: thod rgal du ni snyoms 'jug pa //
translated: Alternating meditative attainment

original: gcig dang gnyis gsum bzhi dang lnga //
analyzed: gcig dang gnyis gsum bzhi dang lnga //
translated: is one, two, three, four, five,

original: drug dang bdun dang brgyad brgyal nas //
analyzed: drug dang bdun dang brgyad brgyal nas //
translated: six, seven, and eight,

original: 'gog pa'i bar du mi 'drar 'gro //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bar du mi 'drar 'gro //
translated: up to the different levels of cessation.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bsam gtan dang po nas bzung ste 'gog pa'i bar du song nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bsam gtan dang po nas bzung ste 'gog pa'i bar du song nas /
translated: The bodhisattvas, beginning with the first concentration up to cessation,

original: de'i 'og tu 'gog pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'gog pa nas bzung ste /
translated: after that, beginning with cessation

original: bsam gtan dang po'i bar du 'ongs te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i bar du 'ongs te /
translated: up to the first concentration.

original: de ltar lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs dang mi mthun pa rnam pa gnyis kyis /
analyzed: de ltar lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs dang mi mthun pa rnam pa gnyis kyis /
translated: In this way, in both the forward and reverse orders,

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med pa bzhi dang 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la song zhing 'ongs nas yang bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med pa bzhi dang 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la song zhing 'ongs nas yang bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: having gone and come in the nine meditative attainments characterized by the four concentrations, four formless states, and cessation, they again enter meditative attainment in the first concentration.

original: de las langs nas 'gog pa la'o //
analyzed: de las langs nas 'gog pa la'o //
translated: Then, having arisen from that, he enters meditative attainment in the state of cessation.

original: de bzhin du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar las 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar las 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: Similarly, he enters meditative attainment in the state of cessation from the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment.

original: de las langs nas de ma thag pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la dmigs te /
analyzed: de las langs nas de ma thag pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la dmigs te /
translated: Then, having arisen from that, he focuses on the meditative attainment that immediately precedes it.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par shes pa mtshams kyi ngo bor bzhag nas thabs mkhas pa'i stobs kyis langs te /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par shes pa mtshams kyi ngo bor bzhag nas thabs mkhas pa'i stobs kyis langs te /
translated: He establishes the consciousness of the desire realm as the threshold and, through the power of skill in means, he arises.

original: rnam par shes pa mnyam par ma @126b bzhag pa de lta bu de mngon du byas nas //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mnyam par ma @126b bzhag pa de lta bu de mngon du byas nas //
translated: Having actualized such a nonconcentrated consciousness,

original: de'i 'og tu 'gog pa la'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'gog pa la'o //
translated: he enters meditative attainment in the state of cessation.

original: de nas mnyam par ma bzhag pa la'o //
analyzed: de nas mnyam par ma bzhag pa la'o //
translated: Then, he enters meditative attainment in the nonconcentrated state.

original: de'i 'og tu 'gog pa gcig pu bor la 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'gog pa gcig pu bor la 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la'o //
translated: Then, having discarded the single state of cessation, he enters meditative attainment in the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment.

original: de nas mnyam par ma bzhag pa la'o //
analyzed: de nas mnyam par ma bzhag pa la'o //
translated: Then, he enters meditative attainment in the nonconcentrated state.

original: de nas gnyis por la ci yang med pa'i skye mched la'o //
analyzed: de nas gnyis por la ci yang med pa'i skye mched la'o //
translated: Then, having discarded the two, he enters meditative attainment in the base of nothingness.

original: de nas mnyam par ma bzhag pa la'o //
analyzed: de nas mnyam par ma bzhag pa la'o //
translated: Then, he enters meditative attainment in the nonconcentrated state.

original: de bzhin du brgyad kyi bar du bor nas bsam gtan dang po la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du brgyad kyi bar du bor nas bsam gtan dang po la'o //
translated: In the same way, skipping over eight, he enters the first meditation.

original: de nas mnyam par ma bzhag pa la'o //
analyzed: de nas mnyam par ma bzhag pa la'o //
translated: Then he enters the fourth meditation, and then he enters the attainment of cessation.

original: de ltar gcig la sogs pa por nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la thug pa'i bar du mi 'dra ba'i sgo nas 'gro bas na mi 'dra bar 'gro ba thod rgal gyi snyoms par 'jug pa la dbang ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid mngon sum du byed pas
analyzed: de ltar gcig la sogs pa por nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la thug pa'i bar du mi 'dra ba'i sgo nas 'gro bas na mi 'dra bar 'gro ba thod rgal gyi snyoms par 'jug pa la dbang ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid mngon sum du byed pas
translated: In this way, skipping over one stage, up to skipping over eight stages, he enters the attainment of cessation.

original: na bsgom pa'i lam yin no //
analyzed: na bsgom pa'i lam yin no //
translated: This is the path of cultivation.

original: de ltar bsgom pa'i lam brjod nas de la spang ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa bzhi brjod dgos pas /
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa'i lam brjod nas de la spang ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa bzhi brjod dgos pas /
translated: Having described the path of cultivation, he must describe the four types of counteragents to the factors to be eliminated on that path.

original: re zhig gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po /
analyzed: re zhig gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po /
translated: First, the conceptualization of the apprehended:🔽In brief, the conceptualization of the apprehended is one,

original: mdor bsdus rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyis //
analyzed: mdor bsdus rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyis //
translated: Because of not being grasped by the buddhas,🔽Because of not having qualities in the three times,

original: bstang bas yongs su ma bzung dang // dus gsum yon tan med pa dang // legs pa'i lam ni rnam gsum la //
analyzed: bstang bas yongs su ma bzung dang // dus gsum yon tan med pa dang // legs pa'i lam ni rnam gsum la //
translated: And because of the three good paths.

original: gzung ba'i rnam rtog 'di gcig ste //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam rtog 'di gcig ste //
translated: This is the first conceptualization of the apprehended.

original: sbyor ba'i rnam pa'i spyod yul can //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i rnam pa'i spyod yul can // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The domain of the aspects of the path of preparation.

original: mdor bsdus pa la dga' ba'i sems can rjes su 'dzin pas chos mdor bsdus pa dang / rgyas pa la dga' ba'i sems can rjes su 'dzin pas chos rgyas pa dang / ji skad bshad pa bzhin don la nan tan mi byed pas sangs rgyas kyis bstang ste yongs su ma bzung ba dang /
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa la dga' ba'i sems can rjes su 'dzin pas chos mdor bsdus pa dang / rgyas pa la dga' ba'i sems can rjes su 'dzin pas chos rgyas pa dang / ji skad bshad pa bzhin don la nan tan mi byed pas sangs rgyas kyis bstang ste yongs su ma bzung ba dang /
translated: The concise Dharma is for those who delight in concise teachings, the extensive Dharma is for those who delight in extensive teachings, the Dharma that is not fully grasped is for those who do not practice the meaning as it is explained.

original: byung ba 'gags pa nyid kyis sbyor ba'i lam gyi yon tan med pa dang / yang dag par skye ba'i rgyu dang mi ldan pas mthong ba'i lam gyi yon tan med pa dang / ma 'ongs pa med pa nyid kyis bsgom pa'i lam yon tan med pa dang /
analyzed: byung ba 'gags pa nyid kyis sbyor ba'i lam gyi yon tan med pa dang / yang dag par skye ba'i rgyu dang mi ldan pas mthong ba'i lam gyi yon tan med pa dang / ma 'ongs pa med pa nyid kyis bsgom pa'i lam yon tan med pa dang /
translated: The path of preparation lacks the qualities of the path of preparation because the arising of the past and future is blocked, the path of seeing lacks the qualities of the path of seeing because it lacks the cause of correct generation, the path of meditation lacks the qualities of the path of meditation because the future does not exist.

original: phyin ci log zhi ba nyid la sogs pas mya ngan las 'das par sbyor ba'i lam dang / stong pa nyid mngon par sgrub pa nyid kyis mthong ba'i lam dang / rang bzhin med par sgom par byed pa nyid kyis bsgom pa'i lam la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po gnas skabs 'dir spang @127a * //
analyzed: phyin ci log zhi ba nyid la sogs pas mya ngan las 'das par sbyor ba'i lam dang / stong pa nyid mngon par sgrub pa nyid kyis mthong ba'i lam dang / rang bzhin med par sgom par byed pa nyid kyis bsgom pa'i lam la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po gnas skabs 'dir spang @127a * //
translated: The path of preparation is the path that connects one to nirvana through the pacification of error and so on. The path of seeing is the path that is the direct establishment of emptiness. The path of meditation is the path that meditates on the absence of intrinsic existence. The first of the three types of conceptualization that apprehends the object is eliminated at this stage.

original: bar bya ba nyid kyis bsgom pa'i lam gyi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs kyi yul can rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: bar bya ba nyid kyis bsgom pa'i lam gyi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs kyi yul can rnam pa dgu'o //
translated: The nine types of subjective consciousness that are the objects of the stage of preparation of the path of meditation are to be eliminated.

original: de ltar dang po bstan nas gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa /
analyzed: de ltar dang po bstan nas gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa /
translated: Having taught the first, the second conceptualization that apprehends the object is taught.🔽The second is the object of engagement

original: gnyis pa sems dang sems byung rnams //🔽'jug pa'i yul can yin bzhed de //🔽sems mi skye dang byang chub kyi //
analyzed: gnyis pa sems dang sems byung rnams // 'jug pa'i yul can yin bzhed de // sems mi skye dang byang chub kyi //
translated: of the mind and mental factors.🔽The mind not arising, not attending to🔽the essence of enlightenment,

original: snying po yid la mi byed dang // theg pa dman pa yid byed dang // rdzogs pa'i byang pa'i byang chub yid mi byed //
analyzed: snying po yid la mi byed dang // theg pa dman pa yid byed dang // rdzogs pa'i byang pa'i byang chub yid mi byed //
translated: attending to the Hīnayāna, and not attending to the enlightenment of the complete yāna.

original: bsgom dang sgom pa med pa dang // de dag las ni bzlog nyid dang // ji bzhin don min rnam rtog pa //
analyzed: bsgom dang sgom pa med pa dang // de dag las ni bzlog nyid dang // ji bzhin don min rnam rtog pa //
translated: of a meaning that is not as it is

original: bsgom pa'i lam la shes par bya //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la shes par bya //
translated: should be understood on the path of meditation.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa dang bral bas byang chub kyi sems mi skye ba dang / sangs rgyas la dmigs pa'i bsod nams khyad par du 'phags pa med pas byang chub kyi snying po yid la mi byed pa dang / nyan thos kyi rigs can nyid kyi phyir de'i theg pa yid la byed pa dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa dang bral bas byang chub kyi sems mi skye ba dang / sangs rgyas la dmigs pa'i bsod nams khyad par du 'phags pa med pas byang chub kyi snying po yid la mi byed pa dang / nyan thos kyi rigs can nyid kyi phyir de'i theg pa yid la byed pa dang /
translated: Thus it is said.🔽The nonarising of the thought of awakening due to being separated from spiritual friends and so forth, the nonattention to the essence of awakening due to the absence of the superiority of merit focused on the Buddha, the attention to its vehicle due to being of the śrāvaka type,🔽the actualization of its vehicle due to being of the pratyekabuddha type, the nonattention to perfect awakening due to the nonestablishment of the perfection of wisdom, meditation due to being associated with reference points,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can nyid kyi phyir de'i theg pa mngon du byed pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa med pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yid la mi byed pa dang / dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis bsgom pa dang /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can nyid kyi phyir de'i theg pa mngon du byed pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa med pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yid la mi byed pa dang / dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis bsgom pa dang /
translated: and the opposite of those are the six branches of the path of meditation.

original: dmigs pa med pa nyid kyis bsgom pa med pa dang / dmigs pa yang med mi dmigs pa yang med pas sgom pa yang med sgom pa med pa yang ma yin pa dang / phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pas don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa nyid la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa nyid kyis bsgom pa med pa dang / dmigs pa yang med mi dmigs pa yang med pas sgom pa yang med sgom pa med pa yang ma yin pa dang / phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pas don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa nyid la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa /
translated: The second is the conceptualization of apprehending the object as it is not, due to mistaken adherence to the object.

original: gnas skabs de na spang bar bya ba nyid kyis bsgom pa'i lam gyi sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa'i gnas skabs kyi yul can rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs de na spang bar bya ba nyid kyis bsgom pa'i lam gyi sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa'i gnas skabs kyi yul can rnam pa dgu'o //
translated: The nine aspects of the subjective object of the path of cultivation are to be abandoned at that time, due to the engagement of the mind and mental factors.

original: de ltar gnyis pa bstan nas 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po //
analyzed: de ltar gnyis pa bstan nas 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po //
translated: Having thus taught the second, the first conceptualization of apprehending is taught:🔽The object-domain of sentient beings,

original: sems can btags pa'i spyod yul dang // chos btags pa dang stong min nyid //
analyzed: sems can btags pa'i spyod yul dang // chos btags pa dang stong min nyid //
translated: The conceptualization of phenomena, and non-emptiness,🔽Attachment, differentiation,🔽The nature of things, the three vehicles,🔽And the impurity of offerings,

original: chags dang rab 'byed bdag nyid dang // dngos por byed dang theg gsum dang // yon ni dag pa ma yin dang // spyod pa rnam par 'khrugs pa la //
analyzed: chags dang rab 'byed bdag nyid dang // dngos por byed dang theg gsum dang // yon ni dag pa ma yin dang // spyod pa rnam par 'khrugs pa la //
translated: And the disturbance of conduct.

original: 'dzin par byed pa dang por de //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa dang por de //
translated: The first is the apprehender.

original: shes par @127b bya ba bsgrags pa yin //
analyzed: shes par @127b bya ba bsgrags pa yin //
translated: It is proclaimed to be the knower.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽rdzas su yod par mi skye bas sems can du btags pa dang / snang ba cam du zad pa'i phyir chos su btags pa dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos stong pa ma yin pa nyid dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te / rdzas su yod par mi skye bas sems can du btags pa dang / snang ba cam du zad pa'i phyir chos su btags pa dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos stong pa ma yin pa nyid dang /
translated: It is said:🔽Since it does not arise as substantially existent, it is designated as sentient beings. Since it is merely appearance, it is designated as phenomena. Since it pervades everything, it is not empty of phenomena such as omniscience.

original: rnam pa thams cad du mngon par zhen pa ma spangs pas chos la chags pa dang / ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pas chos rab tu 'byed pa dang / ched du bya ba mi byed pas dngos po'i ched du bya ba byed pa dang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du mngon par zhen pa ma spangs pas chos la chags pa dang / ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pas chos rab tu 'byed pa dang / ched du bya ba mi byed pas dngos po'i ched du bya ba byed pa dang /
translated: Since it does not abandon clinging to all aspects, it is attachment to phenomena. Since it realizes the lack of entity, it is the discernment of phenomena. Since it does not perform its function, it performs the function of the entity.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la mi dmigs pa'i phyir theg pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung ba dang / yang dag par rab tu ma zhugs pa nyid kyis yon ma dag pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs par dmigs te bsgrubs pas spyod pa rnam par 'khrugs pa la snga ma bzhin du 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa bsgom pa'i lam gyi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs kyi yul can rnam pa dgu'o /🔽// / bam po lnga pa /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la mi dmigs pa'i phyir theg pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung ba dang / yang dag par rab tu ma zhugs pa nyid kyis yon ma dag pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs par dmigs te bsgrubs pas spyod pa rnam par 'khrugs pa la snga ma bzhin du 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa bsgom pa'i lam gyi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs kyi yul can rnam pa dgu'o / // / bam po lnga pa /
translated: Thus, there are nine types of subjects that are objects of the path of meditation that are aspects of the conception of grasping.

original: de ltar dang po bstan nas 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa /🔽sems can btags dang de rgyu yi //
analyzed: de ltar dang po bstan nas 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa / sems can btags dang de rgyu yi //
translated: Having explained the first, the second conception of grasping is taught.🔽The subject that is the cause of🔽the imputation of sentient beings

original: yul can de yis rnam 'joms pas //
analyzed: yul can de yis rnam 'joms pas //
translated: is destroyed by that

original: bsgom pa'i lam dang 'brel pa yis //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam dang 'brel pa yis //
translated: and is connected to the path of meditation.

original: mi mthun phyogs gzhan rnam pa dgu //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs gzhan rnam pa dgu //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The discordant class is the other nine types.🔽The subject that is the cause of the imputation of sentient beings is destroyed by that, and is connected to the path of meditation.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa sems can du btags pa dang / der rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu snang ba tsam gyi yul can bsgom pa'i lam gyis yang dag par spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir de dang 'brel pa rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa sems can du btags pa dang / der rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu snang ba tsam gyi yul can bsgom pa'i lam gyis yang dag par spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir de dang 'brel pa rnam pa dgu'o //
translated: The second kind of conceptual thought, which apprehends the adverse side, is the imputation of sentient beings and the cause for its establishment is the object of the path of meditation, which is the mere appearance of the subject.

original: ji ltar rnam pa dgu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa dgu yin zhe na /
translated: How is it ninefold?

original: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa rnam pa gnyis kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa rnam pa gnyis kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Two verses in the middle explain:

original: bdag nyid ji bzhin kun mkhyen ni //
analyzed: bdag nyid ji bzhin kun mkhyen ni //
translated: The Omniscience of the Tathāgatas is like the self,🔽the three obscurations of the three vehicles,🔽the path of peace, suchness, and so on,🔽the associated and unassociated,🔽the unequaled, suffering, and so on,

original: gsum gyi sgrib pa rnam gsum dang // zhi lam de bzhin nyid sogs dang // mtshungs par ldan dang mi ldan dang // mi mnyam sdug bsngal la sogs dang // nyon mongs rnams kyi rang bzhin dang // gnyis su med la kun rmongs la //
analyzed: gsum gyi sgrib pa rnam gsum dang // zhi lam de bzhin nyid sogs dang // mtshungs par ldan dang mi ldan dang // mi mnyam sdug bsngal la sogs dang // nyon mongs rnams kyi rang bzhin dang // gnyis su med la kun rmongs la //
translated: the nature of the afflictions,🔽and the confusion about nonduality

original: rnam par rtog pa tha mar bzhed //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa tha mar bzhed //
translated: is considered the final conceptual thought.

original: ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba yin te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: rnam pa thams cad yongs su ma shes pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi @128a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad yongs su ma shes pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi @128a * //
translated: Being ignorant of all aspects, one is confused about the obscurations to omniscience.🔽Being ignorant of all paths, one is confused about the obscurations to the knowledge of the path.

original: sgrib pa la kun du rmongs pa dang / lam thams cad yongs su ma shes pas lam shes pa nyid kyi sgrib pa la kun du rmongs pa dang / gzhi thams cad yongs su ma shes pas thams cad shes pas thams cad shes pa nyid kyi sgrib pa la kun du rmongs pa dang /
analyzed: sgrib pa la kun du rmongs pa dang / lam thams cad yongs su ma shes pas lam shes pa nyid kyi sgrib pa la kun du rmongs pa dang / gzhi thams cad yongs su ma shes pas thams cad shes pas thams cad shes pa nyid kyi sgrib pa la kun du rmongs pa dang /
translated: Being ignorant of all bases, one is confused about the obscurations to the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Being ignorant of the perfection of wisdom, one is confused about the path of the pacification of all.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su ma shes pas thams cad zhi ba'i lam la kun du rmongs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i shes bya dang / de bzhin nyid dag yongs su ma shes pas de bzhin nyid la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang mi ldan pa la kun du rmongs pa dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su ma shes pas thams cad zhi ba'i lam la kun du rmongs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i shes bya dang / de bzhin nyid dag yongs su ma shes pas de bzhin nyid la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang mi ldan pa la kun du rmongs pa dang /
translated: Being ignorant of objects of knowledge such as form and suchness, one is confused about suchness and so on, being associated with or not being associated with it.

original: bdud la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su ma shes pas mi mnyam pa nyid la kun du rmongs pa dang / don la sgra ji bzhin du 'dzin pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa la kun du rmongs pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma shes pas nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin la kun du rmongs pa dang /
analyzed: bdud la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su ma shes pas mi mnyam pa nyid la kun du rmongs pa dang / don la sgra ji bzhin du 'dzin pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa la kun du rmongs pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma shes pas nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin la kun du rmongs pa dang /
translated: Since they do not fully understand the nature of demons and so on, they are confused about the unequaled. Since they apprehend the meaning literally, they are confused about the truth of suffering and so on. Since they do not fully understand the nature of attachment and so on, they are confused about the nature of affliction.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su ma shes pas gnyis su med pa la kun du rmongs pa la /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su ma shes pas gnyis su med pa la kun du rmongs pa la /
translated: Since they do not fully understand the characteristics of apprehended objects and the apprehending mind, they are confused about nonduality.

original: snga ma bzhin du 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa tha ma bsgom pa'i lam gyi sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa'i gnas skabs kyi yul can rnam pa dgur bzhed pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa tha ma bsgom pa'i lam gyi sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa'i gnas skabs kyi yul can rnam pa dgur bzhed pa yin no //
translated: It is asserted that the first three of these nine types of object are the domain of the path of seeing, while the latter six are the domain of the path of cultivation.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi mi mthun phyogs rnam pa bzhi po de dag spang ba nyid du gnyen po rnam pa bzhi yang de'i dbye bas tha dad do zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi mi mthun phyogs rnam pa bzhi po de dag spang ba nyid du gnyen po rnam pa bzhi yang de'i dbye bas tha dad do zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the four remedies are also differentiated by their subdivisions, in order to abandon those four kinds of adverse circumstances on the path of cultivation.

original: snga ma bzhin du rnam par rtog pa brgya rtsa brgyad spangs ba dang dus mnyam pa kho nar de dag gis bsdus pa nyon mongs pa brgya rtsa brgyad spangs pas yon tan phun sum tshogs pa thams cad byang chub sems dpa' bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa la
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rnam par rtog pa brgya rtsa brgyad spangs ba dang dus mnyam pa kho nar de dag gis bsdus pa nyon mongs pa brgya rtsa brgyad spangs pas yon tan phun sum tshogs pa thams cad byang chub sems dpa' bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa la
translated: Just as before, the bodhisattva who is on the path of cultivation obtains all the perfections of good qualities by abandoning the one hundred and eight conceptualizations and, at the same time, by abandoning the one hundred and eight afflictions included in them.

original: rten to zhes bya ba bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa ngag gis gsungs pa /🔽yams nad 'di rnams zad nas ni //
analyzed: rten to zhes bya ba bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa ngag gis gsungs pa / yams nad 'di rnams zad nas ni //
translated: The verse in the middle of the chapter is stated by the Bhagavān in order to teach that.🔽Just as, after the end of a plague,

original: yun rings lon nas dbugs phyin ltar //
analyzed: yun rings lon nas dbugs phyin ltar //
translated: after a long time, there is relief,

original: rnam pa kun du 'gro ba yi //
analyzed: rnam pa kun du 'gro ba yi //
translated: so, in every way,

original: bde sgrub yon tan phun tshogs kun //
analyzed: bde sgrub yon tan phun tshogs kun //
translated: all the perfections of good qualities for attaining happiness

original: rgya mtsho che la chu bo bzhin //
analyzed: rgya mtsho che la chu bo bzhin //
translated: are like the great ocean for the four rivers.🔽The bodhisattva who is on the path of cultivation

original: 'bras bu mchog gis sba ba yi //
analyzed: 'bras bu mchog gis sba ba yi //
translated: obtains all the perfections of good qualities by abandoning the one hundred and eight conceptualizations and, at the same time, by abandoning the one hundred and eight afflictions included in them.

original: sems dpa' chen po de la ni //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po de la ni //
translated: For the great being,🔽

original: rnam pa kun du rten par byed //
analyzed: rnam pa kun du rten par byed //
translated: The great beings always rely on them.

original: ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba yin te /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: @128b bsgom pa'i lam la goms pas rnam par rtog pa'i rigs bzhi po 'tshe bar byed pa nyid kyis yams kyi nad du gyur pa 'di rnams zad nas gags byed pa med pas dga' bas dbugs phyin pa thob pa bzhin du /
analyzed: @128b bsgom pa'i lam la goms pas rnam par rtog pa'i rigs bzhi po 'tshe bar byed pa nyid kyis yams kyi nad du gyur pa 'di rnams zad nas gags byed pa med pas dga' bas dbugs phyin pa thob pa bzhin du /
translated: On the path of cultivation, through familiarity, the four types of conceptuality, which are like a plague, are exhausted by their very harmfulness. Since there is no obstruction, one obtains relief, as if from relief from a plague.

original: snying rjes gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pas rnam pa thams cad du 'gro ba'i bde ba bskyed par mkhas pa'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa theg pa gsum gyis bsdus pa thams cad rgya mtsho chen po la chu bo dag bzhin du /
analyzed: snying rjes gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pas rnam pa thams cad du 'gro ba'i bde ba bskyed par mkhas pa'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa theg pa gsum gyis bsdus pa thams cad rgya mtsho chen po la chu bo dag bzhin du /
translated: Through compassion, one becomes subject to others and becomes skilled in generating the happiness of all beings. All the abundant qualities of the excellent qualities of the three vehicles are like rivers in the great ocean.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa 'bras bu rab kyi mthar phyin pa thob pa de dag gis mdzes par gyur ba la rnam pa thams cad mngon du 'ong pa'i rnam pas rten par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa 'bras bu rab kyi mthar phyin pa thob pa de dag gis mdzes par gyur ba la rnam pa thams cad mngon du 'ong pa'i rnam pas rten par byed do //
translated: The bodhisattvas who abide on the path of cultivation, who have attained the culmination of the supreme result, are beautified by them. They rely on them with the aspect of all aspects being manifest.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi rjes la bar chad med pa'i lam yin pas /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi rjes la bar chad med pa'i lam yin pas /
translated: Since it is the uninterrupted path subsequent to the path of meditation,

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin //
translated: it is the uninterrupted concentration.🔽The merit of establishing the beings of the three realms🔽in the realization of the sravakas,

original: stong gsum skye bo nyan thos dang // bse ru'i rtogs pa phun tshogs dang // byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med la //
analyzed: stong gsum skye bo nyan thos dang // bse ru'i rtogs pa phun tshogs dang // byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med la //

original: bkod pa'i dge ba dper mdzad nas //
analyzed: bkod pa'i dge ba dper mdzad nas //

analyzed: bsod nams mang po nyid kyis ni // sangs rgyas nyid kyi bar med de //

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin //

analyzed: de ni rnam pa kun mkhyen nyid //
translated: is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.🔽Some people establish the sentient beings of the three-thousandfold🔽great-one thousandfold world systems in the realizations of the sravakas,

original: 'ga' zhig gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la bkod nas /

original: bsod nams skyed pa gang yin pa de dper mdzad nas de bas khyad par du 'phags par bsod nams mang ba nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen ba nyid gang yin pa de sangs rgyas nyid yin pas sangs rgyas nyid 'thob pa'i bar chad med pa'i ting nge
analyzed: bsod nams skyed pa gang yin pa de dper mdzad nas de bas khyad par du 'phags par bsod nams mang ba nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen ba nyid gang yin pa de sangs rgyas nyid yin pas sangs rgyas nyid 'thob pa'i bar chad med pa'i ting nge
translated: Having exemplified the generation of merit, since omniscience is even more exalted and has much more merit than that, it is buddhahood.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid mi 'thad pas sgom pa la /🔽skye bo byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa mi shes pa'i rab tu smra ba nyid thams cad kyi log par rtogs pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i don bsgrubs pas mi 'thad pa nyid kyis the tshom gyi ngo bo ji skad bshad pa'i yul can nyid kyis rnam
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid mi 'thad pas sgom pa la / skye bo byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa mi shes pa'i rab tu smra ba nyid thams cad kyi log par rtogs pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i don bsgrubs pas mi 'thad pa nyid kyis the tshom gyi ngo bo ji skad bshad pa'i yul can nyid kyis rnam
translated: (4) The misconception of cultivation, since the characteristics of the general and specific are not tenable.

original: pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rten can log par rtog pa bcu drug go //
analyzed: pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rten can log par rtog pa bcu drug go //
translated: The sixteen misconceptions are the bases of the omniscience of all aspects, since they are the objects of doubt, which is the nature of the misconceptions of all beings who do not know the skill in means of bodhisattvas, since they are established as objects that are mutually contradictory.

original: de bas na kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i sgo can gyi klan ka la go rims bzhin du don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi sgo nas lan gdab dgos pas /
analyzed: de bas na kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i sgo can gyi klan ka la go rims bzhin du don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi sgo nas lan gdab dgos pas /
translated: Therefore, one should answer objections from the standpoint of the two truths in accordance with the order of the two truths.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dge ba 'dod pa rnams kyis bden pa gnyis ka la rten pa'i thabs la mkhas pas rnam pa stong du bsal ba sngon du 'gro ba'i nges pa rnam pa thams cad du yang dag par bskyed nas bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bskyed🔽par bya'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyi pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dge ba 'dod pa rnams kyis bden pa gnyis ka la rten pa'i thabs la mkhas pas rnam pa stong du bsal ba sngon du 'gro ba'i nges pa rnam pa thams cad du yang dag par bskyed nas bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bskyed par bya'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyi pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan zhes bya ba las /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who desires virtue should generate the uninterrupted meditative stabilization, having first generated certainty in all aspects by means of the skill in means which is based on the two truths.

original: skabs lnga ba'i 'grel ba'o /
analyzed: skabs lnga ba'i 'grel ba'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the fifth chapter of the treatise, the Ornament of Clear Realization, Instructions on the Perfection of Wisdom, called “The Stabilizations.”

original: // / rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa thob pa so so ba dang bsdus pa nyid du rtogs pa'i don rnams go rims bzhin du blags nas brtan por bya ba'i phyir rnam par sgom par byed bas mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa /
analyzed: // / rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa thob pa so so ba dang bsdus pa nyid du rtogs pa'i don rnams go rims bzhin du blags nas brtan por bya ba'i phyir rnam par sgom par byed bas mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa /
translated: The serial clear realization is the serial realization of the individual and combined realizations of the peak, in order to stabilize them by cultivating them.

original: sbyin pa shes rab bar dag dang // sangs rgyas la sogs dran dang chos //
analyzed: sbyin pa shes rab bar dag dang // sangs rgyas la sogs dran dang chos //
translated: Giving, wisdom, and so on, and mindfulness of the Buddha and so on,

original: dngos med ngo bo nyid kyis de //🔽mthar gyis pa yi bya bar bzhed //
analyzed: dngos med ngo bo nyid kyis de // mthar gyis pa yi bya bar bzhed //
translated: are nonthings by nature.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /🔽pha rol tu phyin pa bzhin ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te / pha rol tu phyin pa bzhin ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir /
translated: They are asserted to be the serial practice.🔽Giving, the perfection of wisdom, and so on, are asserted to be the serial practice.🔽The six perfections are fully accomplished on the ten grounds by completely perfecting the six perfections, such as the perfection of generosity, which are distinguished by the purity of the three spheres.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa 'khor gsum rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba drug rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs pas sa bcu yang dag par sgrub par byed pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa 'khor gsum rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba drug rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs pas sa bcu yang dag par sgrub par byed pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa dang /
translated: The four establishments of mindfulness and so on,

original: byang chub kyi yan @130a * //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan @130a * //
translated: The branches of enlightenment

original: lag gi rna ba dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: lag gi rna ba dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste /
translated: and the noble eightfold path.

original: don dam par dran pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa rnam pa gsum po //
analyzed: don dam par dran pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa rnam pa gsum po //
translated: The three kinds of recollection of the Buddha, which are in the ultimate sense characterized by absence of recollection,🔽are respectively described as the factors conducive to insight, the path of seeing and the path of meditation.

original: go rims bzhin du nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam rjod par byed ba dang / de bzhin du dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rjes su dran pa dang / snga ma bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa phyir mi ldog pa'i dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam rjod par byed ba dang / de bzhin du dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rjes su dran pa dang / snga ma bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa phyir mi ldog pa'i dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang /
translated: Similarly, there is recollection of virtuous, nonvirtuous and ethically neutral phenomena, and, as before, recollection of the noble Sangha of Bodhisattvas who are irreversible.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / gtong ba dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du khong du chud pas rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir mthar gyis pa'i bya bar bzhed pa yin no //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / gtong ba dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du khong du chud pas rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir mthar gyis pa'i bya bar bzhed pa yin no // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan zhes bya ba las /
translated: Similarly, the realization that comes from comprehending that all phenomena, such as morality, generosity, the recollection of the Buddha, and form, are the nature of non-entityness is considered here to be the activity of the serial.

original: skabs drug pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: skabs drug pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the sixth chapter, the chapter on serial training, from Ornament of Realization: A Treatise on the Pāramitāyāna.

original: // / mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa rnam par bsgoms pa ni shin tu goms par bya ba'i phyir de dag nyid skad cig ma gcig gis bsgoms pas skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yin te /
analyzed: // / mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa rnam par bsgoms pa ni shin tu goms par bya ba'i phyir de dag nyid skad cig ma gcig gis bsgoms pas skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yin te /
translated: The serial realization that has been cultivated is cultivated in a single instant in order to become very familiar with it. Thus, it is the single-instant complete enlightenment.

original: de yang mtshan nyid kyis rnam pa bzhi yod pas /
analyzed: de yang mtshan nyid kyis rnam pa bzhi yod pas /
translated: That also has four aspects by way of its characteristics.

original: dang po rnam par smin pa ma yin pa zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad skad cig ma gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa /
analyzed: dang po rnam par smin pa ma yin pa zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad skad cig ma gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa /
translated: First, the non-matured, uncontaminated phenomena are the single moment of the single moment of complete enlightenment.

original: sbyin pa la sogs re res kyang //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs re res kyang //
translated: Because each of generosity and so on

original: zag med chos kun bsdus pa'i phyir //
analyzed: zag med chos kun bsdus pa'i phyir //
translated: comprises all uncontaminated phenomena,

original: thub pa'i skad cig gcig pa yi //🔽rtogs pa 'di ni shes par bya //
analyzed: thub pa'i skad cig gcig pa yi // rtogs pa 'di ni shes par bya //
translated: the single moment of the Muni

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: is to be understood as the realization of this.

original: lugs las chos kyi dbyings kyi rang gi ngo bor /🔽dngos gcig dngos po kun gyi ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: lugs las chos kyi dbyings kyi rang gi ngo bor / dngos gcig dngos po kun gyi ngo bo nyid //
translated: This is stated because in the system of the perfection of wisdom, the nature of the dharmadhatu🔽is the nature of all things,

original: dngos kun dngos po gcig gi ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: dngos kun dngos po gcig gi ngo bo nyid //
translated: the nature of all things is the nature of one thing,

original: gang gis dngos gcig de bzhin nyid mthong ba //
analyzed: gang gis dngos gcig de bzhin nyid mthong ba //
translated: one who sees the suchness of one thing

original: de yis dngos kun de bzhin nyid du mthong //🔽zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de yis dngos kun de bzhin nyid du mthong // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: sees the suchness of all things.🔽This is stated in the perfection of wisdom sutras.

original: mang pos gcig bsdus pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: mang pos gcig bsdus pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is the one subsumed by the many,

original: 'on kyang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i ye shes dmigs par bya ba'i skad cig ma gcig po dngos po so sor nges par 'dzin pa'i phyin ci log @130b dang bral ba'i ngo bos /
analyzed: 'on kyang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i ye shes dmigs par bya ba'i skad cig ma gcig po dngos po so sor nges par 'dzin pa'i phyin ci log @130b dang bral ba'i ngo bos /
translated: However, the single moment of transcendent wisdom that focuses on generosity and so on, by the nature of being free from error in apprehending the individual characteristics of things,

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa nas dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar gyi mtshan nyid kyi chos rnams bsdus pa'i phyir thub pa byang chub sems dpa'i rtogs pa ni skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa nas dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar gyi mtshan nyid kyi chos rnams bsdus pa'i phyir thub pa byang chub sems dpa'i rtogs pa ni skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
translated: comprises all phenomena characterized by generosity and so on up to the eighty minor marks. Therefore the realization of the Sage, the bodhisattva, is the complete enlightenment of a single moment.

original: zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: This is how it should be understood.

original: yang ji ltar na zag pa med pa'i ye shes gcig dmigs na zag pa med pa thams cad bsdus pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na zag pa med pa'i ye shes gcig dmigs na zag pa med pa thams cad bsdus pa yin zhe na /
translated: Again, how is it that when one uncontaminated transcendent wisdom is focused on, all uncontaminated states are included?

original: 'jig rten pa'i dpe /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dpe /
translated: The mundane example:

original: ji ltar skyes bus zo chun rgyud //
analyzed: ji ltar skyes bus zo chun rgyud //
translated: Just as a person moves a chain

original: rdog thabs gcig gis bskyod pa na //
analyzed: rdog thabs gcig gis bskyod pa na //
translated: with a single kick,

original: thams cad cig car 'gul ba ltar //
analyzed: thams cad cig car 'gul ba ltar //
translated: and all links move simultaneously,

original: skad cig gcig shes de bzhin no //
analyzed: skad cig gcig shes de bzhin no //
translated: so it is with the knowledge of one moment.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.

original: dper na skyes bus rdog thabs gcig gis bskyod na bzo bo mkhas pas sngon bzo legs par byas pa'i mthus zo chun gyi rgyud thams cad cig car dus gcig tu 'gul ba de bzhin du sngon gyi smon lam gyi 'phen pa dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi mthus skad cig ma gcig kho na la /
analyzed: dper na skyes bus rdog thabs gcig gis bskyod na bzo bo mkhas pas sngon bzo legs par byas pa'i mthus zo chun gyi rgyud thams cad cig car dus gcig tu 'gul ba de bzhin du sngon gyi smon lam gyi 'phen pa dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi mthus skad cig ma gcig kho na la /
translated: For example, when a person moves a waterwheel with a single foot, due to the previous excellent construction of the artisan, the entire series of waterwheels moves simultaneously at the same time.

original: zag pa med pa'i ye shes gcig dmigs na rigs mthun pa thams cad mngon du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i ye shes gcig dmigs na rigs mthun pa thams cad mngon du byed pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, when a single uncontaminated transcendent wisdom is focused on in a single moment alone due to the impetus of previous aspirations and the power of the dharmadhatu, all similar types are actualized.

original: de ltar dang po bstan nas gnyis pa rnam par smin pa'i chos nyid kyi gnas skabs kyi zag pa med par chos thams cad skad cig ma gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa /
analyzed: de ltar dang po bstan nas gnyis pa rnam par smin pa'i chos nyid kyi gnas skabs kyi zag pa med par chos thams cad skad cig ma gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa /
translated: Having explained the first, the second is the single moment of manifest complete enlightenment with the characteristic of a single moment of all phenomena in the uncontaminated state of the occasion of the reality of karmic maturation.

original: gang tshe chos dkar thams cad kyi //
analyzed: gang tshe chos dkar thams cad kyi //
translated: When all virtuous phenomena

original: rang bzhin shes rab pha rol phyin //
analyzed: rang bzhin shes rab pha rol phyin //
translated: are the nature of transcendent wisdom,

original: rnam smin chos nyid gnas skabs skyes //
analyzed: rnam smin chos nyid gnas skabs skyes //
translated: they are born in the occasion of the reality of karmic maturation.
